description: TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.J. RES. 240, THE RESOLUTION STATING CONGRESS' APPROVAL OF CERTAIN INTERNATIONAL FISHERY AGREEMENTS NEGOTIATED WITH FOREIGN COUNTRIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FISHERY CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT ACT OF 1976.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 252, A RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE COMMITTEE ON STANDARDS OF OFFICIAL  CONDUCT TO DETERMINE WHETHER MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE OR THEIR IMMEDIATE FAMILY OR ASSOCIATES HAVE ACCEPTED ANYTHING OF VALUE FROM THE SOUTH KOREAN GOVERNMENT OR ITS REPRESENTATIVES.

TO AGREE TO A SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR THE SHUSTER AMENDMENT (SEE RC 29) TO H.R. 11.  THE  EDGAR AMENDMENT WOULD ALLOCATE 65% OF THE FUNDS TO ALL STATES BASED ON AVERAGE NUMBER OF UNEMPLOYED, AND 35% TO STATES WHOSE AVERAGE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE IS 6.5%+.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 3753, THE BILL BRINGING CERTAIN GOVERNING INTERNATIONAL FISHERY AGREEMENTS WITHIN THE PURVIEW OF THE FISHERY CONSERVATION ZONE TRANSITION ACT.
TO AMEND H. RES. 287 BY STRIKING TITLE 3.  TITLE 3 CONTAINS LANGUAGE PROHIBITING THE MAINTENANCE OF UNOFFICIAL OFFICE ACCOUNTS TO DEFRAY CONGRESSIONAL OFFICE EXPENSES.

TO AMEND A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3839, THE BILL TO RESCIND CERTAIN BUDGET AUTHORITY  RECOMMENDED IN THE PRESIDENTIAL MESSAGE OF JAN. 17, 1977.  THE CHAPPELL AMENDMENT WOULD RESTORE $81.6 MILLION IN FUNDS FOR THE LONG-LEAD FUNDING OF A NIMITZ-CLASS NUCLEAR CARRIER.

TO AMEND A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3839 (SEE RC 42). THE BENNETT AMENDMENT WOULD RESTORE  $371 MILLION IN FUNDS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF AN AEGIS ANTI-AIRCRAFT SYSTEM ON BOARD THE NUCLEAR VESSEL THE USS LONG BEACH.

TO AGREE TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3477 THAT WOULD PHASE OUT THE 1976 TAX REBATE  FOR PERSONS ANNUALLY EARNING $25,000+ AND WOULD GRANT $50 PAYMENTS TO RECIPIENTS OF BLACK LUNG BENEFITS, AID FOR DEPENDENT CHILDREN, AND VETERANS COMPENSATION.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 3477 TO THE COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT IT BACK WITH A SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT THAT WOULD REDUCE THE LOWER BRACKET TAX RATES FOR A TWO YEAR PERIOD RATHER THAN PROVIDE FOR $50 TAX REBATES.

TO RECOMMIT H. RES. 357, A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY, TO THE COMMITTEE ON HOUSE ADMINISTRATION WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT IT BACK WITH A SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT THAT WOULD LIMIT FUNDS FOR INTERNAL SECURITY INVESTIGATIONS TO $300,000.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 388, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 3843, A BILL AUTHORIZING ADDITIONAL FUNDS FOR LOW AND MODERATE INCOME HOUSING ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS, AND EXTENDING HUD RIOT AND CRIME INSURANCE PROGRAMS.  H.R. 3843 ALSO ESTABLISHES A NATIONAL COMMISSION ON NEIGHBORHOODS.

TO AMEND THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 1746, A BILL TO AMEND THE UNITED NATIONS PARTICIPATION  ACT OF 1945 SO AS TO HALT U.S. IMPORTATION OF RHODESIAN CHROME.  THE BAUMAN AMENDMENT PROHIBITS CHROME IMPORTS FROM ANY COUNTRY THAT HAS NOT COMPLIED WITH THE HUMAN RIGHTS PROVISIONS OF THE UNITED NATIONS CHARTER.

TO AMEND THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 1746 BY DELAYING FOR THIRTY DAYS THE EFFECTIVE  DATE OF THE BILL AND REQUIRING THAT THE PRESIDENT REPORT TO CONGRESS ON THE STATUS OF NEGOTIATIONS WITH THE RHODESIAN GOVERNMENT.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 404, A RESOLUTION FOR THE IMMEDIATE COMMENCEMENT OF A 90 DAY TRIAL  PERIOD OF AUDIO COVERAGE OF DAILY HOUSE PROCEEDINGS.  THE RESOLUTION PROVIDES FOR A LATER EVALUATION OF THE TRIAL PERIOD BY THE HOUSE RULES COMMITTEE.

TO MODIFY AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4877 BY APPROPRIATING AN ADDITIONAL $200 MILLION  FOR THE EMERGENCY ENERGY-FUEL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, PROVIDED THAT THE EXTRA FUNDS WILL NOT BE EXPENDED FOR ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 411, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 4800, A BILL EXTENDING THE EMERGENCY UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION ACT OF 1974 THROUGH MAR. 1978 AND REVISING ITS TRIGGER PROVISIONS.

TO AMEND THE SARASIN AMENDMENT OFFERED AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE QUIE AMENDMENT IN THE  NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO H.R. 4250.  THE ASHBROOK AMENDMENT LIMITS THE AUTHORITY OF A UNION TO INDUCE ANY PERSON TO STRIKE OR TO REFUSE TO WORK AT THE SITE OF A CONSTRUCTION, THEREBY PROTECTING FROM INVOLVEMENT THE EMPLOYER WHO IS NOT PRIMARILY INVOLVED IN THE CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY.

TO AMEND THE SARASIN AMENDMENT OFFERED AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE QUIE AMENDMENT IN THE  NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO H.R. 4250.  THE QUIE AMENDMENT PROPOSES CONFINING SITUS PICKETING TO THE PROJECT WHERE THE LABOR DISPUTE ARISES, SO THAT ONLY THOSE EMPLOYERS WITH DIRECT CONTRACTUAL RELATIONSHIPS AS CONTRACTORS OR SUBCONTRACTORS CAN BE STRUCK.

TO AMEND THE SARASIN AMENDMENT OFFERED AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE QUIE AMENDMENT IN THE  NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO H.R. 4250.  THIS AMENDMENT EXEMPTS FROM THE DEFINITION OF "SITE" THOSE SITES RAISING RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS OF THREE STORIES OR LESS.

TO AMEND THE SARASIN AMENDMENT OFFERED AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE QUIE AMENDMENT IN THE  NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO H.R. 4250.  THE EDWARDS AMENDMENT WOULD REQUIRE A VOTE  OF APPROVAL BY SECRET BALLOT BY THE AFFECTED WORKERS IN ORDER TO AUTHORIZE UNION COMMON SITUS ACTION.

TO AGREE TO THE MODIFIED SARASIN AMENDMENT OFFERED AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE QUIE  AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 4250.  THE MODIFIED SARASIN AMENDMENT CONTAINS THE MAJOR LANGUAGE OF H.R. 5900, A PIECE OF PICKETING LEGISLATION THAT WAS VETOED BY THE 94TH CONGRESS. H.R. 4250.

TO PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 3965, A BILL AUTHORIZING $85 MILLION TO THE FEDERAL  AVIATION ADMINISTRATION (FAA) FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.  THE APPROPRIATED MONIES ARE FOR RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT AND DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS RELATED TO AVIATION.

TO PASS H. RES. 420, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A SELECT COMMITTEE ON CONGRESSIONAL  OPERATIONS WHICH SHALL BE COMPOSED OF SEVEN MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE AND SHALL REPLACE THE JOINT COMMITTEE ON CONGRESSIONAL OPERATIONS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENTS  TO H.R. 5045, THE REORGANIZATION ACT OF 1977.  THE WALKER AMENDMENT OFFERS A REORGANIZATION  FORMAT THAT WOULD REQUIRE THAT CONGRESS VOTE ON REORGANIZATION PLANS SUBMITTED BY THE PRESIDENT, RATHER THAN LETTING THE PLANS TAKE EFFECT UNLESS DISAPPROVED BY EITHER HOUSE WITHIN 60 DAYS OF THEIR SUBMISSION.

TO AGREE TO SECTION 2 OF THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENTS TO H. RES. 393.  SECTION 2 AUTHORIZES  ADDITIONAL FUNDS FOR OFFICE PERSONNEL AND THE LEASING OF EQUIPMENT FOR MAJORITY AND MINORITY LEADERS, AND MAJORITY AND MINORITY WHIPS.

TO AGREE TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 4976, A BILL AMENDING SEVERAL PUBLIC SERVICE ACTS.  THE PROPOSED AMENDMENTS INCREASE AUTHORIZATIONS FOR DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS FOR HOME HEALTH SERVICES FROM $4.45 MILLION TO $12 MILLION.

TO PASS H.R. 4976, A BILL THAT AMENDS THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE ACT, THE COMMUNITY  MENTAL HEALTH CENTERS ACT AND TITLE 5 OF THE SOCIAL SECURITY ACT AND APPROPRIATES $1.1 BILLION IN FUNDS FOR 1978 HEALTH SERVICES PROGRAMS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 3695, A BILL IMPROVING THE PRESENT PROGRAM FOR ALLOCATING GRANT MONIES TO STATES FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND RENOVATION OF MEDICAL FACILITIES SERVING ELIGIBLE VETERANS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 1828, A BILL PROVIDING THAT THE CHANGES MADE BY THE TAX REFORM ACT OF 1976, IN PARTICULAR THE EXCLUSION FOR SICK PAY FOR ALL BUT TOTALLY DISABLED AND RETIRED TAXPAYERS, BE APPLICABLE AS OF JAN. 1, 1977.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 469, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 5294, A BILL TO AMEND THE  CONSUMER CREDIT PROTECTION ACT AND PROVIDE PROTECTION FROM CERTAIN ABUSIVE TACTICS OF DEBT COLLECTOR AGENCIES.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 5717, A BILL TO PROVIDE $20 MILLION IN ASSISTANCE AND REHABILITATION FUNDS TO THE VICTIMS OF THE RECENT EARTHQUAKE DISASTERS IN RUMANIA.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 7, A BILL AUTHORIZING $275 MILLION  FOR FISCAL YEARS 1978-1985 FOR LOCAL AND STATE CAREER EDUCATION PROGRAMS DESIGNED FOR STUDENTS AT THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL LEVELS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 130, A BILL PROTECTING FRANCHISED  DISTRIBUTORS AND RETAILERS OF MOTOR FUEL, UPHOLDING COMPETITION IN THE GASOLINE MARKET AND YET ENCOURAGING CONSERVATION OF FUEL BY REQUIRING THE DISCLOSURE TO CUSTOMERS OF OCTANE RATINGS OF ALL TYPES OF AUTO GASOLINE.
TO  AMEND H.R. 5262 BY DIRECTING U.S. OFFICIALS IN INTERNATIONAL LENDING  INSTITUTIONS TO OPPOSE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR AGRICULTURAL PROJECTS PROMOTING SUGAR, PALM OIL, OR CITRUS CROPS.
TO AMEND H.R. 5262 BY PROHIBITING THAT INTERNATIONAL LENDING INSTITUTIONS USE  U.S. FUNDS FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO CAMBODIA, CUBA, LAOS, AND VIETNAM.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 3340, AS AMENDED.  H.R. 3340 AMENDS THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1954 SO AS TO ALLOW BUSINESS TAX CREDITS FOR BUSINESSES OR RESIDENCES THAT OFFER DAY CARE SERVICES.
TO PASS H.R. 5101, THE BILL AUTHORIZING OF $313 MILLION FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE  ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.

TO PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 5840, EXPORT ADMINISTRATION AMENDMENTS OF 1977.  THIS BILL REVISES  U.S. CONTROLS ON THE EXPORTATION OF CERTAIN SENSITIVE MATERIALS, AND PROHIBITS THAT U.S. FIRMS COMPLY COMPLETELY WITH THE ARAB BOYCOTT OF ISRAELI GOODS.
THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4877 THAT WOULD AUTHORIZE FUNDS OF  $1.17 MILLION FOR THE UNIFORMED SERVICES UNIVERSITY OF THE HEALTH SCIENCES.

TO REJECT A PREFERENTIAL MOTION TO CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #35 TO H.R. 4877 AND EXPRESS THE  SENSE OF THE HOUSE THAT SAID AMENDMENT SHOULD NOT STAND.  SENATE AMENDMENT #35 DEALS WITH THE AUTHORIZATION OF AN ADDITIONAL $20 MILLION TO REIMBURSE STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS FOR THE HIGH COSTS OF SNOW REMOVAL DURING THE WINTER OF 1976-1977.

TO AMEND H.R. 5970, A BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FOR FISCAL 1978, BY PROHIBITING THE PURCHASE OF THREE AIRBORNE WARNING AND CONTROL SYSTEM AIRCRAFTS (AWACS) UNLESS THAT PURCHASE IS AGREED TO BY NATO.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 5675, A BILL ALLOWING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO TRANSFER CERTAIN SURPLUS CASH FUNDS CURRENTLY KEPT IN INTEREST-FREE "TAX AND LOAN ACCOUNTS" IN DEPOSITORY INSTITUTIONS.

TO AMEND H.R. 5970, A BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FOR FISCAL 1978, BY REDUCING THE PRESENT OVERSEAS TROOP STRENGTH BY 17,000 AND BY REDUCING THE PROJECTED END-STRENGTH TROOP LEVEL BY 50,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 5970 BY PROVIDING THAT IN THE FUTURE ALL MEMBERS OF THE MILITARY WILL BE PLACED UNDER THE CONGRESSIONAL PENSION SYSTEM.

THAT THE TREEN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5970, AN AMENDMENT APPROVED BY VOICE VOTE IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE  WHOLE, BE SUBJECT TO A RECORDED VOTE.  THE TREEN AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE EXPENDITURE OF FUNDS TO ADVERTISE THE PRESENT ADMINISTRATION'S REVIEW PROGRAM FOR VIETNAM-ERA DESERTERS.
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 195 BY REDUCING BUDGET AUTHORITY AND OUTLAYS IN THE GENERAL GOVERNMENT FUNCTIONS BY $7 MILLION IN ORDER TO ELIMINATE THE PROPOSED 29% PAY RAISE FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS.
TO AMEND THE SECOND PIKE AMENDMENT TO H. CON. RES. 195 BY CUTTING THE NATIONAL DEFENSE FUNDS  BY $7.95 BILLION AND USING THOSE FUNDS TO REDUCE THE NATIONAL DEBT.

TO ADOPT A SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT TO THE SECOND PIKE AMENDMENT TO H. CON. RES. 195.  THE  BURLESON AMENDMENT INCREASES DEFENSE SPENDING BY $4.1 BILLION AND OUTLAYS BY $2.3 BILLION SO AS TO REACH THE SPENDING LEVELS RECOMMENDED BY THE PRESIDENT.

TO ADOPT THE AMENDED PIKE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 156 AND 157) TO H. CON. RES. 195.  THE ORIGINAL  VERSION OF THIS SECOND PIKE AMENDMENT WOULD HAVE CUT BUDGET AUTHORITY BY $130 MILLION IN ORDER TO ELIMINATE THE 29% PROPOSED PAY RAISE FOR THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY, THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH, AND CERTAIN OTHER FEDERAL EMPLOYEES.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H. CON. RES. 195.   THE MITCHELL AMENDMENT TRANSFERS $6.5 BILLION IN BUDGET AUTHORITY AND $3.6 BILLION IN OUITLAYS FROM DEFENSE PROGRAMS TO DOMESTIC PROGRAMS.
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 195 BY INCREASING BUDGET AUTHORITY AND OUTLAYS BY $500 MILLION EACH FOR  PENSION PROGRAMS OF WORLD WAR I VETERANS.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.  CON. RES. 195.  THE LATTA AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR REDUCED OUTLAYS, A REDUCED DEFICIT AND A PERMANENT "ACROSS-THE-BOARD" TAX REDUCTION.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H. CON. RES. 195.  THE ROUSSELOT AMENDMENT WOULD PROVIDE FOR 1978 REVENUES OF $409 BILLION, BUDGET AUTHORITY OF $453.5 BILLION, OUTLAYS OF $409 BILLION, AND NO DEFICIT.
TO PASS H. CON. RES. 195.  THE MODIFIED BILL PROVIDES FOR REVENUES OF $398.1  BILLION, BUDGET AUTHORITY OF $505.7 BILLION, OUTLAYS OF $466.7 BILLION AND A DEFICIT OF $68.6 BILLION IN FISCAL 1978.

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3843, THE SUPPLEMENTAL HOUSING AUTHORIZATIONS FOR FISCAL  1977.  THE FINAL VERSION OF THE BILL AUTHORIZES AN ADDITIONAL $378 MILLION IN FISCAL YEAR 1977 FOR LOW AND MODERATE INCOME HOUSING ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS.
TO PASS, AS AMENDED, H. RES. 465, A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING $2.5 MILLION FOR THE CONTINUED  INVESTIGATIONS OF THE HOUSE SELECT COMMITTEE ON ASSASSINATIONS.
TO PASS H. RES. 523, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 2, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE REGULATION OF SURFACE COAL MINING OPERATIONS.
THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION  OF H.R. 2,  STRIP MINING CONTROL AND RECLAMATION ACT OF 1977.

TO AMEND H.R. 2  BY PROHIBITING SURFACE MINING IN ALLUVIAL VALLEYS WEST OF THE 100TH MERIDIAN  WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THOSE OPERATIONS ISSUED PERMITS BEFORE JAN. 4, 1977 AND WITH THE FURTHER EXCEPTION OF THOSE OPERATIONS ENGAGED IN COMMERCIAL PRODUCTION ONE YEAR PRIOR TO THE ENACTMENT OF THE BILL.

TO SET ASIDE $300 MILLION IN OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF LEASING RECEIPTS FOR THE FUNDING OF A  PROGRAM FOR THE RECLAMATION OF ABANDONED MINES.  SUCH ACTION WOULD TAKE PLACE BEFORE THE LEVYING OF RECLAMATION FEES ON MINED COAL.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 2 TO THE AD HOC COMMITTEE ON ENERGY WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO RECONSIDER  THE BILL IN THE LIGHT OF THE PRESIDENT'S ENERGY MESSAGE OF APR. 20, 1977.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6550.  H.R. 6550 AUTHORIZES APPROPRIATIONS TO CERTAIN TERRITORIES OF THE UNITED STATES, INCLUDING THE TRUST TERRITORY OF THE PACIFIC ISLANDS AND THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, AND THE TERRITORY OF GUAM.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 4390, A BILL AUTHORIZING $31.05 MILLION IN FISCAL  YEAR 1978 FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE DAM AND CANAL, THE SAN LUIS UNIT, CENTRAL VALLEY PROJECT, CALIFORNIA.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, S. 36, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE $4.9 BILLION IN FISCAL  YEAR 1977 TO THE ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATION FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF CERTAIN NON-NUCLEAR RESEARCH PROJECTS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 5025, A BILL TO AMEND TITLE 38 OF THE UNITED STATES CODE SO THAT  THE CONSTRUCTION OF ANY VETERANS ADMINISTRATION MEDICAL FACILITY COSTING MORE THAN $1 MILLION SHALL BE SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE HOUSE AND THE SENATE VETERANS' AFFAIRS COMMITTEES.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 4007, A BILL REVISING THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE  OF 1954 SO THAT THE DISTRICT THAT A STATE LEGISLATOR REPRESENTS WILL BE DESIGNATED HIS HOME.  H.R. 4007 IS DESIGNED TO FACILITATE THE FIGURING OF TRAVEL EXPENSE DEDUCTIONS FOR STATE LEGISLATORS.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 489, A RESOLUTION PROVIDING FUNDS FOR THE INVESTIGATIONS CONDUCTED  BY THE HOUSE SELECT COMMITTEE ON CONGRESSIONAL OPERATIONS.

TO STRIKE TITLE II OF THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 11, A BILL PROVIDING FOR A PROGRAM OF PUBLIC WORKS JOBS.  TITLE II OF THE REPORT DIRECTS THE PRESIDENT TO SPEND SOME OF THE FUNDS PREVIOUSLY APPROPRIATED FOR CERTAIN WATER PROJECTS IN THE U.S.
TO AMEND H.R. 6179 BY REQUIRING THAT THE ARMS CONTROL AND DISARMAMENT AGENCY REPORT TO CONGRESS  ON THE PROSPECTS FOR VERIFICATION OF THE PROPOSED ARMS CONTROL AGREEMENTS.

TO AMEND H.R. 6689 BY REDUCING THE U.S. CONTRIBUTION TO THE UNITED NATIONS FROM $218 MILLION TO $57.6 MILLION.  THE CRANE AMENDMENT IS DESIGNED TO LIMIT THE U.S. CONTRIBUTION TO A PERCENTAGE NO GREATER THAN THE RATIO OF THE U.S. POPULATION TO THE TOTAL POPULATION OF ALL OTHER UNITED NATIONS' MEMBERS.
TO AGREE TO A SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT TO THE DORNAN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6689.  THE BUCHANAN  AMENDMENT REQUIRES THAT ANY NEW PANAMA CANAL TREATY MUST PROTECT THE VITAL INTERESTS OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND THE MITCHELL, MD. AMENDMENT TO H. CON. RES. 214, THE FIRST CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON  THE BUDGET FOR FISCAL 1978, BY INCREASING THE DEFENSE BUDGET AUTHORITY BY $3 BILLION AND OUTLAYS BY $2 BILLION.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO H. CON. RES. 214.  THE CONABLE AMENDMENT WOULD PROVIDE FOR REDUCED OUTLAYS, A REDUCED DEFICIT, INCREASED FUNDING FOR DEFENSE, AN  ACROSS-THE-BOARD PERSONAL TAX DEDUCTION AND ELIMINATION OF THE BUSINESS TAX CREDIT.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6668.  THIS BILL EXTENDS FOR SIX MONTHS THE  DATE UPON WHICH THE UNITED STATES COMMISSION ON CIVIL RIGHTS MUST FILE ITS REPORT ON AGE DISCRIMINATION AND ALSO EXTENDS THE COMMODITIES PROVISION OF THE OLDER AMERICANS ACT OF 1965.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 334, THE RESOLUTION APPROVING THE CONTINUED APPOINTMENT  OF A SPECIAL COUNSEL TO REPRESENT THE HOUSE AND THE COMMITTEE ON INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE IN THE PENDING COURT CASE REGARDING A POSSIBLE TELEPHONE WIRETAP BY AT AND T.

TO INSTRUCT THE HOUSE CONFEREES APPOINTED TO JOINTLY CONSI- DER H.R. 5840, THE BILL TO AMEND THE EXPORT ADMINISTRATION ACT OF 1969, THAT THEY INSIST ON THE LANGUAGE IN SECTION 110 OF THE HOUSE BILL.  SECTION 110 PROHIBITS THE EXPORTATION OF ALASKAN OIL FOR THE NEXT TWO YEARS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6206, A BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR  FISCAL YEARS 1978-1980 FOR THE EFFECTIVE ENACTMENT OF THE COMMERCIAL FISHERIES RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ACT OF 1964.
TO AMEND H.R. 6655, HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ACT OF 1977, BY STRIKING THE  PROPOSED FORMULA FOR ALLOCATION OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT BLOCK GRANTS AND RESTATING THE FORMULA OTHERWISE.

TO AMEND H.R. 6655 BY REQUIRING THAT LENDING INSTITUTIONS THAT OFFER FLOOD RELIEF PLANS  MUST MAKE CLEAR THAT IF THEIR PLAN IS PURCHASED, THE COMMUNITY IS NO LONGER ELIGIBLE FOR FEDERAL FLOOD DISASTER RELIEF.

TO AMEND H.R. 6714 BY REDUCING BY $25.75 MILLION THE U.S. VOLUNTARY CONTRIBUTION  TO INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS FOR FISCAL 1978.  THE REDUCTION RETURNS THE TOTAL TO THE FIGURE REQUESTED BY THE PRESIDENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 6810 BY CHANGING THE FORMULA FOR THE DISTRIBUTION OF THE APPROPRIATED  FUNDS TO A FORMULA BASED ON STATE AND LOCAL TAX EFFORT INSTEAD OF ON STATE AND LOCAL UNEMPLOYMENT.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 3849, A BILL SPECIFYING QUALIFICATIONS  FOR MEMBERSHIP TO THE NATIONAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE ON OCEANS AND ATMOSPHERE, AND AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THAT COMMITTEE.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 4746, A BILL EXTENDING THE AUTHORITY  OF THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR WITH RESPECT TO RESEARCH PROJECTS ON WATER RESOURCES AND SALINE WATER CONVERSION.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 5885, THE BILL AUTHORIZING  FURTHER APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CONTINUED CONSTRUCTION OF CERTAIN FLOOD CONTROL PROJECTS IN 18 RIVER BASINS OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 2501, A BILL TO AMEND  CERTAIN PUBLIC SURVEY RECORDS SO AS TO ELIMINATE A CONFLICT OF PROPERTY TITLES FOR THE SO-CALLED WOLD TRACT IN THE MEDICINE BOW NATIONAL FOREST IN WYOMING.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6010, A BILL TO AMEND THE FEDERAL AVIATION  ACT OF 1958 WITH RESPECT TO TYPES OF RISK THAT MAY BE INSURED OR REINSURED.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS  S. 1279, THE SENATE BILL TO TEMPORARILY PROVIDE THE  SECRETARY OF COMMERCE WITH THE AUTHORITY TO FACILITATE EMERGENCY ACTIONS NECESSITATED BY THE 1976-1977 U.S. DROUGHT.

TO CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON  S. CON. RES. 19, THE SENATE BILL SETTING BUDGET TARGETS FOR 1978.  THE MODIFIED CONFERENCE REPORT SETS REVENUE LEVELS AT $393.6 BILLION, BUDGET AUTHORITY OF $503.45 BILLION, OUTLAYS OF $460.95 BILLION AND A DEFICIT OF $64.65 BILLION.

TO AMEND H.R. 1139 BY LIMITING THE NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS IN THE SUMMER FOOD PROGRAM IN ANY ONE  STATE TO NO MORE THAN TWICE THE NUMBER OF SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN FROM POVERTY-LEVEL FAMILIES IN THE STATE.

TO AMEND H.R. 1139 BY LIMITING THE NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS IN THE SUMMER FOOD PROGRAM TO THE  AVERAGE OF THE NUMBER OF CHILDREN IN THAT AREA THAT ARE ELIGIBLE FOR FREE OR REDUCED PRICE MEALS DURING THE SCHOOL YEAR.

TO AMEND H.R. 1139 BY PROVIDING THE OPTION TO RECEIVE CASH INSTEAD OF THE COMMODITIES NORMALLY  SUPPLIED UNDER THE ACT.  THE GOODLING AMENDMENT WOULD PERMIT EACH LOCAL SCHOOL DISTRICT THE CHOICE OF THE TWO OPTIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 10 BY PERMITTING THAT FEDERAL EMPLOYEES MAY PARTICIPATE IN POLITICAL ACTIVITY  AND VOTING AT STATE AND LOCAL LEVELS, BUT NOT AT FEDERAL LEVELS.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND H.R. 10 BY PROHIBITING THAT ANY EMPLOYEE ORGANIZATION MAY DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY  INTIMIDATE, THREATEN, OR COERCE FEDERAL EMPLOYEES TO VOTE FOR A CERTAIN CANDIDATE OR A CERTAIN MEASURE.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND H.R. 10 BY DELETING LANGUAGE IN THE BILL THAT CLASSIFIES THE EXTORTION OF POLITICAL CONTRIBUTIONS FROM FEDERAL PERSONNEL AS A CRIMINAL OFFENSE.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS S. 1443 IN LIEU OF H.R. 6258. THE EFFECT OF S. 1443 IS  TO EXTEND UNTIL SEPT. 30, 1977 THE AUTHORIZATIONS FOR THE PRIVACY PROTECTION STUDY COMMISSION.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 1862, THE BILL TO AMEND TITLE 38 OF THE UNITED STATES  CODE AND INCREASE BY APPROXIMATELY 60% THE DISABILITY COMPENSATION RATES FOR DISABLED VETERANS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 6501, A BILL AMENDING TITLE 38 OF THE UNITED STATES  CODE SO AS TO INCREASE THE DISABILITY COMPENSATION FOR THOSE VETERANS DISABLED BY THE LOSS OR LOSS OF USE OF PAIRED EXTREMITIES.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 6502, A BILL AMENDING TITLE 38 OF THE UNITED STATES  CODE BY PROVIDING AN ALLOWANCE FOR AUTOMOTIVE ADAPTIVE EQUIPMENT FOR DISABLED VETERANS OF WORLD WAR I.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE MOTION THAT THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE MEETINGS ON H.R. 5970,  DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE AUTHORIZATIONS FOR FISCAL 1978, BE CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC WHEN CLASSIFIED NATIONAL INFORMATION IS UNDER CONSIDERATION.  THE BENNETT MOTION WOULD ALLOW ALL SITTING MEMBERS OF CONGRESS THE RIGHT TO ATTEND THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE MEETINGS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6884, THE BILL TO AMEND THE FOREIGN ASSISTANCE ACT OF 1961 BY PROHIBITING  MILITARY SALES TO ARGENTINA AND DELETING THE AUTHORIZATION OF $700,000 FOR MILITARY TRAINING IN THAT COUNTRY.
TO AMEND H.R. 6884 BY DELETING THE PROVISION THAT WOULD HAVE ESTABLISHED A SOUTHERN AFRICA  SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS FUND AND A $100 MILLION SECURITY ASSISTANCE FOR THAT FUND.

TO AGREE TO A SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT TO THE BAUMAN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6884.  THE BONKER  AMENDMENT STRIKES THE REQUIREMENT OF "MAJORITY RULE" FROM THE CONDITIONS FOR ELIGIBILITY TO THE SOUTHERN AFRICA SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS FUND.
TO AMEND H.R. 6884 BY REDUCING THE AGGREGATE CEILING FOR FOREIGN MILITARY SALES FROM  $2,098,500,000 TO $1,995,750,000.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 6884 TO THE COMMITTEE ON INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ADD  AN AMENDMENT PERMITTING THE PRESIDENT TO SUSPEND THE 1975 TURKISH EMBARGO.

TO AGREE TO A SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT TO THE BREAUX AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6161.  THE MCKAY AMENDMENT  ALLOWS STATES TO GRANT A 5% VARIANCE OF THE THREE HOUR TIME LIMIT ON SULFUR DIOXIDE EMISSION STANDARDS IN CLASS II HIGH TERRAIN AREAS FOR UP TO 18 DAYS OF THE YEAR.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT, AS MODIFIED BY THE EMERY SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT, TO H.R. 6161.  THE BREAUX AMENDMENT ALLOWS STATES TO GRANT A 5% VARIANCE OF POLLUTION LEVELS IN CLASS I AND CLASS II AREAS FOR UP TO 18 DAYS A YEAR.

TO AMEND H.R. 6161 BY ALLOWING THE EPA ADMINISTRATOR TO GRANT WAIVERS OF THE CLEAN AIR  REQUIREMENTS IN CERTAIN STATES IF THOSE STATES HAVE A PROGRAM STRIVING FOR THE YEARLY REDUCTION OF OXIDANTS IN THE STATE UNTIL NATIONAL STANDARDS ARE MET.

TO PASS AN AMENDMENT OFFERED AS A SUBSTITUTE TO THE MODIFIED DINGELL AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6161.  THE PREYER AMENDMENT WOULD DELAY THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE AUTO EMISSION STANDARDS UNTIL 1980 AND WOULD OFFER A WAIVER OF CERTAIN STANDARDS FOR VEHICLES OF A GROSS WEIGHT OF 3,000 POUNDS OR MORE. REPRESENTATIVE BROWN, MICH. ANNOUNCED ON JUNE 21, 1977 THAT HE WAS INCORRECTLY RECORDED AS VOTING "YES" ON THIS ROLL CALL.  HIS VOTE IN OUR FILES HAS SUBSEQUENTLY BEEN CHANGED FROM A "YES" TO AN "ANNOUNCED NO", AND THE VOTE TOTALS SHOWN IN THE CODEBOOK REFLECT THIS CHANGE.

TO AMEND THE PROVISION OF H.R. 6161 THAT RELATES TO POLLUTION FROM MOBILE SOURCES.  THE  DINGELL AMENDMENT RELAXES AUTO EMISSIONS STANDARDS FOR CARBON MONOXIDE AND NITROGEN OXIDE, AND CHANGES SOME OF THE PROVISIONS DEALING WITH CAR INSPECTION AND WARRANTY.

TO AMEND H.R. 6970, THE MARINE MAMMAL PROTECTION ACT AMENDMENTS, BY REDUCING THE QUOTA OF ACCIDENTAL PORPOISE DEATHS TO 68,910 IN 1977, AND REQUIRING FURTHER REDUCTIONS OF 50% OF THE QUOTA EVERY TWO YEARS THEREAFTER.
TO AMEND H.R. 6804 BY STRIKING THE PROVISIONS THAT WOULD HAVE ASSIGNED CERTAIN  REGULATORY POWERS SOLELY TO THE SECRETARY OF ENERGY.

TO AMEND H.R. 6804 BY STRIKING CERTAIN POWERS OF THE SECRETARY OF ENERGY WITH REGARD TO THE  NEGOTIATION, EXECUTION, AND MANAGEMENT OF FEDERAL LEASES, AND TRANSFERRING THOSE POWERS TO THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR.

TO AMEND H.R. 6804 BY PROHIBITING THAT ANY FORMER OFFICIAL OF THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY ACCEPT EMPLOYMENT FROM ANY INDUSTRY REGULATED BY THE DEPARTMENT FOR A PERIOD OF TWO YEARS AFTER LEAVING HIS/HER POSITION WITH THE GOVERNMENT.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS S. 955, A BILL TO AMEND THE FEDERAL CROP INSURANCE ACT  BY RAISING THE CAPITAL STOCK OF THE FEDERAL CROP INSURANCE CORPORATION TO $150 MILLION.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 75, THE SOIL AND WATER RESOURCES CONSERVATION ACT OF 1977.  THIS BILL BROVIDES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIONAL SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION PROGRAM BY DEC. 31, 1979.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 6794, A BILL REVISING THE FEDERAL ENERGY  ADMINISTRATION ACT OF 1974 AND EXTENDING ITS APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1978.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 6893, A BILL STATING THAT FOR THE PURPOSE OF STATE  INCOME TAX LAWS, MEMBERS OF CONGRESS SHALL ALWAYS BE TREATED AS RESIDENTS OF THE STATE IN WHICH THEY WERE ELECTED.
TO AMEND H.R. 6990, A BILL AUTHORIZING CONSTRUCTION WORK AT CERTAIN MILITARY INSTALLATIONS BY EXEMPTING CERTAIN DEFENSE DEPARTMENT CONTRACTS FROM THE WAGE PROVISIONS OF THE DAVIS-BACON ACT.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF  H.R. 10, A BILL TO AMEND THA HATCH ACT  WITH REGARD TO THE POLITICAL PARTICIPATION RIGHTS OF FEDERAL CIVILIAN AND POSTAL SERVICE EMPLOYEES.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO MODIFY THE CLAY AMENDMENT TO H.R. 10 (SEE RC 315) BY STRIKING LANGUAGE REGARDING THE  LEGALITY OF POLITICAL ACTIVITIES OF LABOR UNIONS.

TO AMEND H.R. 10 WITH AN AMENDMENT THAT INSURES THAT THE ASHBROOK AMENDMENT TO THE BILL  WILL BE CONSISTENT WITH EXISTING LAW CONCERNING THE USE OF LABOR UNION DUES FOR THE FUNDING OF POLITICAL ACTIVITIES.
TO AMEND H.R. 10 BY STRIKING THOSE PROVISIONS THAT EXEMPTED FBI, IRS, CIA, AND OTHER  SUCH AGENTS FROM THE RULES ON RESTRICTED PARTICIPATION IN LOCAL NON-PARTISAN ELECTIONS.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND H.R. 10 BY PROHIBITING THAT ANY FEDERAL EMPLOYEE MAY SOLICIT THE SUPPORT  OF ANOTHER FEDERAL EMPLOYEE, REGARDLESS OF WHETHER THEY KNEW EACH OTHER PREVIOUSLY OR NOT.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO PASS H.R. 7552, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1978 TO THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT, THE U.S. POSTAL SERVICE, THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT, AND VARIOUS OTHER RELATED AGENCIES.

TO AMEND H.R. 7557, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATION BILL, BY PROHIBITING THE LANDING OF CIVIL SUPERSONIC AIRCRAFT AT THE JOHN F. KENNEDY AIRPORT UNLESS THE AIRCRAFT MEETS EXISTING NOISE STANDARDS.
TO AMEND H.R. 7636 BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE ENERGY RESEARCH  AND DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATION.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 617, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 6666, THE BILL TO EXTEND THE AUTHORIZATION OF FUNDS FOR THE LEGAL SERVICES CORPORATION ACT FOR AN ADDITIONAL TWO FISCAL YEARS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6666 BY PROHIBITING THAT STAFF ATTORNEYS PARTICIPATE IN PARTISAN OR  NONPARTISAN POLITICAL ACTIVITIES.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND H.R. 7556, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF THE STATE, JUSTICE, AND COMMERCE, AND TO THE JUDICIARY FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.  THE BURGENER AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE USE OF THE APPROPRIATED FUNDS FOR THE PAYMENT OF SALARIES TO ANY DIPLOMATIC PERSONNEL ASSIGNED TO CUBA OR TO THE SWISS EMBASSY IN CUBA.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND AGREE TO H. CON. RES. 248, A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE  JOINT ECONOMIC COMMITTEE TO BEGIN AN INVESTIGATION OF U.S. AND WORLD ECONOMIC CHANGES SINCE THE ENACTMENT OF THE EMPLOYMENT ACT OF 1946.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 7200, A BILL TO AMEND THE SOCIAL SECURITY  ACT WITH REGARD TO SUPPLEMENTAL SECURITY INCOME BENEFITS, AID TO FAMILIES WITH DEPENDENT CHILDREN, CHILD WELFARE SERVICES AND SOCIAL SERVICES.

TO AMEND H.R. 7553, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR PUBLIC WORKS FOR WATER AND POWER  DEVELOPMENT AND ENERGY RESEARCH FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.  THE CONTE AMENDMENT PROPOSES THE TERMINATION OF THE FUNDS FOR SIXTEEN OF THE RECOMMENDED WATER PROJECTS, PLUS PARTIAL FUNDING FOR THE BONNEVILLE PROJECT.
TO AMEND H.R. 7554 BY REQUIRING THAT AT LEAST 75% OF ALL NEW LOW-INCOME HOUSING  CONTRACTS BE FOR THE SERVICE OF THE ELDERLY AND OF THE HANDICAPPED.
TO AMEND H.R. 7554 BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT PROHIBITS THE USE OF THIS APPROPRIATION FOR COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING GRANTS TO CITIES AND URBAN COUNTIES WITH A POPULATION OF MORE THAN 50,000.

TO AMEND H.R. 7554 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF VA FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN THIS BILL FOR BENEFITS  FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHOSE DISCHARGE WAS UPGRADED AS A RESULT OF THE PRESIDENT'S SPECIAL DISCHARGE PROGRAM THAT WAS PUT INTO EFFECT BY THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE ON APR. 5, 1977.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 7555, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.
TO AMEND H.R. 7555 BY PROHIBITING THAT HEW USE FEDERAL FUNDS TO ENCOURAGE OR ENFORCE THE  BUSING OF STUDENTS TO ANY SCHOOL OTHER THAN THE SCHOOL NEAREST TO THE STUDENTS' HOMES.

TO INSTRUCT THE CONFEREES APPOINTED TO CONSIDER H.R. 5262, THE BILL AUTHORIZING  U.S. CONTRIBUTIONS TO CERTAIN INTERNATIONAL LENDING INSTITUTIONS, THAT THEY INSIST ON LANGUAGE THAT FORBIDS THE USE OF FUNDS FOR LOANS TO THOSE NATIONS THAT VIOLATE THE INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED CODE OF HUMAN RIGHTS.

TO AMEND H.R. 7555, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL 1978, BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF THE APPROPRIATED FUNDS TO PERFORM, ENCOURAGE OR PROMOTE ABORTIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 7558 BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATIONS SHALL BE  USED FOR PROGRAMS GIVING SUBSIDIES TO SUGAR PROCESSORS.

TO INSTRUCT THE HOUSE CONFEREES FOR S. 827, THE BILL TO ESTABLISH A FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY, TO INSIST ON HOUSE LANGUAGE FOR A SUNSET PROVISION THAT WOULD SET DEC. 31, 1982 AS THE LAST EFFECTIVE DAY OF THE ACT.
TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7797 THAT WOULD REDUCE THE APPROPRIATION  FOR THE UNITED NATIONS DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM BY $31 MILLION.
TO AMEND H.R. 7797 BY DELETING THE APPROPRIATION OF $100 MILLION FOR THE  SOUTHERN AFRICA SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS FUND THAT AIDS THE NATIONS BORDERING RHODESIA.
TO AMEND H.R. 7797 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF FUNDS FOR DIRECT OR INDIRECT ASSISTANCE TO UGANDA, CAMBODIA, LAOS, OR THE SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM.
TO AMEND H.R. 7797 BY REINSTATING THE ELIGIBILITY OF NICARAGUA AS A RECIPIENT OF FUNDS FOR MILITARY ASSISTANCE, EDUCATION AND TRAINING.

TO AMEND H.R. 7797 BY PROHIBITING THAT THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL  INSTITUTIONS BE USED FOR THE PURPOSE OF SUPPORTING SUGAR, PALM OIL, OR CITRUS CROPS IF THE U.S. IS ALSO A PRODUCER OF THE SAME OR A SIMILAR AGRICULTURAL COMMODITY.
TO AMEND H.R. 7797 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF FUNDS FOR ANY DIRECT OR INDIRECT AID OR  TRADE WITH CUBA.
THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE  CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 6666, THE BILL TO AUTHORIZE APPROPRIATIONS TO THE LEGAL SERVICES CORPORATION FOR AN ADDITIONAL TWO YEARS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6666 BY REQUIRING THAT ALL BUDGET REQUESTS OF THE LEGAL SERVICES  CORPORATION BE APPROVED BY THE OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET PRIOR TO THEIR SUBMISSION TO CONGRESS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6666 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF FUNDS AUTHORIZED IN THE ACT FOR LEGAL  ASSISTANCE IN ANY CASE RELATING TO SCHOOL DESEGREGATION.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 6666 TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY WITH INSTRUCTIONS  TO REPORT IT BACK WITH AN AMENDMENT RESTORING RESTRICTIONS ON THE AUTHORIZATION OF GRANTS OR CONTRACTS FOR SUPPORT SERVICES.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS S. 964, A BILL RESCINDING A PAY RAISE SCHEDULED  FOR OCT. 1977 FOR THOSE MEMBERS OF THE CONGRESS AND OF THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH THAT RECEIVED THE FEB. 1977 PAY HIKE.
TO AMEND H.R. 7933, THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE APPROPRIATIONS ACT  FOR FISCAL 1978, BY DELETING THE $1.5 BILLION EARMARKED FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF FIVE B-1 BOMBERS.
TO AMEND H.R. 7932 BY RESCINDING THE 29% PAY RAISE PROPOSED ON MAR. 1, 1977  FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND TOP OFFICIALS OF THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH.
TO AMEND H.R. 7932 BY DELETING THE APPROPRIATION OF $55 MILLION FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF AN EXTENSION OF THE WEST CENTRAL FRONT OF THE CAPITOL BUILDING.
TO AMEND H.R. 7933 BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT WOULD HAVE PROVIDED FOR THE GRADUAL  PHASE-OUT OF CIVILIAN RESERVE TECHNICIANS AND FOR THEIR REPLACEMENT BY ACTIVE MILITARY PERSONNEL.

TO AMEND H.R. 7933 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF FUNDS FOR THE RECLASSIFICATION OF U.S.  MILITARY PERSONNEL LISTED AS MISSING IN ACTION IN SOUTHEAST ASIA UNLESS THERE IS CONCRETE EVIDENCE OF DEATH OR UNLESS THE CHANGE OF STATUS IS REQUESTED BY A DEPENDENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 7933 BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT PROHIBITS THE USE OF FUNDS FOR THE  PENSIONS OF MILITARY PERSONNEL WHO ACCEPT FEDERAL JOBS AFTER SEPT. 30, 1977.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 2960, A BILL AUTHORIZING  THE SECRETARY  OF THE INTERIOR TO ERECT A MEMORIAL IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA TO HONOR THE FIFTY-SIX SIGNERS OF THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE.

TO ADOPT H. RES. 642, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 5023, THE BILL EXTENDING THE PERIOD IN  WHICH THE UNITED STATES MAY LITIGATE CLAIMS ON BEHALF OF AMERICAN INDIANS FOR DAMAGES ACCRUED BEFORE JULY 18, 1966.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 7658, THE BILL AUTHORIZING SPECIAL ADAPTED HOUSING  BENEFITS FOR VETERANS DISABLED PERMANENTLY BY A SERVICE-CONNECTED LOSS OF ONE UPPER AND ONE LOWER EXTREMITY.
TO PASS H.R. 5023, THE BILL EXTENDING FOR TWO ADDITIONAL YEARS THE PERIOD IN WHICH THE UNITED STATES MAY LITIGATE CLAIMS ON BEHALF OF THE AMERICAN INDIANS FOR DAMAGES ACCRUED BEFORE JULY 18, 1966.

TO AMEND H.R. 4963, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS TO CERTAIN MARITIME  PROGRAMS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE FOR FISCAL 1978, BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF THE FUNDS TO SUBSIDIZE THE SHIPMENT OF GRAIN TO THE SOVIET UNION.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE COMMITTEE  AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 2777.  THE LAFALCE AMENDMENT WOULD ESTABLISH AN INTERAGENCY TASK FORCE TO STUDY THE RELATIONSHIP OF CONSUMER COOPERATIVES "TO THE ECONOMY AND TO EXISTING FEDERAL PROGRAMS."
TO AMEND H.R. 2777 WITH A SUNSET PROVISION THAT TERMINATES THE AUTHORITIES OF THE ACT ON DEC. 31, 1982.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 658, A RESOLUTION AMENDING THE RULES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES SO AS TO ESTABLISH A PERMANENT SELECT COMMITTEE ON INTELLIGENCE.
TO AMEND THE SARASIN AMENDMENT (SEE RC 421) TO H.R. 4287 BY TRANSFERRING THE AUTHORITY  FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF THE BILL FROM THE SECRETARY OF LABOR TO THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO THE COMMITTEE SUBSTITUTE BILL FOR H.R. 4287.  THE SARASIN AMENDMENT WOULD PROVIDE SEPARATE ADMINISTRATIONS FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF HEALTH AND SAFETY STANDARDS FOR COAL AND FOR NON-COAL MINES.
TO AMEND H.R. 4287 BY ALLOWING THE STATES TO PROMULGATE THEIR OWN SAFETY LAWS AND HOLD THEIR OWN INSPECTIONS, PROVIDED THAT THE STATE PLANS ADEQUATELY COMPLY WITH THE FEDERAL GUIDELINES.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 6936, THE HOUSE COMPANION BILL TO S. 1435, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE FEDERAL ELECTION COMMISSION FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING SEPT. 30, 1978.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H. J. RES. 372, THE RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE  PRESIDENT TO ANNUALLY DECLARE THAT THE WEEK IN NOV. THAT INCLUDES THANKSGIVING DAY SHALL BE CALLED NATIONAL FAMILY WEEK.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 2387, THE BILL TO INCREASE THE SALARIES OF THE DIRECTOR  AND THE DEPUTY DIRECTOR OF THE OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET, AND OF THE CHAIRMAN AND MEMBERS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6974, THE BILL TO ALLOW THE DIRECTOR OF THE  ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE OF THE U.S. COURTS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF POSITIONS THAT ARE CLASSIFIED AS BEING OF SALARY GRADES 16,17, OR 18 OF THE GENERAL SCHEDULE.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6975, THE BILL INCREASING THE NUMBER OF HEARING  EXAMINER POSITIONS AT GRADE 16 OF THE GENERAL SCHEDULE ESTABLISHED BY THE CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 4319, THE BILL TO PROVIDE THAT IN CERTAIN INSTANCES,  FEDERAL EMPLOYEES THAT RETIRE AFTER ONLY FIVE YEARS OF SERVICE SHALL BE ELIGIBLE TO RETAIN THEIR LIFE AND HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFITS.
TO RECEDE FROM DISAGREEMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT #24 TO H.R. 7554 AND CONCUR IN A HOUSE AMENDMENT THAT WOULD DELETE THE INITIAL FUNDING FOR THE JUPITER ORBITER PROBE PROGRAM OF NASA.

TO RECEDE FROM DISAGREEMENT TO SENATE AMENDMENTS #28 AND #40 TO H.R. 7554 AND CONCUR IN THE ORIGINAL  HOUSE AMENDMENTS THAT PROHIBIT THE USE OF APPROPRIATED FUNDS FOR VETERANS' BENEFITS FOR ANYONE PARDONED UNDER THE PRESIDENT'S SPECIAL DISCHARGE PROGRAM.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4746, THE BILL GIVING NEW AUTHORITIES TO THE SECRETARY  OF THE INTERIOR WITH RESPECT TO WATER RESOURCES RESEARCH AND TO RESEARCH ON SALINE WATER CONVERSION.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4975, THE BILL AMENDING THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE ACT  AND AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR BIOMEDICAL RESEARCH IN FISCAL YEAR 1978.

TO AMEND H.R. 7171 BY UPHOLDING THE EXISTING LAW WHICH STATES THAT NO PERSON CAN RECEIVE MORE  THAN $20,000 ANNUALLY IN FEDERAL SUBSIDY PAYMENTS FOR THE PRODUCTION OF WHEAT, FEED GRAIN, OR UPLAND COTTON CROPS.  THE FINDLEY AMENDMENT EXTENDS THIS LAW TO INCLUDE PAYMENTS TO RICE PRODUCERS AND ENACTS THE LAW UNTIL 1981.
TO AMEND H.R. 7171 BY PROHIBITING FARM SUBSIDY PAYMENTS TO CORPORATE ENTERPRISES OR PARTNERSHIPS  WHOSE MEMBERS ARE NOT PRIMARILY ENGAGED IN FARMING OPERATIONS.

THAT THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE MEETINGS ON H.R. 7933, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FOR FISCAL 1978, BE CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC AT SUCH TIME AS CLASSIFIED NATIONAL SECURITY INFORMATION IS UNDER CONSIDERATION.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO THE FITHIAN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171.   THE FINDLEY AMENDMENT CHANGES THE WORDING OF THE PREVIOUS AMENDMENT BY SUBSTITUTING THE WORD "PRODUCER" FOR "PERSON" IN A PROVISION LIMITING SUGAR PAYMENTS TO $50,000.

TO MODIFY THE FOLEY SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR THE WEAVER AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171.  THE MODIFIED FOLEY AMENDMENT STATES THAT THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE SHALL ESTABLISH, MAINTAIN, AND DISPOSE OF A SEPARATE RESERVE OF UP TO 35 MILLION TONS OF FEED GRAIN.

TO AGREE TO THE PREFERENTIAL MOTION THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE FROM DISAGREEMENT AND CONCUR IN THE SENATE  AMENDMENT #61 TO H.R. 7932, THE LEGISLATIVE BRANCH APPROPRIATIONS ACT FOR FISCAL 1978.  AMENDMENT #61 APPROPRIATES $225,000 TO THE JOINT COMMITTEE ON DEFENSE PRODUCTION.
TO AMEND H.R. 7171 BY SETTING PEANUT PRICE SUPPORTS AT $390 PER TON IN 1978, $375 PER TON IN  1979, $360 PER TON IN 1980, AND $345 PER TON IN 1981 AND ALL SUBSEQUENT YEARS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO THE JOHNSON (R,CO) AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171.  THE WHITLEY AMENDMENT STATES THAT IN THE ALLOCATION OF FUNDS TO THE FOOD FOR PEACE PROGRAM, PRIORITY SHALL BE GIVEN TO THE FINANCING OF FOOD AND FIBER SALES.

TO AMEND THE FOLEY AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171 BY ADDING LANGUAGE REQUIRING THAT THE SECRETARY OF  AGRICULTURE MEET ANNUALLY WITH THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES TO DETERMINE WHICH FOODS ARE OF SUFFICIENT NUTRITIONAL VALUE TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM.
TO AMEND THE MATHIS AMENDMENTS (SEE RC 464) TO H.R. 7171 BY LOWERING THE CEILING FOR  THE 1978 EXPENDITURES FOR THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM TO $5.6 BILLION.

TO AGREE TO SEVERAL AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 7171, THE EFFECT OF WHICH WOULD BE TO SET A CEILING OF $5.85 BILLION IN 1978, $6.16 BILLION IN 1979, $6.19 BILLION IN 1980 AND $6.24 BILLION IN 1981 ON THE EXPENDITURES FOR THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM.

TO AMEND THE KELLY AMENDMENT (SEE RC 467) TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171.  THE FENWICK AMENDMENT WOULD EXCLUDE FROM THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM ALL STRIKERS EXCEPT THOSE PREVIOUSLY ELIGIBLE AND THOSE WITH DEPENDENTS UNDER SIXTEEN YEARS OLD.

TO AMEND THE KELLY AMENDMENT (SEE RC 467) TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171 BY ALSO  MAKING EXCEPTIONS  FOR STRIKERS WITH ELDERLY OR DISABLED DEPENDENTS, OR WITH DEPENDENTS UNDER SIXTEEN YEARS OLD.
TO AMEND A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171 BY DENYING ELIGIBILITY TO THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM TO  ALL STRIKERS EXCEPT THOSE THAT HAD BEEN ELIGIBLE BEFOREHAND FOR THE PROGRAM.
TO AMEND A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171 BY MAINTAINING A PURCHASE REQUIREMENT FOR THE FOOD  STAMP PROGRAM.

TO AMEND THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171 BY REQUIRING THAT FOOD STAMP HOUSEHOLDS  WITH AN ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME THAT IS GREATER THAN TWICE THE POVERTY LEVEL INCOME REPAY TO THE GOVERNMENT THAT EXCESS, UP TO THE AMOUNT OF THEIR FOOD STAMP ALLOTMENT.

TO AMEND THE FOLEY COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 473) TO H.R. 7171 BY AUTHORIZING THE  SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE TO ORGANIZE PILOT PROJECTS IN WHICH FOOD STAMPS COULD BE RECEIVED IN EXCHANGE FOR A SPECIFIC NUMBER OF HOURS OF WORK.
TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7171 THAT WOULD SUBSTITUTE THE TEXT  OF H.R. 7940, A BILL REVISING THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM, FOR TITLE XII OF THE BILL.
TO AMEND H.R. 7171 BY PROVIDING FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A PRICE SUPPORT PROGRAM FOR SUGAR  BEET AND SUGAR CANE CROPS OF 1977.

TO RECOMMITT H.R. 7171 TO THE COMMITTEE ON AGRICULTURE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REDUCE THE  TOTAL AMOUNT THAT ONE PRODUCER CAN RECEIVE UNDER ONE OR MORE OF THE VARIOUS GOVERNMENT GRAIN PROGRAMS TO $30,000.

TO ADOPT H. CON. RES. 317, THE RESOLUTION STATING THAT THE HOUSE SHALL ADJOURN ON FRIDAY,  AUG. 5, 1977, AND THE SENATE ON SATURDAY, AUG. 6, 1977, AND THAT THE TWO HOUSES SHALL STAND ADJOURNED UNTIL NOON ON WEDNESDAY, SEPT. 7, 1977.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 727, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 8444, A BILL ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL  COMPREHENSIVE ENERGY PROGRAM.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 715, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 3744, THE BILL TO AMEND THE FAIR  LABOR STANDARDS ACT OF 1938 WITH REGARD TO THE MINIMUM WAGE AND TO OTHER PROVISIONS OF THE ACT.
THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 8444,  THE BILL ESTABLISHING A COMPREHENSIVE NATIONAL ENERGY PROGRAM.

TO AGREE TO AN AD HOC COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8444, THE BILL ESTABLISHING A COMPREHENSIVE NATIONAL ENERGY PROGRAM. THIS AMENDMENT DEALS WITH ENERGY CONSERVATION PROGRAMS FOR EXISTING RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS.
TO AGREE TO AN AD HOC COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8444 THAT WOULD PROVIDE FOR A ONE-YEAR  STUDY OF OFF-HIGHWAY MOTOR VEHICLE CONSERVATION METHODS.
TO AGREE TO THE AD HOC COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8444 THAT WOULD PROVIDE FOR A ONE-YEAR  STUDY OF THE USE OF BICYCLES AS AN ALTERNATE MEANS OF TRANSPORTATION.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO THE AD HOC AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8444 (SEE RC 495).  THE FORD AMENDMENT INSURES THAT PERSONS EMPLOYED BY THE PROGRAMS AUTHORIZED IN THIS ACT BE PROTECTED BY THE WAGE PROVISIONS OF THE DAVIS-BACON ACT.

TO AGREE TO THE MODIFIED AD HOC COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 494) TO H.R. 8444 THAT  PROVIDES FOR FEDERAL GRANTS THAT WOULD PAY UP TO HALF THE PRICE OF THE INSTALLMENT OF ENERGY SAVING DEVICES IN LOCAL GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS UNTIL 1979.

TO CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #82 TO H.R. 7555 WITH AN AMENDMENT RESTRICTING THE FEDERAL FUNDING OF ABORTIONS UNLESS A MOTHER'S LIFE WOULD BE ENDANGERED IF THE FETUS WERE CARRIED TO TERM.  AMENDMENT #82 PROHIBITS THE USE OF FEDERAL FUNDS FOR ABORTION EXCEPT WHEN THE MOTHER'S LIFE IS ENDANGERED, WHEN MEDICALLY NECESSARY, OR IN CASES OF RAPE OR INCEST.

TO AMEND H.R. 8444 BY EXEMPTING NEW ONSHORE NATURAL GAS SUPPLIERS FROM THE FEDERAL PRICE  CONTROLS EFFECTIVE ON APR. 30, 1978.  THE EXEMPTION WOULD ALSO AFFECT NEW OFFSHORE SUPPLIERS BEGINNING IN 1982.

TO AMEND H.R. 8444 SO AS TO DELETE THE SECTION OF THE BILL THAT REQUIRES ANY ELECTRIC  UTILITY COMPANY WANTING TO EXPAND ITS GENERATING CAPACITY TO HAVE ITS REQUEST SUBJECT TO AN ANTI-TRUST REVIEW BY THE JUSTICE DEPARTMENT, AND A FURTHER REVIEW BY THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION.
TO AMEND H.R. 8444 BY DELETING THE PROVISION FOR THE PURCHASE OF 6,000 VANS TO BE USED  TO POOL TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF FEDERAL EMPLOYEES.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE AD HOC COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE  RC 504) TO H.R. 8444.  THE HOWARD AMENDMENT WOULD INCREASE THE GASOLINE TAX BY $.05 IN 1979, AND EQUALLY DIVIDE THE REVENUES BETWEEN HIGHWAY REPAIR PROGRAMS AND MASS TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS.
TO AGREE TO AN AD HOC COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8444 THAT WOULD INCREASE THE GAS TAX BY $.04  IN 1979, AND PLACE THE REVENUES IN AN ENERGY CONSERVATION AND CONVERSION TRUST FUND.
TO AMEND H.R. 8444 BY ALLOWING OIL AND GAS PRODUCERS TO RECOVER A PORTION OF THE PROPOSED CRUDE OIL  EQUALIZATION TAX IF THEY INVEST IN ADDITIONAL EXPLORATORY ACTIVITIES.
TO AMEND H.R. 8444 BY USING THE REVENUES FROM THE PROPOSED CRUDE OIL EQUALIZATION TAX  TO SUPPLEMENT THE FEDERAL OLD-AGE AND SURVIVORS TRUST FUND, A SOCIAL SECURITY TRUST FUND.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 729, A RESOLUTION PROVIDING FUNDS FOR INVESTIGATIONS CONDUCTED BY THE  HOUSE PERMANENT COMMITTEE ON INTELLIGENCE.
TO AMEND H.R. 8444 BY USING THE REVENUES FROM THE PROPOSED CRUDE OIL EQUALIZATION TAX TO REDUCE  GENERAL INCOME TAXES.

TO AGREE TO THE AD HOC COMMITTEE AMENDMENT THAT DELETES FROM H.R. 8444 THE PROVISION  EXEMPTING NEW PLANTS FROM THE OIL AND GAS USERS TAX IF SUCH PLANTS ARE ALSO EXEMPTED FROM THE COAL CONVERSION PROGRAM.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO THE TEXT OF H.R. 8444.  THE  ANDERSON AMENDMENT, WHICH EMBODIES THE TEXT OF H.R. 8555, WAS WRITTEN BY THE REPUBLICAN MEMBERS OF THE AD HOC COMMITTEE AND SUBMITTED AS AN ALTERNATE ENERGY PLAN.
ON THE DEMAND FOR A SEPARATE VOTE IN THE HOUSE, TO AMEND H.R. 8444 BY DELETING THE PROVISION  FOR A FEDERAL VAN POOLING PROGRAM (SEE RC 501).
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 8444 TO THE AD HOC COMMITTEE ON ENERGY WITH INSTRUCTIONS  TO STRIKE THE SECTION THAT ESTABLISHES A CRUDE OIL EQUALIZATION TAX.

TO AMEND THE MAHON MOTION THAT THE HOUSE INSIST ON ITS AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7933  THAT AUTHORIZES FUNDING FOR THE B-1 BOMBER.  THE ADDABBO AMENDMENT PROPOSES THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT THAT DELETES FUNDING FOR THE BOMBER.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT TO H. CON. RES. 341, THE BILL REVISING THE CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET  FOR THE U.S. GOVERNMENT FOR FISCAL 1978.  THE ROUSSELOT AMENDMENT, OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, WOULD RETAIN BUDGET OUTLAYS AT THE 1977 LEVELS, AND PROVIDE FOR AN ACROSS-THE-BOARD TAX REDUCTION.
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 341 BY INCREASING THE DEFICIT BY $175 MILLION SO AS TO FUND A TAX  CREDIT PROGRAM FOR FULL-TIME COLLEGE OR VOCATIONAL EDUCATION STUDENTS.

TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 341 BY REDUCING THE BUDGET OUTLAYS FOR INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS AND  RECOMMENDING THAT THIS REDUCTION BE MADE SPECIFICALLY IN THE U.S. FOOD COMMODITY SUPPORT PROGRAMS IN SOUTH KOREA.
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 341 BY REDUCING THE BUDGET AUTHORITY FOR NATIONAL DEFENSE AND THE BUDGET OUTLAYS FOR INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS AND PHASING OUT ANY TYPE OF U.S. ASSISTANCE TO SOUTH KOREA.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 640, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 6566, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS  TO THE ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATION FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978 FOR NATIONAL SECURITY PROGRAMS.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 657, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 6796, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS  TO THE ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATION FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978 FOR CIVILIAN RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF FOSSIL FUELS, SOLAR ENERGY, GEOTHERMAL ENERGY, AND NUCLEAR ENERGY.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 728, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 2176, THE BILL AMENDING THE ACCOUNTING  AND AUDITING ACT OF 1950 AND AUTHORIZING THE COMPTROLLER GENERAL TO AUDIT THE ACCOUNTS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE BANKS, THE OFFICE OF THE COMPTROLLER OF THE CURRENCY, AND THE FEDERAL DEPOSIT INSURANCE CORPORATION.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 738, THE RULE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5383, THE BILL AMENDING THE AGE DISCRIMINATION IN EMPLOYMENT ACT OF 1967 BY RAISING THE RETIREMENT AGE FROM 65 TO 70 FOR ALL NON-FEDERAL EMPLOYEES COVERED BY THE ACT.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 641, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 6669, THE BILL TO ESTABLISH A FEDERAL  CLIMATE CONTROL PROGRAM TO BETTER PREDICT AND COPE WITH WEATHER-INDUCED PROBLEMS.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 3455, A BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS TO  THE NUCLEAR REGULATORY COMMISSION FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 3454, THE ENDANGERED AMERICAN WILDERNESS  ACT OF 1977, A BILL ADDING LANDS FROM SIXTEEN NATIONAL FORESTS TO THE NATIONAL WILDERNESS PRESERVATION SYSTEM.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 8698, THE BILL DENYING AUTOMATIC ENTITLEMENT TO VETERANS' BENEFITS TO THOSE MEN WITH UPGRADED DISCHARGES PURSUANT TO THE 1977 ADMINISTRATIVE PARDON OF VIETNAM DRAFT EVADERS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 8701, THE BILL MAKING IMPROVEMENTS IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF  THE GI BILL, AND PROVIDING FOR INCREASED EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE, VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION, AND SPECIAL TRAINING ALLOWANCES FOR VETERANS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 8175, THE BILL EXTENDING FOR ONE YEAR THE AUTHORITY  OF THE ADMINISTRATOR OF VETERANS' AFFAIRS AS SET FORTH IN THE VETERANS' ADMINISTRATION PHYSICIANS' AND DENTISTS' PAY COMPARABILITY ACT OF 1975.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 4341, THE BILL NO LONGER REQUIRING THE VETERANS' ADMINISTRATION TO OCCASIONALLY INSPECT THE MANUFACTURING PROCESS OF MOBILE HOMES FOR VETERANS.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6803, THE COMPREHENSIVE OIL POLLUTION  LIABILITY AND COMPENSATION ACT.

THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE FROM DISAGREEMENT WITH THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. CON. RES. 341,  THE SECOND CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL 1978, AND CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT SETTING A BUDGET AUTHORITY OF $500.1 BILLION, OUTLAYS OF $458.25 BILLION, REVENUES OF $397 BILLION AND A DEFICIT OF $61.25 BILLION.

TO AMEND H.R. 3744, THE BILL AMENDING THE FAIR LABOR STANDARDS ACT OF 1938 WITH REGARDS TO  THE MINIMUM WAGE RATE.  THE ERLENBORN AMENDMENT SETS THE MINIMUM WAGE AT $2.65 IN 1978, $2.85 IN 1979, AND $3.05 IN 1980.
TO AMEND H.R. 3744 BY ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL COMMISSION ON FAIR LABOR STANDARDS TO STUDY  THE SOCIAL, POLITICAL AND ECONOMIC IMPACT OF THE MINIMUM WAGE.

TO AMEND H.R. 3744 BY SETTING THE MINIMUM WAGE AT $2.65 FOR 1978 AND THEN REINSTATING  LANGUAGE IN THE BILL THAT PROVIDES FOR THE ADJUSTMENT OF THE WAGE BY AN INDEXING MECHANISM FOR THE NEXT FIVE YEARS.
TO AMEND H.R. 3744 BY RETAINING THE TIP CREDIT AT 50% OF THE MINIMUM WAGE FOR HOTEL, MOTEL, AND RESTAURANT EMPLOYEES.
TO AMEND H.R. 3744 BY RETAINING THE MINIMUM WAGE EXEMPTIONS AND OVERTIME PROVISIONS  FOR SEASONAL RECREATIONAL AND AMUSEMENT PARKS.
TO AMEND H.R. 3744 BY PERMITTING EMPLOYERS TO PAY A SUB- MINIMUM WAGE OF 85% OF THE MINIMUM WAGE TO EMPLOYEES UNDER AGE 19 FOR THE FIRST SIX MONTHS OF THEIR EMPLOYMENT.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3744 THAT WAIVES THE MINIMUM WAGE REQUIREMENT FOR CHILDREN UNDER 12 YEARS OLD THAT ARE EMPLOYED IN THE HAND-HARVESTING OF CROPS BETWEEN JUNE 1 AND OCT. 15 OF ANY YEAR.

TO AMEND THE BLOUIN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3744 BY EXEMPTING THOSE SMALL BUSINESSES WITH RETAIL  SALES OF UNDER $500,000 FROM THE MINIMUM WAGE REQUIREMENT, AND EXTENDING THE EXEMPTION TO OTHER THAN SERVICE AND RETAIL BUSINESSES.  THE BLOUIN AMENDMENT PROPOSES THAT THE CURRENT $250,000 EXEMPTION FOR SMALL BUSINESSES BE PERIODICALLY INCREMENTED BY $25,000 ACCORDING TO INDEXED MEASURES OF THE CONSUMER PRICE INDEX.
TO AMEND THE BLOUIN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3744 (SEE RC 553) WITH AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE THAT WOULD RAISE THE SMALL BUSINESS EXEMPTION FROM $250,000 TO $500,000.

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5262, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR INCREASED U.S. CONTRIBUTIONS  TO THE INTERNATIONAL FINANCE CORPORATION, THE INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION, THE ASIAN DEVELOPMENT BANK, THE ASIAN DEVELOPMENT FUND AND THE INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE THOMPSON SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR  THE COMMITTEE SUBSTITUTE BILL FOR H.R. 4544, THE BILL IMPROVING THE BLACK LUNG BENEFITS PROGRAM ESTABLISHED UNDER THE FEDERAL COAL MINE HEALTH AND SAFETY ACT.  THE ERLENBORN SUBSTITUTE AUTHORIZES THE FILING OF CLAIMS THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR FOR ONE YEAR AFTER THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE BILL.  AFTER THE ONE YEAR DEADLINE, THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT SHALL DISCONTINUE THE PROGRAM, AND ALL CLAIMS WOULD BE FILED AND PAID PURSUANT TO THE WORKERS' COMPENSATION LAWS OF THE SEPARATE STATES.

TO AMEND THE THOMPSON SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT TO THE COMMITTEE SUBSTITUTE BILL FOR H.R. 4544.  THIS  ERLENBORN AMENDMENT WOULD DELETE LANGUAGE THAT ALLOWS FOR REDUCTIONS IN UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION OR WORKERS' COMPENSATION OF A PERSON RECEIVING BLACK LUNG DISABILITY PAYMENTS IF THE OTHER COMPENSATION PAYMENTS ARE RECEIVED FOR REASONS RELATED TO THE SAME DISEASE.

TO AMEND THE THOMPSON SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4544.  THIS AMENDMENT OF THE REPRESENTATIVE FROM ILLINOIS WOULD DELETE LANGUAGE THAT PROHIBITS THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT FROM RE-EXAMINING THE X-RAYS SUBMITTED BY BLACK LUNG CLAIMANTS.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 764, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 8655, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR AN INCREASE  OF $75 BILLION IN THE TEMPORARY LIMIT ON THE PUBLIC DEBT.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 687, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR AN INCREASE IN THE DISTRICT OFFICE RENTAL SPACE FOR  MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE DODD AMENDMENT (SEE RC 570) TO  H.R. 6796, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS TO ERDA FOR CIVILIAN RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT.  THE BROWN AMENDMENT WOULD REDUCE THE FUNDING FOR THE CLINCH RIVER BREEDER REACTOR TO $33 MILLION, THE APPROPRIATION TO BE SPENT ON THE COMPLETION OF THE SYSTEM DESIGN, AND ON THE LIQUIDATION OF ITS CONTRACTS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6796 BY REDUCING THE FUNDING FOR THE CLINCH RIVER BREEDER REACTOR TO $75 MILLION AND  DELAYING FURTHER CONSTRUCTION ON THE SITE FOR ONE YEAR.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 620, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 7073, THE BILL EXTENDING THROUGH FISCAL YEAR 1978  THE AUTHORIZATIONS FOR THE PROGRAMS ESTABLISHED UNDER THE FEDERAL INSECTICIDE, FUNGICIDE AND RODENTICIDE ACT.
THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE FURTHER CONSIDERATION  OF H.R. 6796, ERDA AUTHORIZATIONS FOR CIVILIAN RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT FOR FISCAL 1978.

TO AMEND H.R. 6796 BY INCREASING PRIVATE FINANCIAL PARTICIPATION IN THE FUNDING OF THE CLINCH  RIVER BREEDER REACTOR FOR ALL COSTS OF THE FACILITY THAT EXCEED THE $2 BILLION ESTIMATE FOR ITS CONSTRUCTION.

TO AMEND H.R. 6796 BY AUTHORIZING $28 MILLION FOR THE PURCHASE OF FOUR MEGAWATTS OF SOLAR ENERGY CELLS AND $10 MILLION FOR THE TECHNOLOGICAL DEVELOPMENT OF PHOTOVOLTAIC CELLS.  THE INTENT OF THIS AMENDMENT IS TO STIMULATE MASS PRODUCTION AND LOWER PRICES OF SOLAR ENERGY EQUIPMENT.
TO PASS H.R. 6536, A BILL ESTABLISHING SEPARATE RETIREMENT FUNDS FOR POLICEMEN, FIREMEN, TEACHERS, AND JUDGES OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS S. 1060, A BILL RESTATING THE CHARTER OF THE GEORGE WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY SO AS  TO PROVIDE THE UNIVERSITY WITH A MORE FLEXIBLE AND MODERN CORPORATE CHARTER.
TO PASS H.R. 5813, A BILL REVISING THE PROCESS FOR ESTIMATING ANNUAL FEDERAL PAYMENTS TO THE  DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA FOR WATER AND SANITARY SEWER SERVICES.

TO AMEND H.R. 6530, A BILL AMENDING THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA SELF-GOVERNMENT AND GOVERNMENTAL  REORGANIZATION ACT WITH RESPECT TO THE BORROWING AUTHORITY OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.  THE BAUMAN AMENDMENT ALLOWS THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA TO USE THEIR BORROWING AUTHORITY FOR THE PURCHASE OF LAND FOR A CITY CIVIC CENTER ONLY IF CONGRESS HAS PREVIOUSLY PASSED LEGISLATION APPROVING THE PURCHASE.
TO PASS H.R. 6530, THE BILL AMENDING THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA SELF-GOVERNMENT AND GOVERNMENTAL  REORGANIZATION ACT WITH RESPECT TO THE BORROWING AUTHORITY OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO AMEND H.R. 7747, A BILL AMENDING TITLE 23 OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA CODE, BY  AUTHORIZING THE DENIAL OF BAIL AND THE USE OF PRE-TRIAL DETENTION FOR INDIVIDUALS ACCUSED OF ARMED ROBBERY AS WELL AS OTHER SERIOUS OR VIOLENT CRIMES.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6693, THE BILL EXTENDING FOR FIVE  YEARS THE AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS CONTAINED IN THE CHILD ABUSE PREVENTION AND TREATMENT ACT.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H. CON. RES. 277, A RESOLUTION STATING THE SENSE OF THE SENATE  THAT SIX-DAY MAIL DELIVERY SHOULD BE MAINTAINED DESPITE THE RISING COSTS INVOLVED.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 2664, A BILL INSTRUCTING  THE COURT OF CLAIMS TO REVIEW AN 1877 DECISION OF THE INDIAN CLAIMS COMMISSION TO TAKE APPROXIMATELY 7.3 MILLION ACRES FROM THE GREAT SIOUX RESERVATION.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND AGREE TO H. RES. 780, A RESOLUTION INSTRUCTING THE HOUSE  CONFEREES ON H.R. 7555, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE, TO CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #82 TO THE BILL.  AMENDMENT #82 PROHIBITS THE USE OF FEDERAL FUNDS FOR ABORTION EXCEPT WHEN THE MOTHER'S LIFE IS ENDANGERED, WHEN MEDICALLY NECESSARY, OR IN CASES OF RAPE OR INCEST.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 7769, THE BILL PERMITTING REFUGEES FROM VIETNAM, LAOS, AND CAMBODIA TO ACQUIRE THE STATUS OF PERMANENT RESIDENT ALIENS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 9278, A BILL INCREASING THE AUTHORIZATION OF FUNDS TO FORMER  PRESIDENTS FOR THE PAYMENT OF THEIR STAFF DURING THE THIRTY MONTH PERIOD FOLLOWING COVERAGE UNDER THE PRESIDENTIAL TRANSITION ACT.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 2664, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE RECONSIDERATION  OF AN 1877 DECISION OF THE U.S. INDIAN CLAIMS COMMISSION TO TAKE APPROXIMATELY 7.3 MILLION ACRES IN THE BLACK HILLS FROM THE GREAT SIOUX RESERVATION.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS S. 393, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE  TO STUDY  NINE WILDERNESS AREAS IN THE STATE OF MONTANA TO DETERMINE IF THEY SHOULD BE DESIGNATED NATIONAL WILDERNESS PRESERVATION LANDS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS S. 213, THE BILL AUTHORIZING THE GENERAL ACCOUNTING OFFICE TO  CONDUCT INDEPENDENT AUDITS OF THE OFFICES OF THE IRS, THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT, AND THE BUREAU OF ALCOHOL, TOBACCO, AND FIREARMS.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 760, A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON ASSASSINATIONS OR ANY SUBCOMMITTEE THEREOF TO BRING AND DEFEND LAWSUITS ARISING OUT OF SUBPEONAS, IMMUNITY ORDERS, TESTIMONY OR THE PRODUCTION OF EVIDENCE, AND FAILURE TO TESTIFY OR PRODUCE EVIDENCE.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION  OF H.R. 6566, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATION FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978 FOR VARIOUS NATIONAL SECURITY PROGRAMS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6566 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF ANY FUNDS AUTHORIZED IN THIS BILL FOR THE PRODUCTION, PROCUREMENT, OR DEPLOYMENT OF THE NEUTRON BOMB, OR FOR RESEARCH AND EVALUATION OF THE WEAPON.

TO PASS H.R. 9019, THE BILL RESCINDING CERTAIN BUDGET AUTHORITY CONTAINED IN THE PRESIDENTIAL  MESSAGE OF JULY 19, 1977.  THE BILL CONTAINS TWO RESCISSIONS, ONE IN FOREIGN MILITARY CREDIT SALES, AND ONE IN THE GENERAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION FEDERAL BUILDING FUND.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 7010.  THE RAILSBACK  AMENDMENT WOULD MAKE THE LEGISLATION APPLICABLE ONLY TO VICTIMS OF CRIME THAT ARE SIXTY-TWO YEARS OLD OR OLDER, WOULD REQUIRE THE STATES TO HAVE SOME TYPE OF OFFENDER RESTITUTION PROGRAMS IN ORDER TO RECEIVE FEDERAL FUNDS, AND WOULD COMPENSATE FOR STOLEN OR DAMAGED "ITEMS OF NECESSITY" AS WELL AS FOR PERSONAL INJURY EXPENSES.
TO AMEND H.R. 7010 BY REQUIRING THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO PAY 25% INSTEAD OF 50% OF THE CLAIMS  FILED UNDER THE VICTIMS OF CRIME PROGRAMS OF THE SEPARATE STATES.

TO AMEND H.R. 7010 SO THAT IT IS REQUIRED THAT THE PROCEEDS GATHERED FROM AN INTERVIEW, STATEMENT, OR ARTICLE ABOUT A PERSON CHARGED OR CONVICTED OF CRIMES COVERED UNDER THIS ACT SHALL BE DEPOSITED IN AN ESCROW FUND FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE VICTIMS OR SURVIVORS.
TO PASS H.R. 9354, THE BILL INCREASING THE AUTHORIZATION OF FUNDS FOR STAFFS OF FORMER PRESIDENTS DURING THE THIRTY MONTH PERIOD FOLLOWING COVERAGE UNDER THE PRESIDENTIAL TRANSITION ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 6951, THE BILL EXTENDING THE EXPIRATION DATE OF THE COUNCIL ON WAGE AND PRICE  STABILITY ACT.  THE LEVITAS AMENDMENT WOULD REQUIRE THE PRESIDENT TO SUBMIT A PLAN TO CONGRESS BY MAR. 30, 1978 FOR THE TRANSFER OF THE COUNCIL'S FUNCTIONS TO OTHER AGENCIES.
TO PASS H.R. 6951, THE BILL EXTENDING UNTIL SEPT. 30, 1979 THE EXPIRATION DATE OF THE COUNCIL ON WAGE AND PRICE STABILITY ACT.
TO PASS H. RES. 804, A RESOLUTION STATING THAT THE HOUSE CONCURS IN THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO  H.R. 9290, THE BILL INCREASING THE TEMPORARY LIMIT ON THE PUBLIC DEBT.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 799, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 8410, THE LABOR  REFORM ACT OF 1977.

TO AMEND H.R. 8410 BY DELETING THE SO CALLED EQUAL ACCESS PROVISION, A PROVISION THAT STATES  THAT IF AN EMPLOYER TAKES TIME DURING COMPANY HOURS TO ADDRESS HIS EMPLOYEES ON ISSUES RELATED TO A REPRESENTATION ELECTION, THEN THE LABOR UNION SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO SPEND AN EQUAL AMOUNT OF TIME ADDRESSING EMPLOYEES DURING COMPANY HOURS.

TO OFFER A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8410 THAT PROVIDES THE EMPLOYER WITH AN EQUAL RIGHT TO  ADDRESS EMPLOYEES IN UNION HALLS, AND EXPANDS THE EQUAL ACCESS PROVISIONS OF THE BILL TO COVER ALL TYPES OF LABOR RELATED ELECTIONS.

TO AMEND H.R. 8410 SO AS TO PERMIT AN AGGRIEVED PARTY TO COME FOR APPEAL OF RULES OF TIMELINESS  TO EITHER THE U.S. COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA OR TO THE COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE AREA WHERE THE PARTY RESIDES.

TO AMEND THE CORNELL SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR THE QUIE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 631) TO H.R. 8410.  THE ERLENBORN AMENDMENT REQUIRES THE NATIONAL LABOR RELATIONS BOARD TO ORDER A UNION ELECTION WITHIN TWENTY DAYS OF THE FILING OF A PETITION AND REQUIRES THE BOARD TO SPECIFY A TWENTY-EIGHT DAY TO NINETY DAY DEADLINE FOR CONDUCTING THE ELECTION.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8410 THAT REQUIRES THE NATIONAL LABOR RELATIONS  BOARD TO ORDER A UNION ELECTION WITHIN SEVENTEEN DAYS OF THE FILING OF THE PETITION AND TO SPECIFY A TWENTY-FIVE DAY TO SEVENTY-FIVE DAY DEADLINE FOR CONDUCTING THE ELECTION.
TO AMEND H.R. 8410 BY DELETING THE PROVISION FOR DEBARMENT OF FEDERAL CONTRACTS TO WILLFUL  OR REPEATED VIOATORS OF THIS ACT.
TO AMEND H.R. 8410 SO AS TO GRANT TO THE SECRETARY OF LABOR THE AUTHORITY  TO REMOVE OR REDUCE ORDERS FOR DEBARMENT OF FEDERAL CONTRACTS TO WILLFUL OR REPEATED VIOLATORS OF THIS ACT.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 798, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 4297, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS  FOR FISCAL 1978 FOR PROGRAMS AND SERVICES FUNDED UNDER THE MARINE PROTECTION, RESEARCH, AND SANCTUARIES ACT OF 1972.

TO AMEND H.R. 8410 BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT AUTHORIZES THE NATIONAL LABOR RELATIONS BOARD  TO COMPENSATE LOSSES OF WAGES AND FRINGE BENEFITS THAT OCCUR WHEN A FIRST CONTRACT HAS BEEN DELAYED DUE TO THE EMPLOYER'S REFUSAL TO BARGAIN.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 8410 TO THE COMMITTEE ON EDUCATION AND LABOR WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT IT BACK  WITH AN AMENDMENT DIRECTING THE NATIONAL LABOR RELATIONS BOARD TO PROTECT FREEDOM OF EXPRESSION WHICH DOES NOT CONTAIN THREAT OR PROMISE BY INSURING THAT SUCH EXPRESSION WILL NOT RESULT IN THE INVALIDATION OF A UNION ELECTION.
TO RECOMMIT THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 7797 TO THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE.  H.R. 7797 IS THE  BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FOREIGN ASSISTANCE AND RELATED PROGRAMS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.

TO TABLE THE PERKINS MOTION THAT THE HOUSE DISAGREE TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 3744, THE  FAIR LABOR STANDARDS ACT OF 1977, AND REQUEST A CONFERENCE WITH THE SENATE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF SECTION 12 OF THE ACT.  H.R. 3744, AS MODIFIED BY THE SENATE AMENDMENT, SETS THE MINIMUM WAGE AT $2.65 IN 1978, $2.85 IN 1979, AND $3.05 IN 1980.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 819, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H. RES. 766, A RESOLUTION PROPOSING EXTENSIVE  REFORM OF THE ADMINISTRATIVE ORGANIZATION AND THE LEGISLATIVE MANAGEMENT SERVICES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE FROM ITS AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT #82 (SEE RC 594) TO H.R. 7555,  THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.  THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT FORBIDS THAT THE APPROPRIATED FUNDS BE USED FOR ABORTIONS EXCEPT IN CASES WHERE THE MOTHER'S LIFE WOULD BE ENDANGERED IF THE FETUS WERE CARRIED TO TERM.

TO CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #82 (SEE RC 594) AS MODIFIED BY AN AMENDMENT THAT ALLOWS USE OF THE APPROPRIATED FUNDS FOR ABORTIONS WHERE THE MOTHER'S LIFE WOULD BE ENDANGERED BY THE PREGNANCY, AND FOR CERTAIN "MEDICAL PROCEDURES" PERFORMED AS PROMPT TREATMENT FOR VICTIMS OF RAPE AND INCEST WHOSE PREGNANCY HAS NOT YET  BEEN ESTABLISHED.
TO AMEND H.R. 3816, THE FEDERAL TRADE COMMISSION AMENDMENTS OF 1977, BY STRIKING THE SECTION THAT AUTHORIZES CLASS OR INDIVIDUAL ACTION CONSUMER SUITS ON RULINGS OF THE FEDERAL TRADE COMMISSION.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 698)  TO H.R. 9346. THE FISHER AMENDMENT STRIKES PROVISIONS THAT REQUIRE SOCIAL SECURITY COVERAGE FOR EMPLOYEES OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, AND PROVIDES FOR AN HEW STUDY ON THE ISSUE OF UNIVERSAL COVERAGE.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 9346 THAT STRIKES PROVISIONS REQUIRING SOCIAL SECURITY COVERAGE FOR EMPLOYEES OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE ORIGINAL COMMITTEE AMENDMENT DELETED ONLY THE REQUIREMENT OF SOCIAL SECURITY COVERAGE FOR FEDERAL EMPLOYEES, AND CALLED FOR A MORE COMPREHENSIVE STUDY ON THE ISSUE OF UNIVERSAL COVERAGE.
TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY SLOWING THE INCREASE IN THE TAXABLE WAGE BASE AND SIMULTANEOUSLY  RAISING THE SOCIAL SECURITY TAX RATE BY O.1% A YEAR.

TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY STRIKING PROVISIONS THAT GRANTED A "STANDBY AUTHORITY" TO THE SOCIAL  SECURITY SYSTEM TO BORROW FROM THE GENERAL TREASURY WHEN SOCIAL SECURITY TRUST FUNDS FALL BELOW THE 25% RESERVE RATIO.
TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY DISCONTINUING THE MINIMUM SOCIAL SECURITY CASH BENEFIT PROVISION AFTER 1978.
TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY PHASING OUT BY 1982 THE CEILING ON THE INCOME THAT AN INDIVIDUAL AGE 65 TO 72 CAN EARN WITHOUT LOSING HIS OR HER SOCIAL SECURITY BENEFITS.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H. RES. 827,  THE RESOLUTION DISAPPROVING PRESIDENT CARTER'S SECOND REORGANIZATION PLAN OF 1977 (SEE RC 749).

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 827, THE RESOLUTION EXPRESSING DISAPPROVAL OF PRESIDENT CARTER'S SECOND  REORGANIZATION PLAN OF 1977. THE PRESIDENT'S SECOND PLAN PROPOSES THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN INTERNATIONAL COMMUNICATION AGENCY TO REPLACE THE U.S. INFORMATION AGENCY AND THE BUREAU OF EDUCATIONAL AND CULTURAL AFFAIRS.

THAT THE HOUSE CONCUR IN THE MOST RECENT SENATE AMENDMENT TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 645)  TO SENATE AMENDMENT #82 (SEE RC 594) TO H.R. 7555, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL 1978. THE SENATE AMENDMENT UNDER CONSIDERATION HERE WAS PROPOSED BY SENATOR BROOKE OF MASSACHUSETTS. IT AUTHORIZES THE USE OF FEDERAL FUNDS FOR ABORTION WHEN THE MOTHER'S LIFE WOULD BE ENDANGERED BY THE PREGNANCY, WHEN THE PREGNANCY WOULD CAUSE SEVERE AND LONG-LASTING PHYSICAL HEALTH DAMAGE TO THE MOTHER, OR WHEN THE MOTHER IS A VICTIM OF RAPE OR INCEST AND HAS REPORTED THE INCIDENT TO A LAW ENFORCEMENT OR PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE AGENCY.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE CONTE MOTION TO RECOMMIT H.R. 9375 TO THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INCREASE THE APPROPRIATION FOR AMTRAK FROM $8 MILLION TO $11.5 MILLION.  H.R. 9375 IS THE BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.
TO AMEND THE CONTE MOTION TO RECOMMIT H.R. 9375 TO THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE (SEE RC 753).  THE GORE AMENDMENT WOULD INSTRUCT THE CONFEREES TO INCREASE THE APPROPRIATION FOR AMTRAK TO $18 MILLION.
TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED MOTION TO RECOMMIT H.R. 9375 TO THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS  TO RAISE THE AMTRAK APPROPRIATION FROM $8 MILLION TO $18 MILLION.

TO INSTRUCT THE HOUSE CONFEREES ON H.R. 9346 TO INSIST ON LANGUAGE THAT WOULD PHASE OUT THE  EARNINGS LIMITATIONS FOR SOCIAL SECURITY RECIPIENTS AGE 65 TO 72 BY 1982.

TO AGREE TO H. CON. RES. 432, A RESOLUTION EXPRESSING THE SENSE OF CONGRESS THAT NATIONAL  HEALTH PLANNING GUIDELINES SHOULD RECOGNIZE THE SPECIAL CHARACTERISTICS AND NEEDS OF RURAL POPULATIONS.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 917, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H. J. RES. 662, THE RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING  FURTHER APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1978 FOR THOSE DEPARTMENTS WHOSE APPROPRIATIONS BILLS HAVE NOT YET BEEN ENACTED.

TO MODIFY THE MAHON AMENDMENT TO H. J. RES. 662.  THE MAHON AMENDMENT ADDS LANGUAGE PROVIDING FOR CONTINUING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE. THE MICHEL AMENDMENT MODIFIES THE MAHON AMENDMENT TO INCLUDE A CLAUSE PROHIBITING USE OF THE CONTINUED FUNDS FOR ABORTIONS EXCEPT FOR CERTAIN MEDICAL PROCEDURES FOR VICTIMS OF RAPE OR INCEST THAT HAVE REPORTED THE INCIDENT PROMPTLY, OR WHEN SEVERE AND LONG-LASTING PHYSICAL HEALTH DAMAGE WOULD RESULT TO THE MOTHER IF THE FETUS WERE CARRIED TO TERM.

TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #29 TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 9375, THE BILL  MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL APPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978. THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #43 TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 9375.  SENATE AMENDMENT #43 RESCINDS THE $462 MILLION APPROPRIATION FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE B-1 BOMBER.

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6666, THE BILL EXTENDING THE FUNDING OF THE LEGAL SERVICES ACT THROUGH FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO CONSIDER H. RES. 928, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H. J. RES. 622 AND TO CONCUR IN THE SENATE  AMENDMENTS THERETO. H. J. RES. 622 AUTHORIZES FURTHER APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1978 FOR THOSE DEPARTMENTS WHOSE 1978 APPROPRIATIONS BILLS HAVE NOT YET BEEN ENACTED.

THAT THE HOUSE CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H. J. RES. 622, INCLUDING AN AMENDMENT ON ABORTION. TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3722, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE  SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION FOR FISCAL 1978.

TO CONSIDER H. RES. 929, THE RULE TO CONSIDER THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H. J. RES. 622, THE BILL  MAKING FURTHER CONTINUING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1978.

TO CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #2 TO H. J. RES. 622. AMENDMENT #2 PROHIBITS THE USE OF THE SUPPLEMENTAL HEW FUNDS FOR ABORTION EXCEPT WHEN THE MOTHER'S LIFE WOULD BE ENDANGERED IF THE FETUS WERE CARRIED TO TERM, WHEN SEVERE AND LONG-LASTING PHYSICAL HEALTH DAMAGE WOULD RESULT TO THE MOTHER AS "DETERMINED BY TWO PHYSICIANS" AND FOR CERTAIN MEDICAL PROCEDURES TO TREAT VICTIMS OF RAPE OR INCEST THAT HAVE REPORTED THE INCIDENT PROMPTLY TO A LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY OR A HEALTH SERVICE AGENCY.

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3199, THE BILL AMENDING THE FEDERAL WATER POLLUTION CONTROL ACT OF 1972 AND AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR A NATIONAL SEWAGE TREATMENT PROGRAM.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 937, THE RULE TO CONSIDER THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 9346, THE SOCIAL SECURITY FINANCING AMENDMENTS OF 1977.
