TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 8811, THE BILL AMENDING THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1954 SO AS TO ALLOW ANY JUDGE OR FORMER JUDGE OF THE TAX COURT TO REVOKE HIS OR HER ELECTION TO THE TAX COURT RETIREMENT PAY SYSTEM.

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1585, THE BILL PROHIBITING THE USE OF CHILDREN UNDER AGE SIXTEEN IN SEXUALLY EXPLICIT CONDUCT FOR THE PROMOTION OF ANY FILM, PHOTOGRAPH, NEGATIVE, SLIDE, BOOK, MAGAZINE OR LIVE PERFORMANCE.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 964, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 1614, THE BILL AMENDING THE OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF LANDS ACT OF 1953 WITH RESPECT TO ALTERNATIVE BIDDING SYSTEMS AND TO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION OF THE SHELF LANDS.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 1614, AS REPORTED BY THE AD HOC SELECT COMMITTEE ON THE OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF.  THE BREAUX SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT CONTAINS SEVERAL INDUSTRY-BACKED PROVISIONS INCLUDING A PROVISION FOR THE USE OF THE CASH BONUS BIDDING SYSTEM FOR THE ANNUAL LEASING OF AT LEAST 50% OF THE FEDERALLY OWNED SHELF LANDS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 1614, AS REPORTED BY THE AD HOC SELECT COMMITTEE ON THE OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF.  THE FISH SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT INCLUDES PROVISIONS FOR THE LIMITATION OF DUAL LEASING, THE LEGALIZATION OF JOINT BIDDING, THE LIMITATION OF ALTERNATIVE BIDDING SYSTEMS TO NO MORE THAN 30% OF THE LEASES, AND THE TRANSFER OF SAFETY REGULATORY POWER FROM OSHA TO THE COAST GUARD AND THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR.

TO PASS H.R. 5646, THE BILL AMENDING THE REGIONAL RAIL REORGANIZATION ACT OF 1973 SO AS TO REQUIRE CONRAIL TO MAKE PREMIUM PAYMENTS UNDER CERTAIN MEDICAL AND LIFE INSURANCE PLANS FOR SOME OF ITS RETIRED EMPLOYEES.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 9851, THE BILL AMENDING THE FEDERAL AVIATION ACT OF 1958 SO THAT CHARTER AIRLINES MAY PARTICIPATE IMMEDIATELY IN THE 1977 AIR CARGO DEREGULATION PROGRAM.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 1614, THE OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF LANDS ACTS AMENDMENTS OF 1977.  THE MODIFIED STUDDS AMENDMENT ALLOWS ONLY THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO AUTHORIZE GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL EXPLORATIONS OF THE OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF (OCS).
TO AMEND H.R. 1614 BY PROVIDING THAT IF THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR SHOULD DECIDE TO CANCEL AN OCS LEASE, THE LESSEE SHALL BE ENTITLED TO "JUST COMPENSATION" FOR LOSSES INCURRED.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE TREEN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 1614.  THE BROWN AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR THE USE OF THE SEVEN NEW ALTERNATIVE BIDDING SYSTEMS FOR NOT LESS THAN 10% NOR MORE THAN 30% OF THE TOTAL LEASE SALES IN THE NEXT FIVE YEARS.  THE ORIGINAL TREEN AMENDMENT GIVES THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR UNLIMITED AUTHORITY TO USE EITHER THE OLD OR THE NEW BIDDING SYSTEMS IN ANY PROPORTIONS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE TREEN AMENDMENT (SEE RC 23) TO  H.R. 1614.  THE ENERGY AMENDMENT MANDATES THE USE OF THE NEW ALTERNATIVE BIDDING SYSTEMS FOR NOT LESS THAN 20% NOR MORE THAN 50% OF THE TOTAL AREA TO BE LEASED IN THE NEXT FIVE YEARS.

TO AMEND H.R. 8200 BY EXPANDING THE JURISDICTION OF BANKRUPTCY COURTS, PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF BANKRUPTCY JUDGES BY THE COURTS OF APPEALS, LENGTHENING THE TERM OF JUDGES TO FIFTEEN YEARS, AND PLACING THE U.S. TRUSTEES UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE JUDICIAL CONFERENCE. THIS AMENDMENT WAS PREVIOUSLY ADOPTED BY THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON OCT. 28, 1977 (SEE RC 712, SESSION 1).
TO AMEND H.R. 1614 BY DELETING THE SECTION THAT REQUIRES THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO RANDOMLY SELECT THE AREAS THAT WILL BE LEASED UNDER THE ALTERNATIVE BIDDING SYSTEMS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE MURPHY (NY) AMENDMENT (SEE RC 31) TO H.R. 1614.  THE WHALEN AMENDMENT WOULD DELETE THE SECTION OF THE BILL THAT REQUIRES DOCUMENTATION, REGISTRY AND EMPLOYMENT OF U.S. NATIONALS IN FACILITIES AND VESSELS USED FOR OCS OPERATIONS.

TO AMEND H.R. 1614 BY REQUIRING THAT SIX MONTHS AFTER ENACTMENT OF THE BILL, THE COAST GUARD MUST ISSUE STANDARDS FOR THE DESIGN, CONSTRUCTION, ALTERATION AND REPAIR OF OCS VESSELS AND FACILITIES.  THE MURPHY AMENDMENT ALSO REQUIRES THAT ONE YEAR AFTER ENACTMENT OF THE BILL, ALL OCS VESSELS MUST BE MANNED BY AMERICAN CITIZENS OR PERMANENT RESIDENTS OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO AGREE TO SEVERAL AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 1614, THE EFFECT OF WHICH WOULD BE TO REQUIRE THAT 20% (OR UP TO $200 MILLION) OF OCS REVENUES BE SHARED WITH THE COASTAL STATES THAT ARE AFFECTED BY OFFSHORE DEVELOPMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 1614 BY ALLOWING THOSE COASTAL STATES THAT DO NOT HAVE FEDERALLY APPROVED COASTAL ZONE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS TO STILL RECEIVE THE COMPENSATION PROVIDED BY THE HUGHES AMENDMENT (SEE RC 33).
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 9434, THE BILL RAISING THE FISCAL 1978 CEILINGS ON FEDERAL FUNDING FOR THE MEDICAID PROGRAMS OF PUERTO RICO, GUAM AND THE VIRGIN ISLANDS.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 982, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 8336, THE BILL EXPANDING THE NATIONAL PARK SYSTEM OF THE UNITED STATES TO INCLUDE THE CHATTAHOOCHEE RIVER RECREATION AREA IN GEORGIA.

TO MODIFY THE FOLEY SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 40) FOR H.R. 6362, THE BILL ESTABLISHING A COMMITTEE TO ADVISE CONGRESS AND THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE ON THE SALE OF NATIONAL TIMBER LANDS.  THE KREBS AMENDMENT WOULD RETAIN THE PRESENT SEALED BIDDING SYSTEM.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 6362, THE BILL ESTABLISHING A COMMITTEE TO STUDY THE PROCEDURES FOR THE SALE OF NATIONAL FOREST TIMBER, AND MAKING RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE CONGRESS AND THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE.  THE FOLEY AMENDMENT CONTAINS THE LANGUAGE OF S. 1360, AND PROTECTS SMALLER TIMBER SALE BUSINESSES BY PROVIDING FOR THE OPTION OF ORAL BIDDING.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE BROOKS SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR H.R. 6805.  THE GLICKMAN AMENDMENT PROPOSES THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN INDEPENDENT OFFICE OF CONSUMER COUNSEL IN EACH OF THE TWENTY-THREE MAJOR DEPARTMENTS OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. THE ORIGINAL BROOKS SUBSTITUTE BILL CONTAINS THE TEXT OF H.R. 9718 AND WOULD ESTABLISH AN INDEPENDENT OFFICE OF CONSUMER REPRESENTATION IN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH THAT WOULD REPRESENT THE CONSUMER VIEWPOINT BUT WOULD HAVE NO REGULATORY AUTHORITY.
TO AMEND THE BROOKS SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 44) FOR H.R. 6805 BY REQUIRING THE OFFICE OF CONSUMER REPRESENTATION TO NOTIFY THE PRESIDENT THIRTY DAYS BEFORE FILING SUIT AGAINST A FEDERAL REGULATORY AGENCY.

TO AMEND THE BROOKS SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 44) FOR H.R. 6805 BY DELETING THE PROVISION THAT STATES THAT THE OFFICE OF CONSUMER REPRESENTATION MAY NOT INTERVENE IN THE LABOR PROCEEDINGS OF THE NATIONAL LABOR RELATIONS BOARD OR THE FEDERAL MEDIATION AND CONCILIATION SERVICE.

TO AMEND THE BROOKS SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 44) FOR H.R. 6805 BY DELETING A PROVISION THAT BARS THE OFFICE OF CONSUMER REPRESENTATION FROM INTERVENING IN THE INCOME PROTECTION PROCEEDINGS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 3813, THE BILL ENLARGING THE REDWOOD NATIONAL PARK IN THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA, TO THE COMMITTEE ON INTERIOR AND INSULAR DESIGN WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO DECREASE THE ADDITIONAL ACREAGE FROM 48,000 TO 14,000 ACRES AND TO STRIKE THE PROVISION FOR A 30,000 ACRE PROTECTION ZONE.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2664, THE BILL AMENDING THE INDIAN CLAIMS COMMISSION ACT OF 1946 WITH RESPECT TO THE SETTLEMENT OF THE BLACK HILLS CLAIM OF THE SIOUX INDIANS.

TO INSTRUCT THE HOUSE MANAGERS AT THE CONFERENCE ON H.R. 7843, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF ADDITIONAL DISTRICT AND CIRCUIT JUDGES, TO INSIST ON RETAINING THE SECTION OF THE HOUSE-PASSED BILL THAT DEALS WITH THE MERIT SELECTION OF DISTRICT COURT JUDGES.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 8336, THE BILL EXPANDING THE NATIONAL PARK SYSTEM TO INCLUDE THE CHATTAHOOCHEE RIVER RECREATION AREA IN GEORGIA.

TO AGREE TO SEVERAL COMMITTEE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 8336, THE EFFECT OF WHICH WOULD BE TO REQUIRE PARTIAL FUNDING AND LONG-TERM MANAGEMENT OF THE ADDITIONAL PARK LANDS BY THE STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 10979, THE BILL AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR THE IMMEDIATE REPAIR OF CERTAIN HIGHWAYS AND URBAN MASS TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS THAT HAVE BEEN DAMAGED BY THE SEVERE STORMS OF THE WINTER OF 1977-1978.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H. J. RES. 649, A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO CALL FOR A WHITE HOUSE CONFERENCE ON THE ARTS AND FOR A WHITE HOUSE CONFERENCE ON THE HUMANITIES IN 1979.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 10569, A BILL THAT EXTENDS THE AUTHORIZATIONS AND PROVISIONS OF THE ALCOHOL AND DRUG ABUSE EDUCATION ACT FOR AN ADDITIONAL FIVE YEARS.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 10606, A BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE HUBERT H. HUMPHREY INSTITUTE OF PUBLIC AFFAIRS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA.

TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #43 TO H.R. 9375, THE BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING SEPT. 30, 1978.  AMENDMENT #43 RESCINDS THE FUNDING FOR THE PRODUCTION OF THREE B-1 BOMBERS.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 990, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 9214, THE BILL AMENDING THE BRETTON WOODS AGREEMENTS ACT AND AUTHORIZING U.S. PARTICIPATION IN THE SUPPLEMENTARY FINANCING FACILITY OF THE INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND.

TO AGREE TO A TECHNICAL AMENDMENT TO A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 9214.  THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT SETS FORTH THE SALARIES OF THE U.S. EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND THE ALTERNATE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND.  THE NEAL AMENDMENT MODIFIES THE ORIGINAL AMENDMENT WITH RESPECT TO THE TITLES OF THE EXECUTIVE PERSONNEL.

TO AMEND H.R. 9179, THE OVERSEAS PRIVATE INVESTMENT CORPORATION AMENDMENTS ACT OF 1977, BY PROHITING OPIC LOANS OR GUARANTEES TO THE NATIONAL FINANCE CORPORATION OF PANAMA UNLESS THE HOUSE ADOPTS A RESOLUTION OF APPROVAL.

TO AMEND H.R. 9179 BY PROHIBITING OPIC FROM OFFERING ANY FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO PROJECTS EXPANDING THE PRODUCTION OR PROCESSING OF CROPS OF PALM OIL, SUGAR OR CITRUS FRUITS FOR EXPORT IN COMPETITION WITH THE SAME U.S. CROPS.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 1024, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 9757, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR A ONE-YEAR MORATORIUM ON ANY PROPOSED INCREASES IN PUBLIC GRAZING FEES.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 1030, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 3377, A BILL DEALING WITH THE WICHITA INDIAN LAND CLAIMS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 3377, THE BILL DEALING WITH THE WICHITA INDIAN LAND CLAIMS.  THE RONCALIO SUBSTITUTE BILL DELETES LANGUAGE WAIVING THE DEFENSE OF RES JUDICATA AND COLLATERAL ESTOPPEL, LIMITS THE JURISDICTION OF THE ACT TO THE WICHITA, KEECHI, TAWACONIE AND WACO TRIBES, AND PROVIDES THAT ALL CLAIMS BE SUBJECT TO TRANSFER FROM THE INDIAN CLAIMS COMMISSION TO THE U.S. COURT OF CLAIMS.
TO AGREE TO H. CON. RES. 464, THE RESOLUTION AMENDING THE HOME RULE CHARTER OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA SO THAT ITS VOTERS MAY INITIATE LAWS AND DISAPPROVE COUNCIL ACTS BY WAY OF REFERENDUM.
TO AGREE TO H. CON. RES. 471, A RESOLUTION AMENDING THE HOME RULE CHARTER OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA SO THAT ITS VOTERS MAY RECALL AN ELECTED OFFICIAL OF THE DISTRICT.

TO SUSPND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 9622, THE BILL ABOLISHING THE USE OF "DIVERSITY OF CITIZENSHIP" AS A BASIS FOR REQUIRING FEDERAL DISTRICT COURT JURISDICTION IN CASES INVOLVING RESIDENTS OF SEVERAL STATES.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 1048, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H. J. RES. 554, THE RESOLUTION AMENDING THE U.S. CONSTITUTION TO PROVIDE FOR FULL VOTING REPRESENTATION OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H. J. RES. 715, THE RESOLUTION PROCLAIMING MAY 3, 1978 AS NATIONAL "SUN DAY," A DAY COMMEMORATING AND ENCOURAGING THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOLAR ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 10551, THE BILL ALLOWING THIRTEEN SCHOOL DISTRICTS IN THE UNITED STATES TO OPERATE THEIR COMPENSATORY EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR AN ADDITIONAL YEAR, DESPITE THE FACT THAT THEIR PROGRAMS ARE NOT PRESENTLY FUNDED UNDER TITLE I OF THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION ACT.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 1056, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 11180, THE BILL INCREASING THE PUBLIC DEBT LIMIT FOR AN ADDITIONAL YEAR AND PROVIDING THAT THEREAFTER THE LIMIT SHALL BE DECIDED BY MEANS OF A CONCURRENT BUDGET RESOLUTION.
TO AMEND H.R. 11180 BY STRIKING TITLE II OF THE BILL.  TITLE II STATES THAT THE LIMIT IN THE PUBLIC DEBT SHALL BE DECIDED THEREAFTER BY MEANS OF A CONCURENT BUDGET RESOLUTION.
TO PASS H. J. RES. 746, THE RESOLUTION MAKING URGENT SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY, SOUTHWESTERN POWER ADMINISTRATION, FOR THE REMAINDER OF FISCAL YEAR 1978.

TO MODIFY THE SARASIN AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 50.  THE WRIGHT AMENDMENTS REQUIRE THE PRESIDENT TO INCLUDE GOALS FOR REASONABLE PRICE STABILITY IN HIS ANNUAL ECONOMIC REPORTS, BEGINNING THE THIRD YEAR AFTER ENACTMENT OF THE BILL.  THE ORIGINAL SARASIN AMENDMENTS SET A SHORT-TERM GOAL OF 3% INFLATION WITHIN FIVE YEARS, A LONG-TERM GOAL OF NO INFLATION, AND PROHIBIT THE PRESIDENT FROM RECOMMENDING WAGE AND PRICE CONTROLS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE MODIFIED SARASIN AMENDMENTS (SEE  RC 125) TO H.R. 50. THE JEFFORDS AMENDMENT REQUIRES THE PRESIDENT TO INCLUDE GOALS FOR REASONABLE PRICE STABILITY IN HIS ANNUAL REPORTS BEGINNING THE THIRD YEAR AFTER ENACTMENT OF THE BILL, AND DEFINES PRICE STABILITY ACCORDING TO A GOAL OF 3% INFLATION TO BE REACHED FIVE YEARS AFTER ENACTMENT OF THE BILL.

TO AMEND H.R. 50 BY REQUIRING THAT THE PRESIDENT'S ANNUAL ECONOMIC REPORT DIFFERENTIATE BETWEEN INCREASES IN EMPLOYMENT IN PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR JOBS AND INCREASES IN EMPLOYMENT IN TEMPORARY PUBLIC SERVICE JOBS.
TO AGREE TO SEVERAL AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 50, THE EFFECT OF WHICH IS TO SET A GOAL OF 100% OF PARITY IN THE MARKETPLACE FOR AMERICAN FARMERS WITHIN FIVE YEARS OF THE ENACTMENT OF THE BILL.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE ULLMAN MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 6635, THE BILL PROVIDING THAT INTEREST RATES PAID ON U.S. RETIREMENT PLAN AND INDIVIDUAL RETIREMENT BONDS MAY BE INCREASED TO THE INTEREST RATE PAID ON U.S. SERIES E SAVINGS BONDS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 7814, THE BILL AUTHORIZING THE CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION TO CONDUCT A THREE-YEAR EXPERIMENT ON THE USE OF FLEXIBLE AND COMPRESSED EMPLOYEE WORK SCHEDULES IN CERTAIN BRANCHES OF THE GOVERNMENT.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 10126, THE BILL INCREASING THE NUMBER OF PERMANENT PART-TIME EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 9146, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL REVIEW OF PROPOSED CHANGES IN THE POSTAL SERVICE.

TO RECOMMIT H. RES. 1010 TO THE COMMITTEE ON HOUSE ADMINISTRATION WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT IT BACK FORTHWITH WITH AN AMENDMENT REQUIRING THAT A CERTAIN PORTION OF THE FUNDS BE EARMARKED FOR THE COMMITTEE'S INTERNAL SECURITY JURISDICTION.  H. RES. 1010 IS THE RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY.

TO RECOMMIT H. RES. 956 (SEE RC 137) TO THE COMMITTEE ON HOUSE ADMINISTRATION WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REDUCE THE FUNDING FOR THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON ASSASSINATIONS AND TO HOLD HEARINGS TO JUSTIFY THE CONTINUATION OF ITS FUNDING.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 956, THE RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON ASSASSINATIONS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 95TH CONGRESS.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE RONCALIO MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS S. 1671, THE BILL DESIGNATING APPROXIMATELY 904,500 ACRES OF NATIONAL FOREST LANDS IN THE STATE OF MONTANA AS THE ABSAROKA-BEARTOOTH WILDERNESS.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE ULLMAN MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 810, THE BILL AMENDING THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1954 SO THAT PRIVATE FOUNDATIONS MAY REIMBURSE GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS FOR A LIMITED AMOUNT OF THEIR FOREIGN TRAVEL EXPENSES.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE ULLMAN MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 2028, THE BILL AMENDING THE ALCOHOL TAX PROVISIONS OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1954 AND AUTHORIZING HOME PRODUCTION OF BEER AND WINE.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS S. 1671, THE BILL DESIGNATING APPROXIMATELY 904,500 ACRES OF NATIONAL FOREST LANDS IN THE STATE OF MONTANA AS THE ABSAROKA-BEARTOOTH WILDERNESS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 810, THE BILL AMENDING THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1954 SO THAT PRIVATE FOUNDATIONS MAY REIMBURSE GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS FOR A LIMITED AMOUNT OF THEIR FOREIGN TRAVEL EXPENSES.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3813, THE BILL EXPANDING THE ACREAGE OF THE REDWOOD NATIONAL PARK IN THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA.
THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 50, THE FULL EMPLOYMENT AND BALANCED GROWTH ACT OF 1978.

TO MODIFY THE BAUCUS SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENTS (SEE RC 153) FOR THE ORIGINAL ASHBROOK AMENDMENTS (SEE RC 153) TO H.R. 50. THE MODIFYING ASHBROOK AMENDMENTS STATE THAT ONE OF THE PURPOSES OF THIS ACT SHALL BE THE ACHIEVEMENT OF A BALANCED FEDERAL BUDGET THAT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE UNEMPLOYMENT GOALS SET FORTH IN THE BILL, AND THAT IS CONSISTENT WITH A POLICY DESIGNED TO ACHIEVE A FULLY BALANCED BUDGET BY 1983.

TO AGREE TO SEVERAL AMENDMENTS OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE ASHBROOK AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 50.  THE BAUCUS AMENDMENTS AFFIRM THAT ONE OF THE PURPOSES OF THIS ACT SHALL BE THE ACHIEVEMENT OF A BALANCED BUDGET THAT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE UNEMPLOYMENT GOALS SET FORTH ELSEWHERE IN THE BILL.  THE ORIGINAL ASHBROOK AMENDMENTS STATE THAT ONE OF THE PURPOSES OF THE ACT SHALL BE THE ACHIEVEMENT OF A BALANCED FEDERAL BUDGET BY 1983.
TO AMEND H.R. 50 BY REQUIRING THE PRESIDENT TO MAKE PERMANENT TAX RATE REDUCTIONS FOR INDIVIDUALS AND CORPORATIONS IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THE FULL EMPLOYMENT GOALS SET FORTH IN THIS ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 50 BY DIRECTING THE PRESIDENT TO FUND SOME PROGRAMS ALREADY ESTABLISHED BY LAW AS MAJOR NATIONAL PRIORITIES, ESPECIALLY PROGRAMS FOR THE REMOVAL OF ARCHITECTURAL BARRIERS TO THE HANDICAPPED.

TO AMEND H.R. 50 BY PROVIDING THAT THE UNEMPLOYMENT STATISTICS USED FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS ACT SHALL NOT INCLUDE PERSONS UNEMPLOYED BECAUSE OF STRIKES, PERSONS SEEKING PART-TIME WORK, PERSONS WHO VOLUNTARILY LEFT THEIR OLD JOBS OR ARE WITHOLDING FROM ACCEPTING AN AWAITING JOB, AND PERSONS WHO HAVE BEEN UNEMPLOYED FOR LESS THAN FOUR WEEKS.
THAT THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE RISE FROM THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 50 AND REPORT THE BILL BACK TO THE HOUSE WITH THE ENACTING CLAUSE STRICKEN.

TO AMEND H.R. 50 BY REQUIRING THE PRESIDENT, IN HIS EFFORTS TO ACHIEVE THE GOALS OF THIS ACT, TO CONSIDER THE IMPACT ON THE NATIONAL ECONOMY OF ALL THE PROVISIONS OF THE UNITED STATES CODE AND OF THE CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS.

TO MODIFY THE COMMITTEE SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR TITLE III OF H.R. 50.  THE CONABLE AMENDMENT PERMITS THE NEW JOINT ECONOMIC COMMITTEE TO SUBMIT AMENDMENTS TO THE FIRST CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE BUDGET.  THE ORIGINAL COMMITTEE SUBSTITUTE PERMITS THE JOINT ECONOMIC COMMITTEE TO SUBMIT ITS OWN ANNUAL CONCURRENT RESOLUTIONS ON THE BUDGET.
TO AMEND H.R. 50 BY TERMINATING THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT ON SEPT. 30, 1983, UNLESS AN  EXTENSION OF THE PROVISIONS IS OTHERWISE AUTHORIZED BY CONGRESS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 50.  THE QUIE SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT SETS NATIONAL GOALS OF 4% UNEMPLOYMENT AMONG AMERICANS AGE 16 TO 19, OF 3% UNEMPLOYEMNT AMONG AMERICANS AGE 20 AND OVER, AND OF NO MORE THAN 3% ANNUAL INCREASE IN INFLATION.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE FORD (MI) MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 11274, THE BILL AMENDING TITLE IV OF THE HIGHER EDUCATION ACT OF 1965 WITH RESPECT TO THE AVAILABILITY OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO MIDDLE-INCOME STUDENTS.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 996, AS AMENDED, A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR THE HOUSE SUBCOMMITTEE ON INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE SIMON AMENDMENT (SEE RC 193) TO H.R. 7700.  THE ALLEN AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE U.S. POSTAL SERVICE FROM REDUCING ITS PARCEL POST RATES TO LEVELS THAT WOULD UNDERCUT THE RATES OF COMPARABLE BUSINESSES IN THE PRIVATE SECTOR.

TO AMEND H.R. 7700 BY REINSTATING THE ORIGINAL LANGUAGE OF THE BILL THAT PROVIDED FOR CONGRESSIONAL REVIEW OF RATE, FEE, AND CLASSIFICATION DECISIONS OF THE U.S. POSTAL COMMISSION.

TO AMEND H.R. 7700 BY REQUIRING THE POSTMASTER GENERAL TO SUBMIT AN ANNUAL REPORT TO CONGRESS THAT DETAILS THE POSTAL SERVICE'S EXPENDITURE OF PUBLIC SERVICE FUNDS FOR THE PRECEDING FISCAL YEAR, AND DESCRIBES THE ESTIMATED EXPENDITURE OF PUBLIC SERVICE FUNDS FOR THE COMING FISCAL YEAR.
TO PASS H.R. 10899, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR FEDERAL REGULATION OF FOREIGN BANKS LOCATED IN THE UNITED STATES.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 10878, THE BILL EXTENDING THE VOLUNTARY INSURANCE PROGRAM AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 7 OF THE FISHERMEN'S PROTECTIVE ACT UNTIL OCT. 1, 1981.

TO AMEND H.R. 12930 BY RESTORING A $4.2 MILLION AUTHORIZATION FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AND INVESTIGATIVE ACTIVITIES OF THE BUREAU OF ALCOHOL, TOBACCO AND FIREARMS, AND BY STRIKING LANGUAGE BARRING THE USE OF FUNDS FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF COMPUTERIZED FIREARM REGULATION.

TO AMEND H.R. 12929, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.  THE MICHEL AMENDMENT REDUCES THE APPROPRIATION FOR HEW BY $1 BILLION.
TO AGREE TO H. J. RES. 945, THE RESOLUTION MAKING AN URGENT SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATION FOR THE BLACK LUNG PROGRAM OF THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 1219, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 12933, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND RELATED AGENCIES FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 12441, THE BILL INCREASING THE FISCAL YEAR 1979 AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE TOXIC SUBSTANCES CONTROL ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 12933, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND RELATED AGENCIES FOR FISCAL YAEAR 1979.  THE SHUSTER AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE USE OF FUNDS TO IMPLEMENT OR ENFORCE ANY REGULATION WHICH REQUIRES VEHICLES TO BE EQUIPPED WITH OCCUPANT RESTRAINT SYSTEMS OTHER THAN SEAT BELTS.
TO AMEND H.R. 12933 BY INSURING THAT FUNDS MAY BE USED FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF OCCUPANT RESTRAINT SYSTEMS, AND FOR ANY COURT ACTIONS CONCERNING THE REGULATION OF SUCH SYSTEMS.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 12929, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.
TO AMEND H.R. 12929 BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT PROHIBITS USE OF THE AUTHORIZED FUNDS FOR ABORTIONS, EXCEPT WHERE THE LIFE OF THE MOTHER WOULD BE ENDANGERED IF THE FETUS WERE CARRIED TO TERM.

TO AMEND H.R. 12929 BY STRIKING THE ABORTION PROVISION (SEE RC 443) AND REPLACING IT WITH THE EXACT COMPROMISE LANGUAGE ON ABORTION FUNDING THAT WAS APPROVED BY THE SENATE AND THE HOUSE DURING THE FIRST SESSION OF THE 95TH CONGRESS (SEE RC 775, SESSION 1).
TO AMEND H.R. 12929 BY PROHIBITING USE OF FUNDS TO ISSUE OR ENFORCE ANY RATIO, QUOTA, OR OTHER ADMISSIONS OR HIRING FORMULA RELATED TO RACE, CREED, COLOR, NATIONAL ORIGIN, OR SEX.
TO AMEND H.R. 12929 BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION BY $28.4 MILLION.
THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 12935, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATIVE BRANCH FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 12934, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF STATE, OF JUSTICE AND OF COMMERCE, AND FOR THE JUDICIARY FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.
TO AMEND H.R. 12934 BY PROHIBITING THAT THE FUNDS APPROPRIATED FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE BE USED TO PROMOTE OR TO CONDUCT TRADE RELATIONS WITH CUBA.

TO AMEND H.R. 12934 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF ANY PART OF THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE LEGAL SERVICES CORPORATION FOR PROPROGANDA OR PUBLICITY DESIGNED TO SUPPORT OR DEFEAT ANY PIECE OF STATE OR FEDERAL LEGISLATION.

description: TO AMEND H.R. 12935, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATIVE BRANCH FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATIONS NOT REQUIRED BY LAW BY 5%.

TO AMEND H.R. 12935 BY PROVIDING THAT NONE OF THE FUNDS CONTAINED IN THIS BILL MAY BE USED TO PURCHASE NEW COLOR TELEVISION CAMERAS OR RELATED EQUIPMENT NEEDED TO BROADCAST HOUSE PROCEEDINGS, WITHOUT THE PRIOR APPROVAL OF THE HOUSE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF H. RES. 866 (SEE RC 709, SESSION 1).
TO AMEND H.R. 12935 BY REQUIRING THAT THE TELEVISION CAMERAS PURCHASED FOR COVERAGE OF THE PROCEEDINGS OF THE HOUSE MUST BE OPERATED AND CONTROLLED BY EMPLOYEES OF THE HOUSE.

TO AMEND H.R. 12935 BY PROVIDING THAT CALENDARS, PLANTS, YEARBOOKS AND TRUNKS PREVIOUSLY DISTRIBUTED WITHOUT CHARGE FOR USE IN THE MEMBERS' OFFICES SHALL BE CHARGED TO THE SEPARATE MEMBERS' OFFICE EXPENSE ACCOUNTS.
TO AGREE TO H. RES. 1236, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 12928, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR PUBLIC WORKS FOR ENERGY RESEARCH AND FOR WATER AND POWER DEVELOPMENT FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO AGREE TO SEVERAL AMENDMENTS TO THE BEVILL AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12928.  THE JACOBS AMENDMENTS WOULD DELETE FUNDING FOR THE RUSSELL DAM IN GEORGIA AND SOUTH CAROLINA, THE BONNEVILLE UNIT IN UTAH, AND THE O'NEILL UNIT IN NEBRASKA. THE BEVILL AMENDMENT TO THE BILL ADDS FUNDING FOR ELEVEN WATER PROJECTS RECOMMENDED BY THE ADMINISTRATION.

TO AMEND H.R. 12928 BY DELETING FUNDING FOR THE NARROWS UNIT IN COLORADO, YATESVILLE LAKE IN KENTUCKY, BAYOU BODCAU IN LOUISIANA, LAFARGE LAKE IN WISCONSIN, LUKFATA LAKE IN OKLAHOMA, MERAMEC PARK LAKE IN MISSOURI, FRUITLAND MESA IN COLORADO AND THE SAVERY-POT HOOK PROJECT IN COLORADO.
TO AMEND H.R. 12928 BY BARRING USE OF THE FUNDS FOR PRODUCTION OF THE NEUTRON BOMB.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 12928 TO THE COMMITTEE ON APPROPRIATIONS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT IT BACK FOTHWITH WITH AN AMENDMENT THAT WOULD REDUCE THE APPROPRIATIONS NOT REQUIRED BY LAW BY 3%.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 12936, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.
TO AMEND H.R. 12936 BY DECREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR EPA ABATEMENT AND CONTROL ACTIVITES BY $114.6 MILLION AND THE APPROPRIATION FOR EPA ENFORCEMENT ACITIVITIES BY $18.9 MILLION.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 12936 TO THE COMMITTEE ON APPROPRIATIONS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT IT BACK FORTHWITH WITH AN AMENDMENT REDUCING THE APPROPRIATIONS NOT REQUIRED BY LAW BY 2%.

TO MODIFY THE MOFFETT AMENDMENT (SEE RC 476) TO H.R. 12932 BY LIMITING THE FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR EXPENSES OF CITIZENS INTERVENING IN REGULATORY PROCEEDINGS BEFORE THE ECONOMIC REGULATORY ADMINISTRATION TO NO MORE THAN $100,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 12932 BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT WOULD PROHIBIT USE OF THESE FUNDS TO COVER THE EXPENSES OF CITIZENS INTERVENING IN REGULATORY PROCEEDINGS BEFORE THE ECONOMIC REGULATORY ADMINISTRATION.

THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 13125, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND RELATED AGENCIES FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO AMEND H.R. 13125 BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATIONS NOT REQUIRED BY LAW BY 2%, EXCEPT FOR THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH SERVICE, THE COOPERATIVE STATE RESEARCH SERVICE, AND THE EXTENSION SERVICE.
TO PASS H.R. 12505, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT AND DEMONSTRATION OF SATELLITES DESIGNED TO COLLECT SOLAR ENERGY AND TRANSMIT IT TO EARTH TO GENERATE ELECTRICITY.

TO AMEND H.R. 11493, THE AMTRAK INPROVEMENT ACT OF 1978, BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT REQUIRES AMTRAK TO MAKE PURCHASES EXCEEDING $100,000 ONLY FROM U.S. PRODUCERS AND MANUFACTURERS, EXCEPT WHEN WAIVED BY THE SECRETARY OF TRANSPORTATION.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 11493.  THE MODIFIED MADIGAN AMENDMENT STATES THAT IF THE FEDERAL SUBSIDY FOR A CERTAIN PASSENGER TRAIN IS, ON THE AVERAGE, MORE THAN $100 PER PASSENGER OVER A TWELVE-MONTH PERIOD, THEN THAT PARTICULAR PASSENGER SERVICE SHALL BE DISCONTINUED, PROVIDED THAT THERE ARE ALTERNATIVE MEANS OF COMMON CARRIER TRANSPORTATION FOR USE BY THE PUBLIC IN THAT AREA.

TO AMEND H.R. 11493 BY AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT'S SPECIAL TRADE REPRESENTATIVE, INSTEAD OF THE SECRETARY OF TRANSPORTATION, TO WAIVE THE REQUIREMENT THAT AMTRAK MAKE ALL PURCHASES THAT EXCEED $100,000 ONLY FROM AMERICAN PRODUCERS AND MANUFACTURERS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 10341, THE BILL AMENDING TITLE 10 OF THE UNITED STATES CODE SO THAT MEMBERS OF THE ARMY OR AIR FORCE RESERVES THAT HAVE COMPLETED OVER TWENTY YEARS OF ACTIVE DUTY WILL BE ELIGIBLE FOR FULL RETIREMENT BENEFITS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 10342, THE BILL REVISING THE RULES FOR CALCULATION OF RETIRED PAY FOR MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES WHO WERE RECALLED TO ACTIVE DUTY FOR TWO OR MORE YEARS DURING THE PERIOD EXTENDING FROM OCT. 1, 1963 THROUGH SEPT. 30, 1973.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, S. 666, THE BILL EXTENDING CERTAIN RETIREMENT BENEFITS TO NON-INDIAN EMPLOYEES IN THE BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS AND IN THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE WHO WERE ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY OTHER PREFERENTIAL PROMOTIONAL POLICIES OF THE TWO AGENCIES.
TO REFER THE PRESIDENT'S VETO MESSAGE ON H.R. 3161, AND THE ACCOMPANYING BILL, TO THE COMMITTEE ON POST OFFICE AND CIVIL SERVICE.  H.R. 3161 REDUCES THE BASIC WORKWEEK OF FEDERAL FIREFIGHTERS.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE ROBERTS MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 11886, THE BILL INCREASING THE RATES OF DISABILITY COMPENSATION FOR VETERANS, AND THE RATES OF DEPENDENCY AND INDEMNITY COMPENSATION FOR THEIR SURVIVORS.
TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE ROBERTS MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 11888, THE BILL LOWERING THE MINIMUM DISABILITY RATE REQUIRED FOR ELIGIBILITY FOR DEPENDENCY ALLOWANCES.
TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE ULLMAN MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 12841, THE BILL PROHIBITING THE ISSUANCE OF REGULATIONS ON THE TAXATION OF FRINGE BENEFITS UNTIL 1980.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE BINGHAM MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 12589, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979 FOR STUDIES ON FOREIGN INVESTMENT IN THE UNITED STATES AND ON U.S. INVESTMENTS ABROAD.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 11888, THE BILL LOWERING THE MINIMUM SERVICE-CONNECTED DISABILITY RATE REQUIRED FOR ELIGIBILITY FOR DEPENDENCY ALLOWANCES FROM 50% TO 40%.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 10173, THE BILL IMPROVING PENSION BENEFITS FOR VETERANS, AND FOR SURVIVORS OF VETERANS OF THE MEXICAN BORDER PERIOD, WORLD WAR I, WORLD WAR II, THE KOREAN CONFLICT AND THE VIETNAM WAR.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 12874, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR AN ACCELERATED FEDERAL PROGRAM OF RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, AND DEMONSTRATION OF SOLAR PHOTOVOLTAIC ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES.

TO AMEND H.R. 12433, THE HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ACT OF 1978, BY WAIVING THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE DAVIS-BACON ACT FOR MOST HOUSING REHABILITATION PROJECTS SPONSORED BY NEIGHBORHOOD NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 12433 BY PROVIDING THAT EITHER THE HOUSE OR THE SENATE CAN VETO ANY RULE OR REGULATION ISSUED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT (HUD).
TO AMEND H.R. 12433 BY REQUIRING HUD TO ADMINISTER A PREPURCHASE COUNSELING PROGRAM FOR FIRST-TIME PURCHASERS OF SINGLE FAMILY DWELLINGS THAT HAVE APPLIED FOR FHA MORTGAGES.
TO PASS H.R. 8099, THE BILL SETTLING THE WATER RIGHTS CLAIMS OF THE AK-CHIN INDIANS OF ARIZONA AND PROVIDING FOR THEIR TEMPORARY AND PERMANENT WATER NEEDS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H. J. RES. 1007, THE RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO DESIGNATE A WEEK INCLUDING THE 7TH AND 10TH OF MAY 1979 AS ASIAN/PACIFIC AMERICAN HERITAGE WEEK.

TO AMEND H.R. 12536, THE NATIONAL PARKS AND RECREATION ACT OF 1978, BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT ADDS A 75 MILE STRETCH OF THE DELAWARE RIVER TO THE WILD AND SCENIC RIVERS SYSTEM, AND THAT AUTHORIZES THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO ACQUIRE THE DELAWARE WATER GAP NATIONAL RECREATION AREA.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 11827, THE BILL AUTHORIZING ADDITIONAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR ENFORCEMENT OF THE SURFACE MINING CONTROL AND RECLAMATION ACT OF 1977.

TO AMEND H.R. 12536, THE NATIONAL PARKS AND RECREATION ACT OF 1978, BY STRIKING LANGUAGE THAT DESIGNATES 94% OF THE TOTAL ACREAGE OF GLACIER NATIONAL PARK AS NATIONAL WILDERNESS AND POTENTIAL WILDERNESS.
TO AMEND H.R. 12536 BY CHANGING THE BOUNDARY DESIGNATION FOR THE HELLS CANYON RECREATION AREA IN ORDER TO EXCLUDE THE BLUE JACKET MINING AREA.

TO AMEND H.R. 12536 BY PROVIDING FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A MASTER PLAN TO DELINEATE THE PORTIONS OF THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI THAT WILL BECOME PARTS OF THE WILD AND SCENIC RIVER SYSTEM.  THE OBERSTAR AMENDMENT STATES THAT THE PLAN SHALL BE SUBMITTED TO CONGRESS FOR ITS APPROVAL WITHIN ONE YEAR AFTER THE ENACTMENT OF THIS BILL.

TO TABLE THE ASHBROOK APPEAL OF A RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT SUSTAINED A POINT OF ORDER AGAINST THE ASHBROOK MOTION TO RECOMMIT S. CON. RES. 95 TO THE COMMITTEE ON INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT IT BACK FORTHWITH WITH AN AMENDMENT STATING THAT IT IS THE SENSE OF CONGRESS THAT THE U.S. REPRESENTATIVES TO THE SALT TALKS SHOULD BE WITHDRAWN AS FURTHER EVIDENCE OF U.S. COMMITMENT TO THIS RESOLUTION.  S. CON. RES. 95 IS A RESOLUTION CONDEMNING THE TRIALS OF ANATOLY SHCHARANSKY, VIKTORAS PETKUS, AND ALEKSANDR ILYICH GINZBURG.

TO AGREE TO S. CON. RES. 95, A RESOLUTION CONDEMNING THE TRIALS OF ANATOLY SHCHARANSKY, VIKTORAS PETKUS, AND ALEKSANDR ILYICH GINZBURG AND URGING THE U.S.S.R. TO SEEK A HUMANITARIAN RESOLUTION TO THESE CASES.

TO AMEND H.R. 15, THE BILL EXTENDING THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION ACT FOR AN ADDITIONAL FIVE YEARS, BY ALLOWING LOCAL EDUCATIONAL AGENCIES WHO HAVE COMPENSATORY EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO QUALIFY FOR INCENTIVE GRANTS, EVEN IF AN IDENTIFIABLE STATE-WIDE COMPENSATORY EDUCATION PROGRAM DOES NOT EXIST.
TO AMEND H.R. 15 BY RETAINING A PROVISION IN CURRENT LAW THAT COUNTS TWO-THIRDS, RATHER THAN 100%, OF THE CHILDREN FROM AFDC FAMILIES FOR THE PURPOSE OF ALLOCATING STATE COMPENSATORY EDUCATION FUNDS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE HOLT AMENDMENT TO H.R. 15.  THE KILDEE SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT PROHIBITS COMMUNITY EDUCATION GRANTS FOR ANY PROGRAM THAT DUPLICATES OR COMPETES WITH PUBLIC SERVICES ALREADY OFFERED BY STATE OR LOCAL AGENCIES, EXCEPT WHEN THE COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION DETERMINES THAT COLLABORATION EXISTS BETWEEN THE LOCAL EDUCATION AGENCY AND THE OTHER PUBLIC AGENCIES.  THE HOLT AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE AWARDING OF FEDERAL COMMUNITY EDUCATION GRANTS TO PROGRAMS THAT DUPLICATE EXISTING PUBLIC SERVICES, BUT ALLOWS THE GENERAL LOCAL GOVERNMENT, RATHER THAN THE COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION, TO WAIVE THIS REGULATION.

THAT THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE MEETINGS ON H.R. 10929, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FOR WEAPONS PROCUREMENT AND MILITARY RESEARCH IN FISCAL YEAR 1979, BE CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC WHEN ANY CLASSIFIED NATIONAL SECURITY INFORMATION IS UNDER CONSIDERATION.

TO AMEND H.R. 12163, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY FOR ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.  THE FLOWERS AMENDMENT DIRECTS THE SECRETARY OF ENERGY ONLY TO COMPLETE THE SYSTEM DESIGN AND COMPONENT TESTING FOR THE CLINCH RIVER BREEDER REACTOR PROJECT, AND AUTHORIZES THE SECRETARY TO CONDUCT A STUDY ON CONCEPTUAL DESIGNS FOR ADVANCED BREEDER REACTORS THAT UTILIZE URANIUM/PLUTONIUM AND URANIUM/THORIUM FUEL CYCLES.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 12232, THE BILL AUTHORIZING CERTAIN CHANGES IN THE PAYMENT OF MEMBERS OF THE NATIONAL COMMISSION ON UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION AND IN THE DATES FOR THE SUBMISSION OF THEIR REPORTS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 12380, THE BILL IMPOSING A TWO-YEAR LIMITATION ON THE TIME DURING WHICH AN INDIVIDUAL CAN RECEIVE ANY BENEFITS TO WHICH HE OR SHE IS ENTITLED UNDER THE FEDERAL-STATE EXTENDED UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION PROGRAM.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 10848, THE BILL ALLOWING ANY PERSON WHO APPLIES FOR SUPPLEMENTAL SECURITY INCOME DISABILITY PAYMENTS TO BE CONSIDERED PRESUMPTIVELY DISABLED IF, WITHIN THE FIVE YEARS PRECEDING THE APPLICATION, HE OR SHE HAD BEEN ELIGIBLE FOR SSI DISABILITY PAYMENTS BUT HAD LOST THEM BECAUSE OF THE SO-CALLED "WORK TEST."

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 12163 TO THE COMMITTEE ON SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT IT BACK FORTHWITH WITH AN AMENDMENT AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF ENERGY TO COMPLETE ONLY THE SYSTEM DESIGN AND COMPONENT TESTING FOR THE CLINCH RIVER BREEDER REACTOR PROJECT.  H.R. 12163 IS THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY FOR ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO ORDER A SECOND ON THE UDALL MOTION TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H. J. RES. 738, THE RESOLUTION PROTECTING THE CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS OF NATIVE AMERICANS TO PRACTICE THEIR TRADITIONAL RELIGIONS.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 12443, THE BILL WITHDRAWING THE HEMISPHERIC REQUIREMENTS OF THE IMMIGRATION AND NATIONALITY ACT AND PROVIDING FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A SELECT COMMISSION ON IMMIGRATION AND REFUGEE POLICY.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 12011, THE BILL INDEFINITELY EXTENDING THE AUTHORITY OF THE VETERANS' ADMINISTRATION TO HAVE CONTRACTS WITH PRIVATE HOSPITAL FACILITIES FOR THE CARE OF VETERANS LIVING IN ALASKA, HAWAII, AND OTHER U.S. TERRITORIES NOT CONTIGUOUS TO THE UNITED STATES.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 1172, THE RULE TO CONSIDER H.R. 11983, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE OPERATION OF THE FEDERAL ELECTION COMMISSION IN FISCAL YEAR 1979.
