Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO TABLE THE STEVENSON AMENDMENT #691 TO S. 926.  THIS AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE USE OF CAMPAIGN  CONTRIBUTIONS TO PAY FOR OFFICE EXPENSES.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO TABLE THE MODIFIED STEVENSON AMENDMENT #692 TO S. 926, AN AMENDMENT REDUCING FROM  $5,000 TO $3,000 THE AMOUNT THAT A PARTY COMMITTEE OR A POLITICAL ACTION COMMITTEE CAN CONTRIBUTE TO A CANDIDATE'S CAMPAIGN.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN A POINT OF ORDER AGAINST THE PACKWOOD AMENDMENT #715 TO S. 926, AN  AMENDMENT INCREASING THE INCOME TAX CREDIT FOR CONTRIBUTIONS TO FEDERAL CAMPAIGNS.  THE CHARGE OF UNCONSTITUTIONALITY IS BASED HERE ON THE CLAIM THAT THE PACKWOOD AMENDMENT INFRINGES ON THE SPECIAL RIGHTS AND PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.
TO TABLE THE HELMS AMENDMENT TO S. 926, AN AMENDMENT THAT PROHIBITS THE USE OF  CONTRIBUTIONS, THAT ARE COLLECTED UNDER A COMPULSARY UNION CONTRACT, FOR THE CAMPAIGN EXPENSES OF A CANDIDATE.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO TABLE THE GRIFFIN AMENDMENT TO S. 926.  THE GRIFFIN AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE USE OF  REDUCED POSTAL RATES BY ANY "CORPORATION, LABOR ORGANIZATION, MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION, COOPERATIVE POLITICAL COMMITTEE, OR CORPORATION WITHOUT CAPITAL STOCK."
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO PASS S. 926.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 1952, THE SENATE COMPANION MEASURE TO H.R. 3199, THE PROPOSED CLEAN WATER ACT.  THE BENTSEN AMENDMENT WOULD HAVE INCREASED THE DEGREE OF STATE MANAGEMENT OF WATER RESOURCES.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE BENTSEN AMENDMENT (SEE RC 332) TO S. 1952.
TO AMEND S. 1952 BY PROVIDING FOR THE REGULATION OF THE USE OF DETERGENTS IN THE GREAT  LAKES REGION.

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT TO S. 1952.  THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT PROPOSES THE CENTRALIZATION  OF JUDICIAL REVIEW OF THE EPA'S NATIONAL WATER STANDARDS AND REGULATIONS BY REQUIRING THAT ALL PETITIONS OF COMPLAINT BE REVIEWED ONLY IN THE U.S. COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS H.R. 3199, AFTER STRIKING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND SUBSTITUTING IN LIEU  THEREOF THE TEXT OF S. 1952.

THAT THE SENATE CONCUR IN THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO SENATE AMENDMENT #82 TO H.R. 7555,  THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND WELFARE.  SENATE AMENDMENT #82 STATES THAT FEDERAL FUNDS MAY BE USED FOR ABORTIONS WHEN "MEDICALLY NECESSARY," WHEN THE MOTHER'S LIFE IS ENDANGERED, OR IN CASES OF INCEST OR RAPE.
THAT THE SENATE DISAGREE WITH THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT #82 (SEE RC 337)  TO H.R. 7555.

TO ADOPT THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7797 THAT PROHIBITS THE USE OF THE APPROPRIATED FUNDS FOR CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE UNITED NATIONS UNIVERSITY IN TOKYO, JAPAN.  H.R. 7797 IS THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FOREIGN AID FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.
TO TABLE THE HARRY F. BYRD AMENDMENT (SEE RC 341) TO H.R. 7797.
TO AMEND H.R. 7797 BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION  TO $800 MILLION.

TO AGREE TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7797 THAT MODIFIES THE PROVISION ON THE USE OF  FUNDS TO ASSIST UGANDA, CAMBODIA, LAOS, OR VIETNAM.  THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT PROHIBITS ONLY THE USE OF FUNDS FOR "DIRECT" ASSISTANCE TO THESE COUNTRIES.

TO TABLE THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7797 THAT DELETES HOUSE LANGUAGE THAT WOULD HAVE  PROVIDED FOR A 5% ACROSS-THE-BOARD REDUCTION IN THE FOREIGN AID APPROPRIATIONS, AND A 10% CEILING ON THE AMOUNT REDUCED ON ANY ONE RECIPIENT'S ACCOUNT.

TO TABLE THE CLARK AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7797, AN AMENDMENT AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO  WAIVE THE RESTRICTIONS ON FOREIGN ASSISTANCE TO MOZAMBIQUE AND ANGOLA WHEN SUCH DECISION IS IN THE FOREIGN POLICY INTERESTS OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND H.R. 7797 BY BARRING THE USE OF THE APPROPRIATED FUNDS FOR ANY  ACTIVITY THAT WOULD ADVERSELY AFFECT INDUSTRY OR EMPLOYMENT IN THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS H.R. 7797.

TO AMEND S. 977, A BILL ENCOURAGING THE INCREASED USE OF COAL IN ELECTRIC GENERATING  FACILITIES AND MAJOR INSTALLATIONS.  THE DURKIN AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES AN ADDITIONAL $100 MILLION FOR THE RECONSTRUCTION AND REPAIR OF RAILWAYS USED TO TRANSPORT COAL.
TO AMEND S. 977 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF NATURAL GAS IN ANY EXISTING POWER PLANT AFTER  JANUARY 1, 1985.  THE BILL ORIGINALLY SETS THE PROHIBITION DATE AT JANUARY 1, 1990.
TO AMEND S. 977 BY PROHIBITING THE USE OF NATURAL GAS OR PETROLEUM AFTER  JANUARY 1, 1982 IN ANY EXISTING POWER PLANT OR MAJOR FUEL-BURNING INSTITUTION WITH THE CAPACITY TO BURN COAL.
TO AMEND S. CON. RES. 43, THE BILL REVISING THE FISCAL 1978 CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET FOR THE  UNITED STATES, BY INCREASING THE FUNDING FOR THE AGRICULTURAL FUNCTION TO $6.3 BILLION.

TO PASS S. 1307, A BILL REQUIRING STRICT REVIEW OF APPLICATIONS FOR VETERANS' BENEFITS  FOR THOSE PERSONS THAT WERE DISCHARGED FROM MILITARY SERVICE DURING THE VIETNAM WAR UNDER OTHER THAN HONORABLE CONDITIONS AND WERE PARDONED BY PRESIDENT CARTER'S SPECIAL DISCHARGE PROGRAM.

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT TO S. 977, THE BILL REQUIRING INCREASED USE OF COAL BY THE MAJOR UTILITY INDUSTRIES.  THE MODIFIED KENNEDY AMENDMENT PROHIBITS MAJOR OIL AND GAS PRODUCERS FROM AQUIRING, IN MOST CASES, ADDITIONAL COAL AND URANIUM ASSETS.

TO TABLE THE HANSEN AMENDMENT #836 TO S. 977.  THE HANSEN AMENDMENT STRIKES FROM THE  CLEAN AIR ACT AMENDMENTS OF 1977 THE SECTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO REQUIRE MAJOR INDUSTRIAL COAL BURNERS TO UTILIZE LOCAL AND REGIONAL COAL SUPPLIES.
TO AMEND S. 977 BY AUTHORIZING LIMITED CONVERSIONS OF NATURAL GAS TO OIL DURING NATURAL  GAS SUPPLY EMERGENCIES DECLARED BY THE PRESIDENT.

TO AMEND S. 977 BY INSERTING A PROVISION THAT AUTHORIZES THE FEDERAL ENERGY ADMINISTRATION TO  RECOMMEND PRICE REGULATION OF COAL IF THE RATE OF INCREASE OF THE PRICE OF COAL IS 10% GREATER THAN THE RATE OF INFLATION DURING ANY TWELVE MONTH PERIOD.

TO PASS H.R. 5146, A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE DUTY-FREE ENTRY OF BOBSLEDS, AFTER AMENDING IT BY INSERTING THE TEXT OF S. 977, AND THE SECTION OF H.R. 8444, PROPOSED ENERGY TAX ACT OF 1977, THAT DEALS WITH THE CONVERSION OF NATURAL GAS AND OIL TO COAL.

TO AMEND S. CON. RES. 43, THE BILL REVISING THE CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978, BY  REDUCING THE TOTAL REVENUES BY $11.4 BILLION IN ORDER TO ACCOMODATE A 10% ACROSS-THE-BOARD TAX REDUCTION.
TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. CON. RES. 43 THAT WOULD REDUCE BOTH REVENUES AND  BUDGET OUTLAYS BY $11.4 BILLION, AND PROVIDE FOR A 10% ACROSS-THE-BOARD TAX REDUCTION.
TO AMEND S. CON. RES. 43 BY REDUCING REVENUES BY $11.4 BILLION AND REDUCING OUTLAYS BY 2.5%  IN ALL FUNCTIONS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE FOR A 10% ACROSS-THE-BOARD INCOME TAX REDUCTION.
TO TABLE THE ROTH AMENDMENT TO S. CON. RES. 43.  THE ROTH AMENDMENT WOULD HAVE REDUCED  REVENUE LEVELS BY $175 MILLION IN ORDER TO ACCOMODATE A $250 TAX CREDIT FOR FULL-TIME COLLEGE STUDENTS.
TO PASS H. CON. RES. 341, AS AMENDED, AFTER STRIKING ALL AFTER THE RESOLVING  CLAUSE AND SUBSTITUTING IN LIEU THEREOF THE TEXT OF S. CON. RES. 43.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 275, THE FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ACT OF 1977.
TO AMEND S. 2057, THE BILL ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL ENERGY CONSERVATION POLICY, BY  INSTITUTING A PARKING SYSTEM THAT WOULD REQUIRE ALL FEDERAL EMPLOYEES TO PAY FOR THEIR PARKING PRIVILEGES.
TO TABLE THE RIEGLE AMENDMENT #803 TO S. 2057, AN AMENDMENT THAT WOULD STRIKE FROM THE BILL THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT ESTABLISHING MINIMUM MILEAGE STANDARDS FOR AUTOMOBILES.

TO TABLE THE RIEGLE AMENDMENT #804 TO S. 2057.  RIEGLE AMENDMENT #804 WOULD MODIFY THE  METZENBAUM AMENDMENT TO THE BILL (SEE RC 364) BY DISREGARDING THE MINIMUM MILEAGE STANDARDS WHENEVER CONGRESS ENFORCES A "GAS GUZZLER" TAX.
TO AMEND S. 2057 BY PROVIDING FOR A GASOLINE RATIONING SYSTEM THAT WOULD PROHIBIT THE USE  OF PRIVATE AUTOS DURING ONE TWENTY-FOUR HOUR CALENDAR DAY PERIOD EACH SEVEN DAY CALENDAR WEEK.
TO AMEND S. 2057 SO AS TO IMPLEMENT AN ENERGY STAMP PROGRAM THAT WOULD SUPPLY STAMPS TO  LOW-INCOME AND FIXED-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS TO HELP THEM MEET RESIDENTIAL ENERGY COSTS.
TO AMEND S. 2057 BY ESTABLISHING A MANDATORY GAS RATIONING PROGRAM.
TO AMEND S. 2057 BY DELETING THE PROVISION OF THE BILL THAT WOULD REQUIRE THE UTILITY COMPANIES  TO INSPECT HOMES AND ARRANGE FOR THE INSTALLATION OF INSULATION UPON THE REQUEST OF THE HOME OWNER.
TO AMEND S. 2057 BY ALLOWING THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY TO OFFER INTEREST FREE LOANS TO THEIR  CUSTOMERS THAT WISH TO HAVE ATTIC INSULATION INSTALLED IN THEIR ALL-ELECTRIC HOMES.

TO TABLE THE HANSEN AMENDMENT TO S. 2057.  THE HANSEN AMENDMENT NULLIFIES A RECENTLY ADOPTED  AMENDMENT TO THE CLEAN AIR ACT THAT ALLOWED THE PRESIDENT TO PROHIBIT ANY MAJOR FUEL-BURNING STATIONARY SOURCE FROM USING OTHER THAN LOCAL OR REGIONAL FUEL SUPPLIES.
TO PASS S. 2057.

TO AMEND THE MELCHER AMENDMENT (SEE RC 374) OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO THE COMMITTEE SUBSTITUTE BILL FOR S. 1360, THE BILL REVISING THE NATIONAL FOREST SERVICE TIMBER SALES PROGRAM.  THE GRAVEL AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT PUBLIC TIMBER ON NATIONAL FOREST LANDS IN ALASKA BE APPRAISED BY THE RESIDUAL VALUE METHOD.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE BILL FOR THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO S. 1360, THE BILL REVISING THE NATIONAL FOREST SERVICE SALES PROGRAM.  THE MELCHER AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR THE PUBLIC AUCTION OF NATIONAL FOREST TIMBER ACCORDING TO THE METHOD OF BIDDING THAT THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE DEEMS APPROPRIATE.

THAT THE SENATE CONCUR IN THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H. CON. RES. 341, THE  SECOND CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.  THE ADOPTED HOUSE AMENDMENT SETS THE BUDGET AUTHORITY AT $500.1 BILLION, OUTLAYS AT $458.25 BILLION, REVENUES AT $397 BILLION AND THE DEFICIT AT $61.25 BILLION.

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #835 TO S. 1750, THE BILL DELAYING FOR EIGHTEEN MONTHS THE FOOD  AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION'S PROPOSED BAN ON SACCHARIN AND AUTHORIZING FURTHER STUDY ON THE ISSUE.  THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT, OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 378), WOULD ALLOW THE SECRETARY OF HEW, AFTER EXTENSIVE CONSULTATION, TO AUTHORIZE THAT A WARNING ON THE EFFECTS OF SACCHARIN BE REPRODUCED BY RADIO, TELEVISION, AND THE PRINTED MEDIA.

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #836 TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 378) TO S. 1750.  THE AMENDMENT OF THE SENATOR FROM MASSACHUSETTS REQUIRES THAT THE LIMITED WARNING PRESENTLY PRINTED ON ALL SACCHARIN PRODUCTS ALSO BE RELEASED BY RADIO, TELEVISION AND THE PRINTED MEDIA.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE, SCIENCE, AND TRANSPORTATION TO S. 1750.  THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT DELETES A HUMAN RESOURCES COMMITTEE AMENDMENT THAT REQUIRES THAT HEALTH WARNINGS ACCOMPANY ANY RADIO OR TELEVISION ANNOUNCEMENTS ADVERTISING SACCHARIN PRODUCTS.
TO AMEND S. 1750 BY DELETING FROM THE BILL AN AMENDMENT OF THE HUMAN RESOURCES COMMITTEE  THAT REQUIRES THAT A HEALTH WARNING ACCOMPANY ANY PRINTED ADVERTISEMENT FOR A PRODUCT CONTAINING SACCHARIN.

TO RECOMMIT S. 1750 TO THE HUMAN RESOURCES COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO HOLD HEARINGS WITH THE BROADCASTING INDUSTRY TO DETERMINE THAT INDUSTRY'S OPINION ON THE ISSUE OF PUBLIC ADVERTISEMENT OF HEALTH WARNINGS ABOUT SACCHARIN PRODUCTS.
TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR S. 1750 THAT WOULD ALLOW FOR THE SALE OF  SACCHARIN SWEETNERS IN THE STORES, BUT WOULD PROHIBIT THEIR USE AS ADDITIVES IN ANY FOOD PRODUCTS.
TO PASS S. 1750.

TO TABLE THE EAGLETON AMENDMENT TO S. 995, THE BILL AMENDING THE CIVIL RIGHTS ACT OF 1964 SO  AS TO PROHIBIT DISCRIMINATION ON THE GROUNDS OF PREGNANCY OR RELATED MEDICAL CONDITIONS. THE EAGLETON AMENDMENT STATES THAT IT SHALL BE THE EMPLOYER'S OPTION TO INCLUDE ELECTIVE ABORTION PLANS IN THE COMPANY'S MEDICAL BENEFITS.
TO AMEND S. 995 BY IMPOSING A SIX WEEK LIMIT ON THE PERIOD OF DISABILITY PAYMENTS FOR  CHILDBIRTH  OR OTHER RELATED MEDICAL CONDITIONS.
TO PASS S. 995.

TO AMEND S. 274, THE BILL PROHIBITING ANY TYPE OF UNION ORGANIZATION OR MEMBERSHIP  AMONG MILITARY PERSONNEL.  THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT WOULD EXEMPT FROM THE PROVISIONS OF THE BILL THOSE CIVILIAN TECHNICIANS THAT ARE EMPLOYED BY THE SAME RESERVE UNIT  TO WHICH THEY BELONG.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE BILL FOR S. 274.  THE ABOUREZK  SUBSTITUTE BILL WOULD PROHIBIT MILITARY PERSONNEL FROM ENGAGING IN COLLECTIVE BARGAINING OR STRIKES DEALING WITH COMBAT-RELATED ISSUES, BUT WOULD ALLOW FOR THE REPRESENTATION OF PERSONNEL GRIEVANCES DEALING WITH NON-COMBAT ISSUES.
TO PASS S. 274.

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #957 TO S. 2104, THE BILL ESTABLISHING A COMPREHENSIVE  NATURAL GAS POLICY.  THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT WOULD LOWER THE REGULATED PRICE OF NEW NATURAL GAS IN THE INTERSTATE OR INTRASTATE MARKETS FROM $1.75 TO $1.45 PER THOUSAND CUBIC FEET (MCF).

TO TABLE THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE BILL FOR S. 2104. THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE  PROPOSES THE IMMEDIATE DEREGULATION OF NEW ONSHORE NATURAL GAS AND THE DEREGULATION OF NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS IN FIVE YEARS.
TO AGREE TO DIVISION 1 OF THE MCGOVERN AMENDMENT #889 (SEE 398) TO S. 2104.  DIVISION  1 STATES THAT THE TITLE SHALL BE CALLED THE "FEDERAL OIL AND GAS CORPORATION ACT."

TO TABLE DIVISION 2 OF THE MCGOVERN AMENDMENT #889 (SEE RC 398) TO S. 2104.  DIVISION 2  STATES THAT THE PURPOSE OF THE ACT IS TO ESTABLISH AN INDEPENDENT PUBLIC CORPORATION TO INSURE THE EQUITABLE PRICING AND THE ADEQUATE DISTRIBUTION OF OIL AND NATURAL GAS SUPPLIES.
TO TABLE DIVISION 3 OF THE MCGOVERN AMENDMENT #889 (SEE RC 398) TO S. 2104.  DIVISION 3 DESCRIBES THE QUALIFICATIONS AND THE DUTIES OF A BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THE FEDERAL OIL AND GAS CORPORATION.
TO TABLE DIVISION 4 OF THE MCGOVERN AMENDMENT #889 (SEE RC 398) TO S. 2104.  DIVISION 4 OUTLINES THE PROCEDURE FOR APPOINTMENT OF OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES OF THE FEDERAL OIL AND GAS CORPORATION.
TO TABLE DIVISION 5 OF THE MCGOVERN AMENDMENT #889 (SEE RC 398) TO S. 2104.  DIVISION 5 LISTS THE GENERAL CORPORATE POWERS OF THE FEDERAL OIL AND GAS CORPORATION.

TO TABLE DIVISION 6 OF THE MCGOVERN AMENDMENT #889 (SEE RC 398) TO S. 2104.  DIVISION 6 OF THE AMENDMENT SETS FORTH THE  AUTHORITY OF THE FEDERAL OIL AND GAS CORPORATION TO CONSTRUCT, LEASE OR PURCHASE TRANSMISSION PIPELINES.
TO TABLE DIVISION 7 OF THE MCGOVERN AMENDMENT #889 (SEE RC 398) TO S. 2104.  DIVISION 7 DISCUSSES THE AUTHORITY OF THE FEDERAL OIL AND GAS CORPORATION TO INCUR DEBT FOR CAPITAL PURPOSES.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 2104 THAT WOULD ADD TO THE BILL A TITLE  ESTABLISHING A PUBLIC CORPORATION WITH LIMITED AUTHORITY TO EXPLORE AND DEVELOP SUPPLIES OF NATURAL GAS AND OIL THAT ARE FOUND ON FEDERALLY OWNED LANDS.

TO TABLE THE ALLEN AMENDMENT TO THE JACKSON AMENDMENT (SEE RC 400) TO S. 2104.  THE ALLEN AMENDMENT EMBODIES THE TEXT OF THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE BILL (SEE RC 390), A BILL PROPOSING THE DEREGULATION OF NATURAL GAS SUPPLIES.

TO TABLE THE JACKSON AMENDMENT #845 TO S. 2104.  THE JACKSON AMENDMENT WOULD PROVIDE FOR  THE REGULATION OF NATURAL GAS SUPPLIES IN SUCH A WAY THAT THE PRICE OF NEW GAS WOULD BE TIED TO THE UPPER TIER PRICE OF DOMESTIC CRUDE OIL. ACCORDING TO THE PROVISIONS OF THE JACKSON AMENDMENT, THE PRICE OF NATURAL GAS FROM "EXOTIC" SOURCES SUCH AS DEVONIAN SHALE AND COAL SEAMS WOULD NOT BE REGULATED.
TO INSTRUCT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO REQUEST THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.

TO TABLE THE BENTSEN AMENDMENT #849 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390)  FOR S. 2104.  THE BENTSEN AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR INCREMENTAL PRICING OF NATURAL GAS THAT IS SUPPLIED TO BOILER SYSTEMS USING MORE THAN 1,500 THOUSAND CUBIC FEET (MCF) OF GAS PER DAY.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE BENTSEN AMENDMENT (SEE  RC 402) TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104. THE DECONCINI AMENDMENT WOULD REQUIRE THAT THE UTILITY COMPANIES GIVE PRIORITY TO THE SALE OF OLD NATURAL GAS AT THE OLD PRICES TO RESIDENTIAL USERS AND OTHER USERS CONSUMING LESS THAN 50 MCF A DAY.
TO TABLE THE FORD AMENDMENT TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT ENDING THE PRICE CONTROLS ON GAS  PRODUCED BY SMALL WELLS WITH AN OUTPUT OF NO MORE THAN 100 MCF PER DAY.

TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #851 TO THE FORD AMENDMENT #881 (SEE RC 404) TO S. 2104.  THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT CHANGES THE WORDING OF THE FORD AMENDMENT SO THAT IT WILL NOW PERTAIN TO BOTH "NEW" WELLS AND "ALL PRESENTLY CAPPED WELLS."

TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #852 TO THE FORD AMENDMENT #881 (SEE RC 404) TO S. 2104.  THE SECOND METZENBAUM AMENDMENT TO THE FORD AMENDMENT WOULD EXEMPT FROM PRICE REGULATION THOSE INDEPENDENT COMPANIES WHOSE SALES OF NATURAL GAS ARE LESS THAN 100 BILLION MCF ANNUALLY.
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF PROTOCOL TO THE CONVENTION ON INTERNATIONAL  CIVIL AVIATION, EXECUTIVE A, 95TH CONGRESS, FIRST SESSION.
TO INVOKE CLOTURE AND END DEBATE ON THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE BILL (SEE RC 390) FOR  S. 2104.
TO ADJOURN THE SENATE.
TO TABLE THE FORD AMENDMENT (SEE RC 404) TO S. 2104.
TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE BYRD MOTION (SEE RC  410) TO TABLE THE FORD AMENDMENT (SEE RC 404) TO S. 2104 WAS AGREED TO.
TO AMEND THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE BILL (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 BY PROVIDING FOR  A SYSTEM OF INCREMENTAL GAS PRICING THAT WOULD FAVOR RESIDENTIAL AND OTHER SMALL USERS (SEE RC 402).

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR THE JACKSON SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE BILL (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  THE KENNEDY SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT EMBODIES THE GAS PRICING PROPOSALS OF THE ADMINISTRATION.
TO TABLE THE BENTSEN MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE KENNEDY SUBSTITUTE AMENDMET  (SEE RC 413) FOR THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 WAS TABLED.

TO AGREE TO DIVSION 1 OF AN AMENDMENT (SEE RC 417) TO S. 2104.  DIVISION 1 OF THE  METZENBAUM AMENDMENT REQUIRES THAT NATURAL GAS PRODUCERS SUBMIT A REPORT ON THEIR EXPLORATION, DEVELOPMENT AND PRODUCTION EXPENSES FOR THE LAST FIVE YEARS.
TO TABLE THE HANSEN MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH DIVISION 1 OF THE METZENBAUM  AMENDMENT (SEE RC 415) TO S. 2104 WAS REJECTED.

TO AGREE TO DIVISIONS 2 AND 3 OF AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2104 THAT REQUIRES DETAILED REPORTS FROM  NATURAL GAS PRODUCERS ON THEIR ACTIVITIES AND EXPENDITURES IN RECENT YEARS. DIVISIONS 2 AND 3 OF THE AMENDMENT REQUIRE THAT THE DEVELOPMENT OUTLAYS OF A NATURAL GAS COMPANY MAKING LARGE PROFITS FROM NEW NATURAL GAS PRICES BE INCREASED BY 50%.
TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH DIVISION 2 AND DIVISION 3 OF  THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT (SEE RC 417) TO S. 2104 WERE REJECTED.

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #854 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT (SEE  RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  KENNEDY AMENDMENT #854 EXCLUDES THE GAS FOUND ON THE OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF FROM THE DEREGULATION PROVISION OF THE PEARSON-BENTSEN AMENDMENT.
TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE  BY WHICH KENNEDY AMENDMENT #854 (SEE RC 419) TO S. 2104 WAS TABLED.

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT KENNEDY AMENDMENT #855 TO THE  PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 IS NOT GERMANE TO THE BILL. KENNEDY AMENDME #855 PROHIBITS NATURAL GAS COMPANIES FROM OWNING OR CONTROLLING COAL OR URANIUM DEPOSITS.

TO AMEND THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 SO AS TO NO LONGER  DEFINE "NEW GAS" BY A MEASURE OF ITS DISTANCE FROM EXISTING WELLS.  THE HASKELL AMENDMENT REQUIRES THAT A QUALIFIED GEOLOGIST DEFINE ALL "NEW GAS" ACCORDING TO GEOLOGICAL GUIDELINES.

TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #955 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 390)  FOR S. 2104.  METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #955 LIMITS THE RETURN ON INCURRED COSTS OF A NATURAL GAS COMPANY TO 18%.

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #868 TO S. 2104  IS OUT OF ORDER.  THE AMENDMENT WAS RULED OUT OF ORDER ON THE GROUNDS THAT IT HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY OFFERED BY MR. JACKSON (SEE RC 400) AND SUBSEQUENTLY TABLED BY THE SENATE.
THAT THE SENATE STAND IN RECESS UNTIL 9:00 A.M. ON TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 27, 1977.

TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM APPEAL OF THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #994  TO S. 2104 WAS OUT OF ORDER.  METZENBAUM AMENDMNT #994 WOULD ADD TO THE BILL A NEW TITLE II THAT PROVIDES FOR INCREASED COMPETITION IN THE PETROLEUM INDUSTRY.
TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1352 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT LIMITING PRICE DEREGULATION  TO NATURAL GAS SOLD BY INDEPENDENT, NONINTEGRATED GAS COMPANIES.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #1118 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR  S. 2104.  THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #1118 CHANGES THE DEFINITION OF "NEW GAS" SO AS TO APPLY ONLY TO GAS PRODUCED FROM RESERVOIRS THAT WERE DISCOVERED AFTER 1978.
TO TABLE THE BENTSEN MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT  #1118 (SEE RC 428) WAS TABLED.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1361 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE #862 (SEE RC 390)  FOR S. 2104.  KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1361 REDEFINES "NEW GAS" ACCORDING TO A DIFFERENT SET OF LOCATION REQUIREMENTS, AND LIMITS PRICE DEREGULATION TO THOSE GAS COMPANIES  THAT PUBLISH BASIC DATA ON THEIR COSTS, TAXES, PRODUCTION, AND RESERVES.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1365 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1365 INSURES THAT MOST OF THE PROFITS FROM INCREASED PRICES OF DEREGULATED GAS ARE PLOWED BACK INTO EXPLORATIONS FOR NEW NATURAL GAS.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #915 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #915 PROVIDES FOR THE DELIVERY OF "NEW NATURAL GAS" TO INTERSTATE PIPELINES ON AN EMERGENCY BASIS.
TO AMEND THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 BY DELETING THE PROVISION THAT ALLOWS FOR CHARGES IN EXCESS OF THE NATIONAL CEILING ON NATURAL GAS PRICES.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #1075 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390)  FOR S. 2104.  METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #1075 DELETES FROM THE BILL THE PROVISION THAT PREVENTS THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION FROM REDUCING NATURAL GAS PRICES TO LESS THAN THE INTERIM CEILING PRICE FOR NATURAL GAS.

TO AMEND THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 BY GIVING THE  FEDERAL ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION THE SOLE AUTHORITY TO DETERMINE THE NEW CRUDE OIL EQUIVALENT PRICE THAT WILL BE USED IN TURN TO DETERMINE THE PRICE OF NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #906 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT THAT DELETES THE WORDS "BUT NOT INTRASTATE GAS" FROM A SECTION OF THE BILL EXPLAINING THE 1954 SUPREME COURT DECISION ON THE NATURAL GAS ACT.

TO AMEND S. 2104 SO AS TO INCLUDE CERTAIN PUBLIC SERVICE INSTITUTIONS SUCH AS SCHOOLS AND HOSPITALS IN THE CATEGORY OF "HIGH PRIORITY USERS" THAT ARE ELIGIBLE FOR REDUCED GAS RATES AND FIRST-PRIORITY SERVICE DURING NATURAL GAS SHORTAGES.
TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #929 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT THAT WOULD REQUIRE THAT  PRODUCTION DIFFERENCES BETWEEN NONASSOCIATED AND ASSOCIATED OR DISSOLVED NATURAL GAS BE RECOGNIZED.

TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #1077 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390)  FOR S. 2104. METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #1077 WOULD REQUIRE THAT THE PRICE OF NEW OFFSHORE GAS THAT IS PRODUCED DURING THE FIVE YEAR PHASEOUT PERIOD BE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL CEILING EQUAL TO THE REFINER COST OF ACQUIRING CRUDE OIL DURING THE THREE PRECEDING CALENDAR MONTHS.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1363 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1363 DEFINES "NEW NATURAL GAS" AS THAT GAS PRODUCED FROM A RESERVOIR THAT WAS DISCOVERED AFTER APRIL 20, 1977.
TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1363 (SEE RC  440) TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN (SEE RC 390) SUBSTITUTE  WAS TABLED.

TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #913 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #913 WOULD ALLOW FOR CHARGES IN EXCESS OF THE NATIONAL CEILING ON OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS PRICES ONLY UPON REVIEW OF THE ACTUAL COSTS OF PRODUCTION.

TO AMEND S. 2104 BY ADDING TO THE SECTION OF THE BILL THAT LISTS THE "PURPOSES" OF THE  LEGISLATION A STATEMENT THAT SAYS THERE HAS BEEN A FOURFOLD INCREASE IN THE INTERNATIONAL PRICE OF OIL SINCE 1973 DUE TO "RUTHLESS INTERNATIONAL CARTEL ACTION."

TO AMEND THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 SO AS TO DELETE THE PROVISION  FOR A FIVE YEAR PHASEOUT OF PRICE CONTROLS ON NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS AND CONTINUE PRICE REGULATION INDEFINITELY.
TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH METZENBAUM AMENDMENT  #1138 (SEE RC 444) TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 WAS REJECTED.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #974 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104   KENNEDY AMENDMENT #974 AUTHORIZES THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION TO SET OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS PRICES BOTH ABOVE AND BELOW THE NATIONAL CEILING PRICE FOR OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF GAS.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #967 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  KENNEDY AMENDMENT #967 WOULD SET THE PRICE OF OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS AT A FIGURE RELATIVELY EQUAL TO THE NATIONAL GAS SALES PRICE DETERMINED TO BE JUST AND REASONABLE BY THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION ON APRIL 20, 1977.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #910 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT MAKING THE PROVISIONS OF THE  ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEDURES ACT APPLICABLE TO ANY PRICES OR RULES AND ORDERS RELATING TO PRICES THAT ARE ISSUED UNDER S. 2104.
TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #911 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT ALLOWING THE PRESIDENT TO  SET SPECIAL NATURAL GAS PRICES ONLY WHEN IT IS NECESSARY TO REIMBURSE PRODUCERS FOR ACTUAL COSTS OF PRODUCTION.

TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #919 TO S. 2104.  ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #919 STATES THAT EVEN UNDER A DEREGULATION POLICY, THE PRICE OF NEW NATURAL GAS CAN NOT EXCEED THE CURRENT BTU-RELATED PRICE OF CRUDE OIL, PLUS AN INFLATION ADJUSTMENT.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK MOTION TO APPEAL THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT ABOUREZK AMENDMENT  #896 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 WAS NOT GERMANE TO THE BILL. THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR VERTICAL DIVESTITURE OF THE PETROLEUM INDUSTRY.
TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #975 (SEE RC 453) TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390)  FOR S. 2104.

TO AMEND THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 BY REQUIRING THAT THE  FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION FILE AN ANNUAL REPORT WITH CONGRESS AND THE PRESIDENT ON THE LACK OF COMPLIANCE BY PRODUCERS OF NATURAL GAS WITH CONTRACT OBLIGATIONS.

TO TABLE BUMPERS AMENDMENT #1039, THE MODIFIED VERSION OF THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE  (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104. THE MODIFIED AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR DEREGULATION BUT ALSO IMPOSES A PRICE CEILING FOR TWO YEARS AND PROVIDES FOR AN INCREMENTAL PRICING SYSTEM FOR THE PROTECTION OF HOMEOWNERS, SCHOOLS, AND HOSPITALS.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #934 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #934 PROVIDES FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS PRICES ACCORDING TO "ACTUAL" RATHER THAN "PROSPECTIVE" PRODUCTION COSTS.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1086 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1086 PROVIDES FOR A TEN YEAR PHASE-OUT OF PRICE REGULATION OF NATURAL GAS FOUND ON OFFSHORE FEDERAL LANDS.

TO TABLE THE BAYH AMENDMENT #990 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  BAYH AMENDMENT #990 STATES THAT IN THE EVENT OF A SHORTAGE OF NATURAL GAS SUPPLIES, ALLOCATIONAL PRIORITY SHALL BE GIVEN TO HOMEOWNERS, SCHOOLS, HOSPITALS, AND SMALL AGRICULTURAL USERS.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #897 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #897 PROVIDES FOR DEREGULATION OF NATURAL GAS PRICES ONLY FOR GAS PRODUCED BY COMPANIES WHOSE INTERSTATE SALES ARE LESS THAN 100 BILLION CUBIC FEET (MCF) ANNUALLY.
TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #946 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT MODIFYING THE "PURPOSE" SECTION  OF THE BILL SO AS TO STATE THAT THE BURDEN OF INCREASED COSTS SHALL BE BORNE BY LOW PRIORITY USERS.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #944 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT STATING THAT THE PRICE OF NATURAL GAS  SHALL BE DETERMINED IN PART BY THE "ACTUAL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH FINDING NEW SUPPLIES OF NATURAL GAS," INSTEAD OF THE "COSTS AND RISKS."

TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #921 TO S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #921 REDEFINES THE TERM "INFLATION  ADJUSTMENT" TO BE THE RATIO OF THE WHOLESALE PRICE INDEX FOR THE PRECEDING QUARTER TO THE WHOLESALE PRICE INDEX FOR THE FIRST QUARTER OF 1977.

TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM MOTION TO APPEAL THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #905 TO S. 2104 WAS OUT OF ORDER BECAUSE IT HIT THE BILL IN TWO PLACES.  METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #905 ADDS LANGUAGE THAT STATES THAT THE NATURAL GAS INDUSTRY HAS STIMULATED USE OF ITS PRODUCT BY LARGE CONSUMERS, AND THAT NATURAL GAS IS AN INFERIOR SOURCE OF POWER FOR TRANSPORTATION.

TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #928 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT ADDING LANGUAGE THAT CALLS FOR ASSURANCES THAT PRICE INCREASES WILL RESULT IN INCREASED EXPLORATION AND DEVELOPMENT OF NATURAL GAS SUPPLIES.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #904 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT THAT DELETES THE BILL'S FINDING  THAT THE CONTINUATION OF COST-BASED REGULATION OF NATURAL GAS IS ONE OF THE CAUSES OF THE WIDENING PRICE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN GAS AND OIL.
TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #907 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT STATING THAT ONE OF THE PURPOSES OF THE  BILL SHALL BE TO "LIMIT INTERSTATE PIPELINES AND NATURAL GAS PRODUCERS TO A FAIR RATE OF RETURN."
THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE JOHNSTON AMENDMENT #1058 (SEE  RC 468) TO THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT #1022 (SEE RC 489) FOR S. 2104 IS NOT GERMANE.
TO TABLE THE JOHNSTON AMENDMENT #1058 (SEE RC 468) TO THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489)  FOR S. 2104.

TO AMEND THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT #1022 (SEE RC 489) FOR S. 2104 BY AUTHORIZING  ELECTRICAL POWER PLANTS TO VOLUNTARILY SELL THEIR NATURAL GAS SUPPLIES FOR THE REPLACEMENT COST OF RESIDUAL FUEL OIL SO AS TO ENCOURAGE CONVERSION TO HEAVY PETROLEUM FUEL OILS.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #922 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT STATING THE FINDING THAT THE  GAS INDUSTRIES' ESTIMATES OF PROVEN RESERVES OF NATURAL AS HAVE DECLINED DUE TO DOWNWARD REVISIONS WHILE THE DEMAND FOR THE PRODUCT HAS RISEN.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #930 TO S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #930 ADDS TO THE BILL'S FINDINGS THE STATEMENT THAT WHILE THE GAS INDUSTRIES' ESTIMATES OF PROVEN RESERVES OF NATURAL GAS HAVE DECLINED, AND WHILE THE DEMAND FOR THE PRODUCT HAS RISEN, THERE HAS BEEN A SHORTAGE OF GAS IN THE INTERSTATE MARKET AND AN INCREASING PROPORTION OF NATURAL GAS ON THE DEREGULATED INTRASTATE MARKET.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #931 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT STATING THE FINDING  THAT THE "PRODUCERS HAVE CLAIMED THAT" THE INCREASING DIFFERENTIAL BETWEEN OIL AND NATURAL GAS PRICES IS DUE TO A DECLINE IN INCENTIVES TO DISCOVER NEW NATURAL GAS.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #932 TO THE MODIFIED PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 454)  FOR S. 2104. AMENDMENT #932 AUTHORIZES THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION TO DETERMINE AN INTERIM CEILING ON NATURAL GAS PRICES ACCORDING TO THE COSTS OF FINDING, DEVELOPING, AND PRODUCING GAS.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1366 TO THE MODIFIED PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 454)  FOR S. 2104. AMENDMENT #1366 REDEFINES "NEW" NATURAL GAS, REQUIRES THE PUBLICATION OF EXPLORATION AND PRODUCTION COSTS, AND PROHIBITS THAT PROFITS BE INVESTED IN OTHER THAN ENERGY-RELATED ENTERPRISES.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1078 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1078 STATES THAT THE PRICE  OF NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS SHALL BE BASED ON THE BTU-RELATED PRICE PER BARREL WELLHEAD PRICE OF CRUDE OIL IN THE PRECEDING THREE MONTHS.

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1132 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1132 ASSURES THAT "ASSOCIATED" GAS, (GAS IN CONTACT WITH CRUDE OIL IN THE RESERVOIR), WILL BE COMPENSATED AT A REASONABLE RATE.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1072 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104. AMENDMENT #1072 REQUIRES THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION TO PUBLISH A MONTHLY REPORT IN THE FEDERAL REGISTER ON THE CURRENT BTU-RELATED PRICE OF DOMESTIC CRUDE OIL.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #945 TO S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #945 MODIFIES THE BILL'S  FINDINGS AND STATES THAT A NEW SYSTEM OF GAS PRICING IS NEEDED TO (1) ELIMINATE PRICE DISTORTIONS CAUSED BY THE EXISTENCE OF TWO SEPARATE MARKETS, (2) ACCURATELY REFLECT PRODUCTION COSTS OF NATURAL GAS, AND (3) REFLECT THE ECONOMIC IMPACT OF RELYING UPON ALTERNATIVE ENERGY SOURCES IN THE ABSENCE OF ADEQUATE NATURAL GAS SUPPLIES.

TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #947 TO S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #947 ADDS TO THE BILL'S FINDINGS  A REQUEST FOR AN INDEPENDENT DATA SYSTEM FOR NATURAL GAS BECAUSE OF THE "QUESTIONABLE RELIABILITY OF AVAILABLE DATA."

TO TABLE THE BAYH AMENDMENT #1260 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1260 AUTHORIZES THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION TO REQUIRE INTERSTATE PIPELINES TO EXPAND THEIR GAS STORAGE CAPACITY IN ORDER TO ADEQUATELY MEET PEAK DEMAND DAY REQUIREMENTS.

TO TABLE THE BAYH AMENDMENT #908 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  THE BAYH AMENDMENT REQUIRES THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION TO DETERMINE THE EXPLORATION EXPENDITURES AND THE ULTIMATE RECOVERABLE RESERVES OF NATURAL GAS FOR EACH PROJECT.
TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #984 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT CHANGING THE DEFINITION OF  "PERSON" TO INCLUDE INDIVIDUALS AND CORPORATIONS.

TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1079 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1079 STATES THAT NATURAL GAS SOLD TO THE INTERSTATE MARKET DURING EMERGENCY PERIODS SHALL BE SUBJECT TO THE RULES AND REGULATIONS OF THE INTERSTATE MARKET.
TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1076 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1076 SETS THE PRICE OF NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS AT $1.45 PER THOUSAND CUBIC FEET (MCF).

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #1222 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT REDEFINING "INFLATION ADJUSTMENT"  TO BE THE RATIO OF THE WHOLESALE PRICE INDEX OF INDUSTRIAL COMMODITIES LESS FUELS AND RELATED PRODUCTS AND POWER FOR THE PRECEDING QUARTER OVER THE SAME INDEX FOR THE FIRST QUARTER OF 1977.
TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #894 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT INCREASING THE FINE FOR VIOLATION  OF THE RULES OF THE INCREMENTAL PRICING SYSTEM TO $25,000.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1124 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1124 STRIKES AN EARLIER AMENDMENT ON FACTORS TO BE CONSIDERED IN ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL CEILING ON THE PRICE OF NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS.

TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1125 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1125 DELETES A SECTION REQUIRING THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION TO CONSIDER NATIONAL CEILING RATES THAT WOULD PROTECT CONSUMERS DURING NATURAL GAS SHORTAGES.

TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1126 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1126 DELETES THE WORDS "AND ONLY THESE FACTORS" FROM A SECTION OUTLINING THE FACTORS TO BE CONSIDERED IN SETTING A NATIONAL CEILING ON OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS PRICES.

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT LONG (FOR METZENBAUM) AMENDMENT #1087 IS OUT  OF ORDER BECAUSE IT DOES NOT DEAL WITH THE PRESENTLY MODIFIED TEXT OF S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #1087 MODIFIES THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104 BY TERMINATING PRICE CONTROLS ON NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS ON JANUARY 1, 1988. THE BILL S. 2104 WAS PREVIOUSLY RECOMMITTED AND REPORTED BACK WITH THE TEXT OF THE BYRD-JACKSON COMPROMISE AMENDMENT #1022.  THE BYRD-JACKSON AMENDMENT IMPOSES A CEILING OF $2.0 BTU FOR NATURAL GAS IN 1978, ALLOWS FOR AN INCREMENT IN THE CEILING ACCORDING TO AN INFLATION INDEX, AND MORE BROADLY DEFINES THE MEANING OF "NEW NATURAL GAS."

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT LONG (FOR ABOUREZK) AMENDMENT #1367 IS OUT  OF ORDER BECAUSE IT DOES NOT DEAL WITH THE MODIFIED VERSION OF S. 2104 THAT IS PRESENTLY BEFORE THE SENATE (SEE RC 489).  AMENDMENT #1367 ESTABLISHES A PUBLIC CORPORATION CALLED THE FEDERAL OIL AND GAS CORPORATION TO EXPLORE AND DEVELOP NATURAL GAS AND OIL RESOURCES FOUND ON FEDERAL LANDS.
TO TABLE LONG (FOR METZENBAUM) AMENDMENT #1167 TO THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE #1022  (SEE RC 489) FOR S. 2104. AMENDMENT #1167 RAISES THE FINE FOR VIOLATION OF THE ACT TO $100,000.

TO TABLE LONG (FOR ABOUREZK) AMENDMENT #1380 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390) FOR  S. 2104. AMENDMENT #1380, ALSO IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, TIES THE PRICE OF NEW NATURAL GAS TO THE CURRENT BTU-RELATED PRICE AND TIES THE PRICE OF OLD NATURAL GAS TO A FIGURE DETERMINED BY THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION.

TO TABLE THE HANSEN (FOR METZENBAUM) AMENDMENT #1141 TO THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489)  FOR S. 2104. AMENDMENT #1141 REDEFINES "NEW NATURAL GAS" TO MEAN GAS THAT IS FROM RESERVOIRS DISCOVERED AFTER THE DATE OF ENACTMENT OF THIS BILL.

TO TABLE THE LONG (FOR METZENBAUM) AMENDMENT #1122 TO THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 390)  FOR S. 2104. AMENDMENT #1122 DELETES A SECTION OF THE SUBSTITUTE THAT REQUIRES THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION TO CONSIDER PROSPECTIVE EXPLORATION AND PRODUCTION COSTS WHEN DETERMINING THE NATIONAL  PRICE CEILING ON NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS.
TO DIRECT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO COMPEL THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.

TO TABLE MCCLURE (FOR METZENBAUM) AMENDMENT #1144 TO THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489)  FOR S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT USING THE DATE OF ENACTMENT OF THE BILL AS THE REFERENCE POINT FOR DEFINING "NEW CONTRACTS" FOR "NEW NATURAL GAS."

TO TABLE METZENBAUM AMENDMENT #1297 TO S. 2104, AS MODIFIED (SEE RC 489).  THE METZENBAUM  AMENDMENT SETS THE PRICE OF OLD NATURAL GAS AT $1.45 PER MILLION BTUS,  MULTIPLIED BY AN INFLATION ADJUSTMENT.
TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1305 TO THE MODIFIED VERSION OF S. 2104 (SEE RC 489).  ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1305 REVISES THE BILL'S PROVISIONS FOR AN INCREMENTAL PRICING SYSTEM FOR NATURAL GAS.

TO TABLE ABOUREZK (FOR DOMENICI) AMENDMENT #1306 TO S. 2104, AS MODIFIED (SEE RC 489).  AMENDMENT #1306 GIVES THE RIGHT OF JUDICIAL REVIEW TO ANY PERSON AGGRIEVED BY A RULING OF THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION.

TO TABLE ABOUREZK (FOR BENTSEN) AMENDMENT #1316 TO THE MODIFIED VERSION OF S. 2104 (SEE RC 489).  AMENDMENT #1316 REQUIRES THE SECRETARY OF ENERGY TO SUBMIT AN ANNUAL REPORT TO CONGRESS ON THE PRODUCTION OF NATURAL GAS AND THE DISCOVERY OF NEW RESERVES.
TO TABLE BUMPERS AMENDMENT #1039, AN AMENDMENT EMBODYING THE TEXT OF THE MODIFIED PEARSON-BENTSEN  SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 454) FOR S. 2104.
TO PASS, AS AMENDED, H.R. 9290, A BILL AUTHORIZING AN INCREASE IN THE TEMPORARY PUBLIC DEBT LIMIT.

THAT THE SENATE CONCUR IN THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5645, THE BILL  AUTHORIZING FUNDS TO THE CIVIL RIGHTS COMMISSION FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.  THE HOUSE AMENDMENT COMPROMISES THE TWO APPROPRIATIONS PROPOSALS OF THE HOUSE AND THE SENATE, AND PROHIBITS THAT THE FUNDS BE USED TO HIRE NEW STAFF.

TO TABLE METZENBAUM (FOR DOMENICI) AMENDMENT #1301 TO THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489)  FOR S. 2104. AMENDMENT #1301 REQUIRES THE FEDERAL POWER COMMISSION TO EXEMPT SALES OF HIGH COST NATURAL GAS FOR THIRTY DAYS FOLLOWING THE ENACTMENT OF THE BILL.
TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK (FOR METZENBAUM) AMENDMENT #1197 TO S. 2104, AS MODIFIED (SEE RC 489).  AMENDMENT #1197 SETS THE PRICE CEILING FOR OLD NATURAL GAS AT $0.53 PER MCF.

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE DANFORTH (FOR METZENBAUM) AMENDMENT #1106  TO THE MODIFIED PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 454) FOR S. 2104 WAS OUT OF ORDER. AMENDMENT #1106 PROVIDES FOR AN INCREASE IN NEW NATURAL GAS PRICES AS OF THE DATE OF ENACTMENT OF THE BILL.

TO TABLE THE CRANSTON APPEAL FROM THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE READING OF THE  PRINTED METZENBAUM (FOR TOWER AMENDMENT #865 IS NOT DILATORY.  AMENDMENT #865 MODIFIES S. 2104 SO AS TO AUTHORIZE THE FEDERAL ENERGY ADMINISTRATION TO SET A CEILING ON PRICES FOR OLD CRUDE OIL.
TO AMEND THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489) FOR S. 2104 BY RAISING THE FINE FOR  VIOLATION OF THE ACT TO $50,000.
THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE METZENBAUM CALL FOR A QUORUM IS DILATORY.

TO TABLE DANFORTH (FOR ABOUREZK) AMENDMENT #970 TO THE ORIGINAL PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE  RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  AMENDMENT #970 GRANTS INTERVENORS IN A LAWSUIT THE RIGHT TO OBTAIN THE INFORMATION GRANTED TO THE ORIGINAL PARTIES.

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT IF AN AMENDMENT IS RULED TO  BE OUT OF ORDER, THEN AN APPEAL FROM THAT RULING OF THE CHAIR IS DILATORY. THE AMENDMENT IN QUESTION HERE IS AMENDMENT #1084 (SEE RC 512) TO THE MODIFIED PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489) FOR S. 2104.

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE CHAFEE (FOR  METZENBAUM) AMENDMENT #1084 TO THE MODIFIED PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489) FOR S. 2104 IS OUT OF ORDER.  AMENDMENT #1084 PROVIDES FOR THE TERMINATION OF PRICE CONTROLS ON NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS IN 1985.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6655, THE HOUSING AND COMMUNITY  DEVELOPMENT ACT OF 1977.

TO TABLE S. CON. RES. 47, A RESOLUTION EXPRESSING THE SUPPORT OF THE  CONGRESS FOR PRESIDENT CARTER'S DECISION TO UPHOLD THE ARMS LIMITATIONS AGREEMENTS ESTABLISHED IN THE 1972 STRATEGIC ARMAMENT TALKS WITH THE SOVIET UNION.

TO TABLE THE MCCLURE AMENDMENT #861 TO S. CON. RES. 47, THE RESOLUTION  EXPRESSING THE SUPPORT OF CONGRESS FOR PRESIDENT CARTER'S DECISION TO CONTINUE LIMITATION OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF STRATEGIC ARMAMENTS. THE MCCLURE AMENDMENT STATES THAT THE RESOLUTION SHALL NOT PROHIBIT OR HINDER THE DEVELOPMENT OF ANY NUCLEAR WEAPON SYSTEM AUTHORIZED BY THE CONGRESS.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK APPEAL FROM THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT UNDER  CLOTURE, AMENDMENTS WHICH ARE OUT OF ORDER ON THEIR FACE CAN BE RULED OUT OF ORDER BY THE CHAIR ON ITS OWN INITIATIVE. PENDING CONSIDERATION UNDER THIS RULING IS ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1266 TO S. 2104, AN AMENDMENT MODIFYING THE ORIGINAL BILL WITH RESPECT TO EXPANSION OF THE STORAGE CAPACITY OF INTERSTATE PIPELINES.

THAT THE SENATE RULE ON THE BAKER POINT OF ORDER THAT UNDER CLOTURE, THE AUTHOR OF AN AMENDMENT HAS THE RIGHT TO RECALL HIS AMENDMENTS SUBMITTED TO THE DESK WITHOUT ASKING UNANIMOUS CONSENT. UNDER CONSIDERATION HERE IS THE STEVENS MOTION TO RECALL HIS OWN AMENDMENTS NUMBERED 1059, 1061, 1062 AND 1063 TO THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489) FOR S. 2104.

THAT THE SENATE RULE ON THE BAKER POINT OF ORDER THAT UNDER CLOTURE, WHEN AMENDMENTS, MOTIONS, OR REQUESTS FOR YEA AND NAYS ARE RULED DILATORY OR NOT IN ORDER, THESE RULINGS DO NOT SUFFICIENTLY CONSTITUTE TRANSACTION OF BUSINESS FOR THE PURPOSE OF CALLING ANTOHER QUORUM.
TO TABLE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT #1226 (SEE RC 516) TO S. 2104.
TO INSTRUCT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO REQUEST THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.

TO SUSPEND PARAGRAPH 2 OF RULE XXII SO AS TO BE ABLE TO CALL UP HART SUBSTITUTE #1389  FOR THE BYRD-JACKSON SUBSTITUTE (SEE RC 489) FOR S. 2104. AMENDMENT #1389 SETS THE PRICE OF NEW NATURAL GAS AT THE BTU-RELATED PRICE OF OIL ON THE DAY OF THE BILL'S ENACTMENT, SETS THE PRICE OF OLD NATURAL GAS AT $1.45 PLUS AN INFLATION ADJUSTMENT, AND ESTABLISHES AN INCREMENTAL PRICING SYSTEM FOR NATURAL GAS.
TO INSTRUCT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO COMPEL THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.
TO INSTRUCT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO REQUEST THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.

TO AGREE TO AMENDEMNT #1039 IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE PEARSON-BENTSEN SUBSTITUTE  #862 (SEE RC 390) FOR S. 2104.  THE BUMPERS AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR DEREGULATION OF NEW ONSHORE NATURAL GAS PRICES, REGULATION OF NEW OFFSHORE NATURAL GAS PRICES UNTIL DECEMBER 31, 1982, A CEILING ON ANY NEW NATURAL GAS SOLD FOR TWO YEARS AFTER THE ENACTMENT OF THE BILL, AND AN INCREMENTAL PRICING SYSTEM TO SERVE HIGH PRIORITY USERS.

TO AMEND H.R. 9005, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA FOR FISCAL  YEAR 1978, BY APPROPRIATING $1.4 BILLION FOR THE PHYSICAL DISASTER LOAN PROGRAM OF THE SMALL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION.
TO AMEND H.R. 9005, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA FOR FISCAL 1978,  BY RESTORING A $27 MILLION APPROPRIATION FOR THE PURCHASE OF LAND FOR A CIVIC CENTER.
TO TABLE THE MODIFIED HART AMENDMENT #1399 (SEE RC 528) TO S. 2114, THE PUBLIC UTILITES  REGULATORY ACT OF 1977.
TO AMEND S. 2114 SO AS TO REQUIRE THAT A BASIC SUPPLY OF ELECTRICITY BE OFFERED TO ANY PERSON  AGE 62 OR OLDER AT THE LOWEST COST AFFORDED ANY CLASS OF CONSUMER SERVED BY THE UTILITY.

TO AMEND THE WILLIAMS AMENDMENT (SEE RC 537) TO S. 1871, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR AUTOMATIC  ADJUSTMENTS OF THE MINIMUM WAGE RATE.  THE BARTLETT AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR AN INCREASE OF THE MINIMUM WAGE TO $2.50 IN 1978, $2.70 IN 1979, AND $2.90 IN 1980.

TO AMEND THE WILLIAMS AMENDMENT (SEE RC 537) TO S. 1871 SO AS TO PROVIDE FOR AN INCREASE IN THE  MINIMUM WAGE OVER A THREE YEAR PERIOD INSTEAD OF A FOUR YEAR PERIOD.
TO AMEND S. 1871 BY INCREASING THE MINIMUM WAGE TO $2.65 IN 1978, $2.90 IN 1979, AND $3.15 IN 1980, AND $3.40 IN 1981.
TO AMEND S. 1871 BY AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF LABOR TO CONDUCT A STUDY ON THE IMPACT OF  THE REDUCTION OF THE TIP CREDIT AS PROPOSED IN THE STAFFORD AMENDMENT (SEE RC 540) TO THE BILL.
TO AMEND THE STAFFORD AMENDMENT (SEE RC 540) TO S. 1871 BY GRADUALLY REDUCING THE TIP CREDIT  FROM 50% TO 40%.
TO AMEND S. 1871 BY REDUCING THE TIP CREDIT FROM 50% TO 30% BY 1981.
TO AMEND S. 1871 BY EXEMPTING ALL WORKERS AGE 16 THROUGH 19 FROM MINIMUM WAGE COVERAGE.
TO AMEND S. 1871 SO THAT WORKERS BETWEEN AGE 16 AND 20 MAY BE HIRED AT 85% OF THE ADULT MINIMUM WAGE.
TO AMEND S. 1871 SO THAT WORKERS UNDER AGE 20 MAY BE HIRED AT 75% OF THE ADULT MINIMUM WAGE RATE FOR THEIR FIRST SIX MONTHS ON THE JOB.
TO AMEND S. 1871 SO THAT WORKERS UNDER AGE 20 MAY BE HIRED AT 85% OF THE ADULT MINIMUM WAGE  FOR THEIR FIRST SIX MONTHS ON THE JOB.
TO AMEND S. 1871 SO THAT WORKERS AGED 68 OR OLDER MAY BE HIRED AT 75% OF THE ADULT MINIMUM WAGE.

TO TABLE DIVISION 2 OF THE DECONCINI AMENDMENT #1038 TO S. 1871.  DIVISION 2  GIVES THE SECRETARY  OF LABOR DISCRETIONARY AUTHORITY TO EXEMPT CERTAIN EMPLOYERS FROM THE SIX-PERSON LIMITATION ON THE NUMBER OF FULL-TIME STUDENTS THAT CAN BE HIRED FOR PART-TIME JOBS AT 85% OF THE ADULT MINIMUM WAGE.

TO TABLE THE BUMPERS AMENDMENT TO TOWER AMENDMENT #1019 TO S. 1871.  THE BUMPERS AMENDMENT EXEMPTS SMALL RETAIL AND SERVICE BUSINESSES FROM MINIMUM WAGE LAWS IF THEIR GROSS VOLUME OF SALES IS  LESS THAN $250,000 IN 1977, LESS THAN $275,000 IN 1978 AND 1979, AND LESS THAN $325,000 IN 1980. THE ORIGINAL TOWER AMENDMENT TO THE BILL EXEMPTED SMALL RETAIL AND SERVICE BUSINESSES FROM MINIMUM WAGE LAWS IF THEIR GROSS VOLUME OF SALES WAS LESS THAN $1 MILLION ANNUALLY.

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR S. 1871.  THE CHILES AMENDMENT EMBODIES THE  PROVISIONS OF THE HOUSE VERSION OF THE BILL AND CONSEQUENTLY PROPOSES THAT THE MINIMUM WAGE BE RAISED TO $2.65 IN 1978, $2.85 IN 1979 AND $3.05 IN 1980.
TO PASS H.R. 3744, AFTER STRIKING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF  THE TEXT OF S. 1871.

TO AMEND THE EMERGENCY PETROLEUM ALLOCATION ACT OF 1973 WITH RESPECT TO THE DEFINITION  OF A "STRIPPER WELL" AND APPLY THE NEW DEFINITION TO THE TAX AND PRICE CONTROL PROVISIONS OF H.R. 5263 AND OTHER LEGISLATION.

TO TABLE DOLE AMENDMENT #1019 IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 5263.  THE DOLE SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT EMBODIES THE PROVISIONS OF H.R. 8444, THE HOUSE-PASSED ENERGY TAX BILL.
