H.R. 9346 IS THE SOCIAL SECURITY FINANCING AMENDMENTS OF 1977.
TO PASS S. J. RES. 82, A RESOLUTION EXPRESSING CONGRESSIOANL APPROVAL OF THE  PRESIDENT'S RECOMMENDATION TO USE THE ALCAN PIPELINE FOR TRANSPORTATION OF NATURAL GAS FROM ALASKA TO THE OTHER STATES.

THAT THE SENATE CONCUR IN AN AMENDMENT TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 583) TO SENATE AMENDMENT  #82 (SEE RC 337) TO H.R. 7555, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.  THE BILL AS MODIFIED BY THE MAGNUSON AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE AUTHORIZED FUNDS MAY BE USED FOR MEDICAL PROCEDURES NECESSARY FOR THE TREATMENT OF VICTIMS OF RAPE AND INCEST, AND FOR ABORTIONS IN CASES WHERE THE MOTHER'S LIFE WOULD BE ENDANGERED BY THE PREGNANCY "OR"           AND LONG-LASTING PHYSICAL HEALTH DAMAGE TO THE MOTHER WOULD RESULT IF THE PREGNANCY WERE CARRIED TO TERM."
TO TABLE THE CURTIS SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 612) FOR H.R. 9346, THE PROPOSED SOCIAL  SECURITY FINANCING AMENDMENTS OF 1977.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 9346.  THE CURTIS SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT INCREASES THE SOCIAL SECURITY TAX RATE FOR EMPLOYERS BY 0.5% AND THE TAX RATE FOR EMPLOYEES BY 0.5%.

TO TABLE THE MCINTYRE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 9346.  THE MCINTYRE AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE VETERANS' PENSION AND COMPENSATION PAYMENTS WILL NOT BE REDUCED AS A RESULT OF INCREASES IN MONTHLY SOCIAL SECURITY PAYMENTS CAUSED BY COST-OF-LIVING INCREASES.
TO TABLE THE BELLMON MOTION TO COMMIT H.R. 9346 TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS  TO REPORT IT BACK IN FEBRUARY OF 1978.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT TO THE MODIFIED HOUSE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 610) TO SENATE AMENDMENT #82 (SEE RC 337) TO H.R. 7555, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL 1978. THE BROOKE AMENDMENT MODIFIES THE WORDING OF THE BILL SO AS TO AUTHORIZE THE USE OF HEW FUNDS FOR ABORTIONS ONLY IF THE LIFE OF THE MOTHER WOULD BE ENDANGERED BY THE PREGNANCY "AND" IF THERE WOULD BE SEVERE AND LONG-LASTING PHYSICAL DAMAGE TO THE MOTHER IF THE PREGNANCY WERE CARRIED TO TERM.
TO TABLE THE DANFORTH AMENDMENT (SEE RC 617) TO H.R. 9346.

TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY AUTHORIZING A REFUNDABLE TAX CREDIT OF 10% FROM THE GENERAL FUND FOR STATES, MUNICIPALITIES, PRIVATE AND PUBLIC COLLEGES AND OTHER CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS FOR THEIR TOTAL SOCIAL SECURITY LIABILITIES.

TO AMEND THE CRANSTON SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR H.R. 8175, THE BILL EXTENDING CERTAIN PROVISIONS  OF THE VETERANS' ADMINISTRATIVE PHYSICIANS AND DENTISTS PAY COMPARIBILITY ACT. THE MATHIAS AMENDMENT WOULD EXTEND THE PROPOSED INCENTIVE PAY PROVISIONS FOR VA PHYSICIANS AND DENTISTS EMPLOYED BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY INCREASING THE "EARNED INCOME DISREGARD" FOR RECIPIENTS OF AID FOR  FAMILIES WITH DEPENDENT CHILDREN (AFDC).  THE MOYNIHAN AMENDMENT WOULD DISREGARD THE FIRST $30.00 IN MONTHLY BENEFITS, DISREGARD A LIMITED AMOUNT OF CHILD CARE EXPENSES, LIMIT WORK-RELATED EXPENSES TO 15-25% OF THE GROSS INCOME AS DETERMINED BY THE STATE AND HEW, AND WOULD DISREGARD ONE-THIRD OF THE REMAINING INCOME AFTER THE THREE ABOVE DEDUCTIONS WERE MADE.
TO TABLE THE CHURCH SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 621) FOR THE GOLDWATER AMENDMENT  (SEE RC 622) TO H.R. 9346.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE GOLDWATER AMENDMENT (SEE RC 622)  TO H.R. 9346.  THE CHURCH SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT STATES THAT AFTER AGE SEVENTY A PERSON MAY EARN UNLIMITED INCOME WITHOUT LOSING HIS OR HER SOCIAL SECURITY BENEFITS.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 9346 THAT REPEALS THE EARNINGS LIMITATION FOR  INDIVIDUALS AGED SEVENTY OR OLDER.  THE ORIGINAL GOLDWATER AMENDMENT WOULD HAVE PROVIDED THAT BY 1982, ANY INDIVIDUAL AGE SIXTY-FIVE OR OLDER COULD EARN UNLIMITED INCOME WITHOUT LOSING HIS OR HER SOCIAL SECURITY BENEFITS.

TO TABLE CURTIS AMENDMENT #1055 TO H.R. 9346.  THE CURTIS AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES A 0.5% TOTAL INCREASE IN THE SOCIAL SECURITY TAX TO BE SHARED EQUALLY BY EMPLOYERS AND EMPLOYEES, AND INCREASES THE WAGE BASE.  (ON THIS ROLLCALL, VICE-PRESIDENT MONDALE HAS VOTED "AYE.")

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1059 TO THE ROTH AMENDMENT (SEE RC 626) TO H.R. 9346.  THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES TO TAX-PAYING PARENTS A TUITION TAX CREDIT OF $150 IF ONE OFFSPRING IS ENROLLED FULL-TIME IN A HIGHER EDUCATION PROGRAM AND A $250 TAX CREDIT IF MORE THAN ONE DEPENDENT IS ENROLLED FULL-TIME.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1060 TO THE ROTH AMENDMENT (SEE RC 626) TO H.R. 9346.  KENNEDY AMENDMENT #1060 REDUCES THE TUITION TAX CREDIT FOR TAXPAYERS WITH AN ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME OF MORE THAN $25,000 ANNUALLY.
TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 9346 THAT PROVIDES FOR A TUITION TAX CREDIT OF $250 PER  DEPENDENT THAT IS ENROLLED FULL TIME IN AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION.
TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY PROVIDING FOR SEMI-ANNUAL COST-OF-LIVING INCREASES IN SOCIAL SECURITY  BENEFITS DURING PERIODS OF ACCELERATED INFLATION.

TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FROM THE GENERAL REVENUES TO COVER THE COSTS  OF THE 10% SOCIAL SECURITY TAX CREDIT GRANTED TO STATES, MUNICIPALITIES AND CERTAIN CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS (SEE RC 617).
TO AMEND H.R. 9346 BY EXTENDING THE PROVISIONS OF THE EMERGENCY UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION ACT OF 1974 FOR AN ADDITIONAL SIX MONTHS THROUGH APRIL 30, 1978.

TO TABLE THE MODIFIED TOWER AMENDMENT #1066 TO H.R. 9346, AN AMENDMENT PROPOSING SHORT TERM  FINANCIAL SOLUTIONS FOR THE SOCIAL SECURITY SYSTEM UNTIL A SPECIAL COMMISSION HAS HAD TIME TO RESEARCH THE PROBLEM AND REPORT BACK RECOMMENDATIONS TO CONGRESS BY JANUARY 1, 1980.
TO PASS H.R. 9346.

TO PASS H.R. 9418, AFTER STRIKING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND SUBSTITUTING IN LIEU  THEREOF THE MODIFIED TEXT OF S. 2159. S. 2159 AMENDS THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE ACT WITH RESPECT TO ADMISSIONS, CURRICULA, AND FINANCIAL AID AT MEDICAL, PUBLIC HEALTH AND DENTISTRY SCHOOLS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE BROOKE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 635) TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 583) TO SENATE AMENDMENT #82 (SEE RC 337) TO H.R. 7555, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, AND OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND WELFARE FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.  THE HELMS SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE USE OF FEDERAL FUNDS FOR ABORTIONS UNLESS THE MOTHER'S LIFE WOULD BE ENDANGERED IF THE FETUS WERE CARRIED TO TERM.

TO MODIFY THE BROOKE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 635) TO THE HOUSE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 583) TO THE SENATE  AMENDMENT #82 (SEE RC 337) TO H.R. 7555 BY INSERTING THE WORD "PROMPTLY." THE EFFECT OF THE HELMS PERFECTING AMENDMENT IS TO ALLOW THE USE OF FEDERAL FUNDS FOR ABORTIONS IF THE LIFE OF THE MOTHER WOULD BE ENDANGERED BY THE PREGNANCY, OR IF THE MOTHER IS A VICTIM OF RAPE OR INCEST AND HAS "PROMPTLY" REPORTED THE INCIDENT TO A LAW ENFORCEMENT OR HEALTH SERVICE AGENCY.

TO MODIFY THE HOUSE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 583) TO SENATE AMENDMENT #82 (SEE RC 337) TO H.R. 7555.  THE BROOKE AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE USE OF FEDERAL FUNDS FOR ABORTIONS IF THE LIFE OF THE MOTHER WOULD BE ENDANGERED BY THE PREGNANCY, IF SEVERE AND LONG-LASTING PHYSICAL HEALTH DAMAGE WOULD RESULT TO THE MOTHER, OR IF THE MOTHER IS A VICTIM OF RAPE OR INCEST AND HAS REPORTED THE INCIDENT TO THE PROPER AUTHORITIES.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 9346, THE SOCIAL SECURITY FINANCING AMENDMENTS OF 1977.

TO TABLE THE HART AMENDMENT TO S. 1437, THE BILL REVISING AND REFORMING THE CRIMINAL CODE OF THE UNITED STATES.  HART AMENDMENT #1011 PROHIBITS IMPRISONMENT FOR THE SOLE PURPOSE OF REHABILITATION OF A DEFENDANT.

TO TABLE THE SCOTT AMENDMENT #1660 TO S. 1437.  AMENDMENT #1660 STRIKES FROM THE BILL A SECTION THAT GIVES THE DEFENDANT OR THE GOVERNMENT THE RIGHT TO APPEAL A SENTENCE THAT FALLS OUTSIDE OF THE REGULATIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE U.S. SENTENCING COMMISSION.
TO TABLE SCOTT AMENDMENT #1659 TO S. 1437.  AMENDMENT #1659 STRIKES FROM THE BILL THE PROVISION FOR A UNITED STATES SENTENCING COMMISSION.
TO TABLE THE DOLE AMENDMENT #1104 (SEE RC 5) TO S. 1437.
TO AMEND S. 1437 BY ALLOWING STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS TO APPLY THEIR OWN STANDARDS OF OBSCENITY.

TO TABLE DOLE AMENDMENT #1105 TO S. 1437.  AMENDMENT #1105 ALLOWS THE DENIAL OF PRE-TRIAL RELEASE TO INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE BEEN ACCUSED OF COMMITING MURDER, RAPE, ARMED KIDNAPPING, ARMED ROBBERY, AIRCRAFT HIJACKING IN WHICH A DEATH OCCURS, OR SEIZURE OF A HOSTAGE IN ORDER TO NEGOTIATE RELEASE OF ANOTHER ACCUSED INDIVIDUAL.
TO INSTRUCT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO REQUEST THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.
TO INSTRUCT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO REQUEST THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.
TO TABLE SCOTT AMENDMENT #1115 TO S. 1437.  AMENDMENT #1115 EMBODIES THE TEXT OF S. 1382, A BILL THAT INCREASES THE NUMBER AND TYPES OF CRIMES THAT ARE PUNISHABLE BY DEATH.
TO AMEND S. 1437 BY INCORPORATING THE TEXT OF S. 1585, THE PROTECTION OF CHILDREN AGAINST SEXUAL EXPLOITATION ACT OF 1977.

TO TABLE THE MATHIAS AMENDMENT TO S. 1437.  THE MATHIAS AMENDMENT MODIFIES THE VENUE PROVISIONS FOR OBSCENITY CHARGES SO THAT THE DEFENDANT MAY BE PROSECUTED IN THE DISTRICT IN WHICH THE OBSCENE MATERIALS WERE MAILED OR RECEIVED, OR IN THE DISTRICT WHERE THE DEFENDANT'S PRIMARY PLACE OF BUSINESS IS LOCATED.
TO TABLE SEVERAL COMMITTEE AMENDMENTS (SEE RC 13) TO S. 1437.

TO AGREE TO SEVERAL COMMITTEE AMENDMENTS TO S. 1437, THE EFFECT OF WHICH WOULD BE TO MODIFY THE VENUE PROVISIONS FOR OBSCENITY PRACTICES SO THAT THE DEFENDANT MAY BE PROSECUTED ONLY IN THE DISTRICT IN WHICH THE MATERIAL WAS DISSEMINATED OR THE DISTRICT IN WHICH THE OFFENSE WAS COMPLETED.

TO TABLE A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO S. 1437 THAT STATES THAT A PERSON ACCUSED OF DISSEMINATING OBSCENE MATERIALS MAY HAVE A DEFENSE IF THE DISSEMINATION OF THAT MATERIAL WAS LEGAL IN THE STATE IN WHICH IT OCCURRED.
TO INSTRUCT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO REQUEST THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #1138 TO THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 14) TO S. 1437.  AMENDMENT #1138 STATES THAT A PERSON ACCUSED OF DISSEMINATING OBSCENE MATERIALS HAS A DEFENSE IF THE DISSEMINATION OF THAT MATERIAL HAS BEEN LEGALIZED BY STATUTE IN THE STATE IN WHICH THE MATERIAL WAS DISTRIBUTED.

TO AMEND THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 14) TO S. 1437 BY STATING THAT THE DEFENDANT IN A CASE OF DISSEMINATION OF OBSCENE MATERIALS HAS A DEFENSE IF THE DISSEMINATION OF THAT MATERIAL HAS BEEN LEGALIZED IN THE "POLITICAL SUBDIVISION OR LOCALITY" IN WHICH THE MATERIAL WAS DISTRIBUTED.
TO AGREE TO THE MODIFIED COMMITTEE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 17) TO S. 1437.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #1151 TO S. 1437, AN AMENDMENT THAT WOULD DELETE THE SECTION OF THE BILL THAT STATES THAT THE "EXISTENCE OF FEDERAL JURISDICTION IS NOT AN ELEMENT OF THE OFFENSE" AND EACH JURY MUST THEN PROVE FEDERAL JURISDICTION BEFORE DETERMINING A VERDICT.
TO AMEND S. 1437 BY ADDING A NEW TITLE OF TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS TO THE BILL.
TO PASS S. 1437.

TO AMEND S. 1976, THE BILL INCREASING THE ACREAGE OF THE REDWOOD NATIONAL PARK IN THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA, BY RETAINING THE JURISDICTION OF THE COURT OF CLAIMS OVER CASES IN WHICH A LANDOWNER HAS FAILED TO ACT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE NEW LEGISLATION.
TO AMEND S. 1976 BY DELETING THE SECTION OF THE BILL THAT PROVIDES FOR THE ADDITION OF 30,000 ACRES AS A "PARK PROTECTION ZONE" BEYOND THE 48,000 ACRES DESIGNATED FOR EXPANSION OF THE PARK.
TO PASS S. 1976.
TO TABLE THE HAYAKAWA MOTION THAT THE SENATE RECEDE FROM ITS AMENDMENT #43 (SEE RC 26) TO H.R. 9375, THE BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978.

TO INSIST ON SENATE AMENDMENT #43 TO H.R. 9375, THE BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978. AMENDMENT #43 RESCINDS $462 MILLION APPROPRIATED IN FISCAL YEAR 1977 FOR THE PRODUCTION OF ADDITIONAL B-1 BOMBERS, AND HALTS PRODUCTION OF SEVERAL OF THE AIRCRAFT.

TO AMEND THE MCCLURE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 28) TO S. 897, THE NUCLEAR NONPROLIFERATION ACT OF 1978.  THE GLENN AMENDMENT REQUIRES THAT A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION BE PASSED BY THE UNITED STATES CONGRESS IN ORDER TO VETO ADMINISTRATIVE PLANS FOR STORAGE OF SPENT NUCLEAR FUEL FROM FOREIGN COUNTRIES.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 897 THAT ALLOWS CONGRESS TO VETO, BY WAY OF A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, ANY ADMINISTRATIVE PLAN TO BRING SPENT NUCLEAR FUEL FROM FOREIGN NUCLEAR POWER REACTORS TO THE UNITED STATES FOR SHORT-TERM OR PERMANENT STORAGE. THE ORIGINAL MCCLURE AMENDMENT PROVIDED FOR A ONE-HOUSE VETO OF SUCH A PLAN.

TO TABLE THE DOMENICI AMENDMENT #1210 TO S. 897.  AMENDMENT #1210 STATES THAT THE NUCLEAR REGULATORY COMMISSION HAS THE DISCRETION TO WAIVE THE FULL REVIEW OF EXPORT LICENSES SO THAT THE LICENSE IS REVIEWED ONLY ONCE EVERY FIVE YEARS.
TO PASS H.R. 8638 AFTER STRIKING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF THE TEXT OF S. 897.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3454, THE ENDANGERED AMERICAN WILDERNESS ACT OF 1977.
TO INSTRUCT THE SERGEANT AT ARMS TO COMPEL THE ATTENDANCE OF ABSENT SENATORS.  (SINCE THIS VOTE OCCURRED WHILE THE SENATE WAS IN CLOSED DOOR SESSION, THE DATA ARE NOT PRESENTLY AVAILABLE.)
TO TABLE THE ALLEN MOTION TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, (EXECUTIVE N, 95TH CONGRESS, FIRST SESSION), EXECUTIVE CALENDAR NO. 2.

TO TABLE THE ALLEN AMENDMENT #40 TO THE TREATY CONCERNING THE PERMANENT NEUTRALITY AND OPERATION  OF THE PANAMA CANAL, (EXECUTIVE N, 95TH CONGRESS, FIRST SESSION), EXECUTIVE CALENDAR NO. 1.  AMENDMENT #40 ALLOWS THE UNITED STATES TO MAINTAIN A MILITARY PRESENCE IN THE PANAMA CANAL ZONE UNTIL THE YEAR 2019 IF BY THE YEAR 1999, THE PRESIDENT CERTIFIES THAT MAINTAINING SUCH PRESENCE IS NECESSARY FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE CANAL.

TO TABLE THE HATCH AMENDMENT TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY, (EXECUTIVE N, 95TH CONGRESS, FIRST SESSION), EXECUTIVE CALENDAR NO. 1.  THE HATCH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE ENGLISH TEXT OF THE TREATY SHALL BE LEGALLY BINDING IN THE EVENT OF A DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE SPANISH AND ENGLISH TRANSLATIONS OF THE DOCUMENT.
TO AMEND THE NEUTRALITY TREATY BY PROVIDING THAT IT SHALL NOT BE EFFECTIVE UNLESS THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY IS RATIFIED BY THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #35 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. AMENDMENT #35 PROVIDES FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF U.S. TROOPS IN THE CANAL ZONE AFTER THE YEAR 1999 IF, AT THAT TIME, THE UNITED STATES IS AT WAR WITH ANY NATION SEEKING TO TRANSPORT ITS WARSHIPS THROUGH THE NEUTRAL CANAL.
TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #2 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. AMENDMENT #2 ALLOWS THE UNITED STATES TO PREVENT ENEMY WARSHIPS FROM REACHING THE NEUTRAL CANAL ZONE.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #51 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. AMENDMENT #51 PROVIDES FOR THE CONTINUED MILITARY PRESENCE OF THE UNITED STATES IN PANAMA UNTIL THE YEAR 2019 IF THE PRESIDENT DEEMS THAT THE GOVERNMENT OF PANAMA IS DOMINATED BY A FOREIGN POWER, OR IS COMMUNIST.
TO AMEND THE NEUTRALITY TREATY BY REQUIRING THAT PANAMA COMMIT ITSELF TO RESPECT AND ABIDE BY THE PROVISIONS OF THE MONROE DOCTRINE.
TO AMEND THE NEUTRALITY TREATY BY REQUIRING THAT ANY OTHER CANAL THAT IS BUILT EITHER PARTIALLY OR WHOLLY IN THE TERRITORY OF THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA SHALL ALSO BE NEUTRAL.
TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #61 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. AMENDMENT #61 DENIES THE RIGHT OF NEUTRAL TRANSIT TO WARSHIPS OR SUBMARINES OWNED BY COUNTRIES THAT ARE AT WAR WITH THE UNITED STATES.
TO TABLE THE HELMS AMENDMENT #4 TO ARTICLE II OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  AMENDMENT #4 PROVIDES FOR THE CONTINUED U.S. MAINTENANCE OF MILITARY BASES ON THE GALETA ISLAND AFTER THE YEAR 1999.

TO TABLE STEVENS AMENDMENT #64 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. AMENDMENT #64 DENIES THE RIGHT OF NEUTRAL TRANSIT TO WARSHIPS OR SUBMARINES OWNED BY NATIONS THAT ARE AT WAR OR IN A STATE OF BELLIGERENCE WITH EITHER THE UNITED STATES OR THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #5 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. AMENDMENT #5 STRIKES THE SECION OF THE TREATY THAT ENTITLES THE WARSHIPS AND AUXILIARY VESSELS OF ANY NATION TO UNOBSTRUCTED TRANSIT OF THE CANAL.

TO TABLE THE DOLE AMENDMENT #59 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY, AN AMENDMENT THAT GUARANTEES THE UNITED STATES THE RIGHT TO INTERVENE MILITARILY EVEN WHEN THERE HAS ONLY BEEN A UNILATERAL JUDGEMENT ABOUT POSSIBLE THREAT TO THE NEUTRALITY OF THE CANAL.

TO TABLE THE HELMS AMENDMENT #27 OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE BYRD (WV) EXECUTIVE AMENDMENT #20 (SEE RC 49) TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  AMENDMENT #27 STATES THAT IN THE EVENT OF ANY THREAT TO THE REGIME OF NEUTRALITY OF THE PANAMA CANAL, BOTH PARTIES SHALL CONSULT CONCERNING JOINT AND INDIVIDUAL EFFORTS TO SECURE NEUTRALITY.  IF JOINT PLANS SEEM INADEQUATE, EITHER PARTY MAY TAKE WHATEVER ECONOMIC, DIPLOMATIC, OR MILITARY MEASURES THAT IT DEEMS NECESSARY FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE CANAL.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #6 TO THE BYRD (WV) EXECUTIVE AMEND- MENT #20 (SEE RC 49) TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  ALLEN AMEND- MENT #6 DELETES THE SECTION OF THE AMENDMENT THAT DENIES THE UNITED STATES THE RIGHT TO TAKE ANY ACTION AGAINST THE TERRITORIAL INTEGRITY OR POLITICAL INDEPENDENCE OF PANAMA, AND LEAVES ONLY THE FOLLOWING WORDING:  "ANY UNITED STATES ACTION WILL BE DIRECTED AT INSURING THE CANAL WILL REMAIN OPEN, SECURE, AND ACCESSIBLE."

TO AMEND THE NEUTRALITY TREATY BY PROVIDING THAT PANAMA AND THE UNITED STATES SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO DEFEND THE CANAL AGAINST ANY THREAT TO THE REGIME OF NEUTRALITY, BUT AT THE SAME TIME, THE UNITED STATES SHALL NOT HAVE THE RIGHT TO TAKE ANY ACTION AGAINST THE TERRITORIAL INTEGRITY OR POLITICAL INDEPENDENCE OF PANAMA.

TO TABLE THE DOLE MODIFIED AMENDMENT #12 TO ARTICLE V OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  DOLE AMENDMENT #12 STATES THAT U.S. TROOPS MAY REMAIN IN PANAMA UNTIL THE YEAR 2010 IF BOTH PARTIES HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO REACH A MUTUAL AGREEMENT FOR THE CONTINUED AVAILABILITY TO THE UNITED STATES OF ANY DEFENSE SITE OR MILITARY INSTALLATION AFTER THE DATE OF TERMINATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.

TO TABLE THE DOLE AMENDMENT #58 TO ARTICLE V OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY BY PROVIDING THAT AFTER THE TERMINATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, ONLY PANAMA SHALL MAINTAIN MILITARY FORCES, MILITARY INSTALLATIONS, AND DEFENSE SITES "EXCEPT AS THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA MAY OTHERWISE AGREE."

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #8 TO THE BYRD (WV) EXECUTIVE AMEND- MENT #21 (SEE RC 54) TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  AMENDMENT #8 STATES THAT THE UNITED STATES SHALL BE THE SOLE JUDGE OF WHETHER AN "EMERGENCY" EXISTS.

TO TABLE THE DOLE AMENDMENT #60 TO THE BYRD (WV) EXECUTIVE AMENDMENT #21 (SEE RC 54) TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  DOLE AMENDMENT #60 STATES THAT THE EXISTENCE OF AN "EMERGENCY" MAY BE "DETERMINED BY EACH HEAD OF STATE FOR VESSELS OF HIS NATION."
TO AMEND THE NEUTRALITY TREATY BY PROVIDING THAT WARSHIPS AND AUXILIARY VESSELS OF THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO TRANSIT THE CANAL WITHOUT DELAY DURING EMERGENCIES.

TO TABLE THE HELMS AMENDMENT #9 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. AMENDMENT #9 PROVIDES THAT WARSHIPS AND AUXILIARY VESSELS OF THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT OF TOLL-FREE TRANSIT OF THE CANAL.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #77 TO ARTICLE V OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  AMENDMENT #77 STATES THAT THE PROVISIONS OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY SHALL NOT PREVENT THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA FROM NEGOTIATING LATER AGREEMENTS TO MAINTAIN U.S. MILITARY PRESENCE IN PANAMA AFTER THE YEAR 1999.

TO TABLE THURMOND AMENDMENT #73 TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. THE THURMOND AMENDMENT ADDS A NEW ARTICLE IX THAT AUTHORIZES THE AMERICAN BATTLE MONUMENTS COMMISSION TO ARRANGE FOR THE TRANSFER OF THE REMAINS OF THE U.S. CITIZENS FROM MOUNT HOPE CEMETERY TO THE AMERICAN SECTOR OF THE COROZAL CEMETERY.

TO TABLE THE SCHMITT AMENDMENT #78 OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  THE SCHMITT SUBSTITUTE TREATY PROVIDES FOR INTERNATIONAL MANAGEMENT AND DEFENSE OF THE PANAMA CANAL.

TO AGREE TO EXECUTIVE RESERVATION #8 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  THE NUNN RESERVATION PROVIDES THAT NOTHING IN THE NEUTRALITY TREATY SHALL PREVENT THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA FROM NEGOTIATING AN AGREEMENT TO MAINTAIN UNITED STATES MILITARY FORCES OR DEFENSE SITES IN THE CANAL ZONE AFTER THE YEAR 1999.

TO AGREE TO EXECUTIVE RESERVATION #7 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  THE RANDOLPH RESERVATION PROVIDES THAT BEFORE THE TREATY IS PUT INTO EFFECT, THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA SHALL NEGOTIATE AN AGREEMENT ALLOWING THE AMERICAN BATTLE MONUMENTS COMMISSION TO ADMINISTER THE AMERICAN SECTOR OF THE COROZAL CEMETERY AFTER THE YEAR 1999.

TO TABLE THE BARTLETT EXECUTIVE RESERVATION #4 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY. RESERVATION #4 STATES THAT PRIOR TO EXCHANGING THE RATIFIED TREATIES, THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES MUST DETERMINE WHETHER PANAMA HAS RATIFIED THE AMENDED TREATIES BY MEANS OF A NATIONAL PLEBISCITE.
TO TABLE THE MODIFIED DECONCINI EXECUTIVE AMENDMENT #83 (SEE RC 64) TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.

TO TABLE THE ALLEN EXECUTIVE AMENDMENT #12 TO THE MODIFIED DECONCINI AMENDMENT #83 (SEE RC 64) TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  THE ALLEN AMENDMENT STATES THAT THE DECONCINI AMENDMENT SHALL BE CONSIDERED AS AN AMENDMENT TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY, RATHER THAN AS AN AMENDMENT TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY BY PROVIDING THAT BOTH THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO TAKE MILITARY OR NON-MILITARY ACTIONS TO REOPEN THE CANAL IN THE EVENT OF ITS CLOSING OR IN THE EVENT OF INTERFERENCE WITH ITS OPERATIONS.

TO TABLE THE MODIFIED GRIFFIN EXECUTIVE AMENDMENT #71, OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.  THE MODIFIED GRIFFIN SUBSTITUTE WITHOLDS SENATE APPROVAL OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY AND ADVISES THE PRESIDENT TO RENEGOTIATE THE TREATY WITH PANAMA AND ALL THE NATIONS OF THE WESTERN HEMISHERE.
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY CONCERNING THE PERMANENT NEUTRALITY AND OPERATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL.

TO TABLE THE WALLOP AMENDMENT TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY (EXECUTIVE N, 95TH CONGRESS, FIRST SESSION), EXECUTIVE CALENDAR NO. 2.  THE WALLOP AMENDMENT STATES THAT IF PANAMA ABROGATES ANY PROVISION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY OR THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, THEN THE NEW TREATIES SHALL BE TERMINATED AND SUPERSEDED BY THE FORMER TREATIES.
TO AMEND THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY BY PROVIDING THAT THERE SHALL BE NO OTHER FOREIGN MILITARY PRESENCE OTHER THAN THE UNITED STATES IN THE TERRITORY OF THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA PRIOR TO THE YEAR 2000.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6782, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR A FEDERAL MARKETING ORDER FOR THE PROMOTION OF RAISINS.  THE MODIFIED MCGOVERN AMENDMENT INCREASES THE LOAN RATES AND TARGET PRICES FOR THE 1978 CROPS OF WHEAT, CORN, AND UPLAND COTTON.
TO TABLE THE BELLMON AMENDMENT #1219 TO THE DOLE AMENDMENT #1216 (SEE RC 71) TO  H.R. 6782.  THE BELLMON AMENDMENT RAISES THE SET-ASIDE REQUIREMENTS FOR WHEAT CROPS.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 6782 THAT WILL PROVIDE FOR A SYSTEM OF FLEXIBLE PARITY.  THE MODIFIED DOLE AMENDMENT STATES THAT IF A FARMER CHOOSES TO ADDITIONALLY SET-ASIDE UP TO 50% OF HIS LANDS, HE WILL RECEIVE GOVERNMENT PAYMENTS FIGURED ON A SLIDING SCALE OF TARGET PRICES THAT IS LINKED TO THE PERCENTAGE OF THE FARMER'S LAND THAT HE HAS VOLUNTARILY SET-ASIDE.
TO PASS H.R. 6782.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3813, THE BILL INCREASING THE ACREAGE OF THE REDWOOD NATIONAL PARK IN CALIFORNIA.

TO TABLE DIVISION 1 OF THE ALLEN AMENDMENT #86 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, (EXECUTIVE N, 95TH CONGRESS, FIRST SESSION), EXECUTIVE CALENDAR NO. 2.  DIVISION 1 OF THE ALLEN AMENDMENT PROTECTS THE RIGHT OF THE UNITED STATES TO PREVENT THE CONSTRUCTION OF A SECOND CANAL IN PANAMA BY ANY NATION OTHER THAN THE UNITED STATES.

TO TABLE DIVISION 2 OF THE ALLEN AMENDMENT #86 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  DIVISION 2 OF THE ALLEN AMENDMENT PROTECTS THE RIGHT OF THE UNITED STATES TO NEGOTIATE WITH ANY OTHER NATION THE CONSTRUCTION OF A TRANSOCEANIC CANAL ANYWHERE IN THE WESTERN HEMISPHERE.
TO AMEND THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY BY AUTHORIZING PANAMA TO LEASE ITS CANAL AREAS AND MILITARY INSTALLATIONS TO THE UNITED STATES FOR A PERIOD OF 99 YEARS.
TO AMEND THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY BY PROVIDING THAT PANAMA MAY NOT NATIONALIZE, EXPROPRIATE OR SEIZE OWNERSHIP OF ANY U.S. PROPERTY FOR THE DURATION OF THIS TREATY.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5383, THE BILL AMENDING THE AGE DISCRIMINATION IN EMPLOYMENT ACT BY INCREASING THE MANDATORY RETIREMENT AGE TO SEVENTY FOR MOST OCCUPATIONS.

TO TABLE HATCH AMENDMENT #92 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. HATCH AMENDMENT #92 STATES THAT THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY WILL NOT TAKE EFFECT UNTIL CONGRESS HAS AUTHORIZED THE DISPOSAL OF ALL U.S. PROPERTY IN THE CANAL ZONE.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #91 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. AMENDMENT #91 ALLOWS U.S. EMPLOYEES OF THE PANAMA CANAL COMPANY TO CONTINUE TO HOLD THEIR POSITIONS UNTIL THEY REACH RETIREMENT AGE, RETIRE VOLUNTARILY, OR ARE DISCHARGED FOR CAUSE.

TO TABLE HELMS AMENDMENT #17 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, AN AMENDMENT THAT RESTORES A SECTION OF THE OLD TREATY THAT ALLOWS EITHER THE UNITED STATES OR PANAMA TO TAKE NECESSARY ACTION IN THE CASE OF AN INTERNATIONAL THREAT TO THE SECURITY OF THE CANAL, OR TO THE SECURITY OF THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #18 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. AMENDMENT #18 REQUIRES SENATE CONFIRMATION OF ALL OF THE U.S. AND PANAMANIAN NOMINEES TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION.

TO TABLE BARTLETT AMENDMENT #41 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. THE BARTLETT AMENDMENT STATES THAT IF THE SURPLUS REVENUES FROM THE OPERATION OF THE CANAL ARE NOT SUFFICIENT TO COVER THE $10 MILLION ANNUAL PAYMENT FROM THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION TO THE GOVERNMENT OF PANAMA, THE UNITED STATES SHALL NOT BE OBLIGATED TO PAY THE UNPAID BALANCE.

TO WAIVE SECTION 303(A) OF THE CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET ACT SO THAT THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6782, THE PROPOSED EMERGENCY AGRICULTURAL ACT OF 1978, CAN BE CONSIDERED PRIOR TO THE ADOPTION OF THE FIRST BUDGET RESOLUTION FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6782.

TO TABLE DOLE AMENDMENT #10 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. AMENDMENT #10 STRIKES A SECTION OF THE TREATY THAT PROHIBITS THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA FROM INDEPENDENTLY NEGOTIATING WITH A THIRD COUNTRY FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF ANOTHER INTEROCEANIC CANAL IN THE WESTERN HEMISPHERE.

TO TABLE HATCH AMENDMENT #38 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. AMENDMENT #38 STATES THAT THE OPERATING REVENUES OF THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION SHALL BE DEPOSITED IN THE U.S. TREASURY AND THAT THE REIMBURSEMENT OF PANAMA SHALL THEN BE SUBJECT TO THE APPROPRIATIONS PROCESS OF THE U.S. CONGRESS.

TO TABLE HELMS AMENDMENT #100 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  HELMS AMENDMENT #100 PROVIDES THAT THE PERSONNEL, VEHICLES, VESSELS AND AIRCRAFT OF THE UNITED STATES FORCES SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO MOVE FREELY THROUGHOUT PANAMANIAN LAND SPACE, AIRSPACE AND WATERWAYS "WITHOUT IMPEDIMENT" OF ANY KIND.

TO TABLE HELMS AMENDMENT #20 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, AN AMENDMENT THAT EXPLICITLY GIVES THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA AND THE UNITED STATES THE RIGHT TO CONDUCT SEPARATE MILITARY PLANNING EXERCISES OR OPERATIONS THAT ARE DEEMED NECESSARY FOR THE DEFENSE OF THE CANAL.
TO TABLE HELMS AMENDMENT #21 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. AMENDMENT #21 ALLOWS THE UNITED STATES TO TRANSPORT NUCLEAR ARMAMENTS THROUGH THE CANAL OR ON MILITARY BASES LOCATED IN THE CANAL ZONE.

TO TABLE CANNON AMENDMENT #23 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, AN AMENDMENT THAT REDUCES THE ANNUAL PAYMENT OF THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION TO THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA FROM $10 MILLION TO $5 MILLION U.S. DOLLARS.
TO TABLE HATCH AMENDMENT #22 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. AMENDMENT #22 REQUIRES THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA TO INSURE FREEDOM OF SPEECH AND FREEDOM OF THE PRESS IN THE COUNTRY.

TO TABLE HELMS AMENDMENT #102 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  HELMS AMENDMENT #102 REQUIRES THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA TO GUARANTEE THE CONTINUED RECOGNITION OF THE CIVIL RIGHTS OF THE U.S. CITIZENS IN THE CANAL ZONE.

TO TABLE HATCH AMENDMENT #82 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. AMENDMENT #82 STATES THAT U.S. CITIZENS WHO LOSE THEIR JOBS WITH THE PANAMA CANAL COMPANY AS A RESULT OF THE RATIFICATION OF THE NEW TREATIES, SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO EQUITABLE JOB PLACEMENTS WITHIN THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES.

TO TABLE STEVENS AMENDMENT #90 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. STEVENS AMENDMENT #90 STATES THAT IF EITHER PANAMA OR THE UNITED STATES SHOULD ABROGATE ANY RESERVATION, DECLARATION, OR UNDERSTANDING ATTACHED BY EITHER PARTY TO THE NEW TREATY OR ITS RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION, THEN SUCH TREATY SHALL BE TERMINATED AND THE FOUR SUPERSEDED TREATIES SHALL REMAIN IN EFFECT.

TO TABLE THE THURMOND AMENDMENT #24 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  AMENDMENT #24 STATES THAT THE OPERATING EXPENSES OF THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION SHALL BE PAID BEFORE ANY ANNUAL PAYMENTS ARE MADE TO THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA.

TO TABLE SCHMITT AMENDMENT #97 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. AMENDMENT #97 GRANTS U.S. OWNERSHIP IN PERPETUITY OF THE SECTION OF THE COROZAL CEMETERY THAT ENCOMPASSES THE REMAINS OF CITIZENS OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO TABLE THE ALLEN AMENDMENT #101 TO THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, AN AMENDMENT REQUIRING THE CITIZENS OF PANAMA TO APPROVE THE NEW TREATY BY NATIONAL PLEBISCITE WITHIN SIX MONTHS OF THE DATE OF EXCHANGE OF THE NEWLY RATIFIED TREATIES.

TO AGREE TO EXECUTIVE AMENDMENT #99 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  AMENDMENT #99 REQUIRES THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA TO WAIVE THEIR RECIPROCAL RIGHTS AND RELEASE ONE ANOTHER FROM THEIR OBLIGATIONS UNDER PARAGRAPH 2 OF ARTICLE XII, THE SECTION OF THE TREATY THAT PROHIBITS THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW INTEROCEANIC CANAL IN THE WESTERN HEMISPHERE.

TO AGREE TO A RESERVATION TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  THE HOLLINGS-HEINZ RESERVATION STATES THAT AFTER TERMINATION OF THE TREATY, THE U.S. SHALL NOT BE OBLIGATED TO PAY ANY OF THE UNPAID BALANCE THAT MIGHT EXIST IF THE SURPLUS REVENUES OF THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION HAVE NOT BEEN GREAT ENOUGH TO SUBSIDIZE THEIR ANNUAL $10 MILLION PAYMENTS TO THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA.

TO TABLE THE MCCLURE SUBSTITUTE RESERVATION FOR THE BROOKE RESERVATION #28 (SEE RC 102) TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  THE MCCLURE SUBSTITUTE REQUIRES THAT THE IMPLEMENTING LEGISLATION FOR THE NEW TREATIES MUST BE ENACTED BY CONGRESS PRIOR TO THE EXCHANGE OF THE INSTRUMENTS OF RATIFICATION.

TO AGREE TO A RESERVATION TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  BROOKE RESERVATION #28 STATES THAT THE RATIFIED TREATIES SHALL NOT BE EXCHANGED UNTIL MARCH 31, 1979, NOR SHALL THEY TAKE EFFECT UNTIL OCTOBER 1, 1979 UNLESS IMPLEMENTING LEGISLATION IS ENACTED BEFORE MARCH 31 OF THAT YEAR.

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION #27 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  BROOKE RESERVATION #27 PROVIDES THAT EVERY THREE YEARS THE UNITED STATES AND PANAMA SHALL AGREE UPON THE SPECIFIC LEVELS AND QUALITY OF SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED BY THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA TO THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION IN EXCHANGE FOR ITS $10 MILLION ANNUAL PAYMENT TO THE COUNTRY.

TO TABLE HELMS RESERVATION #18 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  RESERVATION #18 STATES THAT THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION SHALL BE OBLIGATED TO MAKE ANNUAL PAYMENTS TO THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA THAT WILL VARY ACCORDING TO THE EXTENT THAT THE OPERATING REVENUES OF THE CANAL EXCEED THE EXPENDITURES OF THE COMMISSION FOR EACH YEAR.

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION #19 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  CURTIS RESERVATION #19 PROVIDES THAT ALL U.S. ECONOMIC ASSISTANCE TO PANAMA THAT IS CONNECTED WITH THESE TREATIES SHALL BE SUSPENDED UNTIL SETTLEMENT OF ALL OF THE CLAIMS THAT WERE FILED BEFORE SEPTEMBER 7, 1977 BY U.S. CITIZENS WHOSE PROPERTIES HAVE BEEN NATURALIZED, EXPROPRIATED, SEIZED OR OCCUPIED BY THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA.

TO TABLE DOLE RESERVATION #33 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  RESERVATION #33 STATES THAT THE FIXED ANNUAL ANNUITY OF $10 MILLION U.S. DOLLARS SHALL BE WAIVED DURING ANY PERIOD IN WHICH THE CANAL IS INOPERABLE.

TO TABLE THE DOLE (FOR THURMOND) RESERVATION #34 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY. RESERVATION #34 STATES THAT PRIOR TO THE EXCHANGE OF THE RATIFIED TREATIES, THEY MUST BE RESUBMITTED TO THE SENATE FOR ITS APPROVAL OF ANY ADDITIONAL PANAMANIAN AMENDMENTS OR RESERVATIONS THAT ARE BINDING ON THE UNITED STATES.

TO TABLE THURMOND UNDERSTANDING #16 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  UNDERSTANDING #16 STATES THAT THE U.S. MAY EXAMINE THE ECONOMIC EFFECTS OF ANY TOLL INCREASES AND MAY PRESCRIBE NEW TOLL LEVELS THAT WOULD "MINIMIZE ANY DISPROPORTIONATE EFFECT ON THE COMMERCE OF ANY PORT OF THE UNITED STATES."

TO AGREE TO A RESERVATION TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY THAT PROVIDES THAT THE FIXED ANNUAL $10 MILLION PAYMENT TO PANAMA SHALL NOT ACCUMULATE DURING THE LIFE OF THE TREATY.

TO TABLE BARTLETT RESERVATION #3 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, A RESERVATION THAT WITHOLDS SENATE APPROVAL OF THE TREATY UNTIL THE PRESIDENT HAS DETERMINED IF PANAMA HAS RATIFIED THE MODIFIED TREATIES BY MEANS OF A NATIONAL PLEBISCITE.

TO TABLE THE STEVENS APPEAL FROM THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT BYRD RESERVATION #36 (SEE RC 116) IS IN ORDER EVEN THOUGH IT PERTAINS TO A PROVISION OF THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #104 TO BYRD RESERVATION #36 (SEE RC 116) TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  AMENDMENT #104 ADDS LANGUAGE THAT SAYS THAT RESERVATION #36 SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS LIMITING OR DETRACTING FROM THE DECONCINI RESERVATION (SEE RC 64) TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.

TO TABLE ALLEN AMENDMENT #105 TO BYRD RESERVATION #36 (SEE RC 116) TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  AMENDMENT #105 STATES THAT RESERVATION #36 SHALL BE CONSTRUED AS LIMITING OR DETRACTING FROM THE DECONCINI RESERVATION (SEE RC 64) TO THE NEUTRALITY TREATY.
TO TABLE BYRD RESERVATION #36 (SEE RC 116) TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.

TO TABLE CANNON AMENDMENT #37 TO BYRD RESERVATION #36 (SEE RC 116) TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  THE CANNON AMENDMENT STRIKES LANGUAGE THAT STATES THAT ANY ACTIONS OF THE U.S. SHALL NOT "BE INTERPRETED AS A RIGHT" OF INTERVENTION IN THE INTERNAL AFFAIRS OF PANAMA.

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION #36 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  BYRD RESERVATION #36 STATES THAT EVEN IF ACTION IS TAKEN BY THE UNITED STATES TO PROTECT THE NEUTRALITY, ACCESSIBILITY AND SECURITY OF THE PANAMA CANAL, THE U.S. SHALL NOT CLAIM NOR SEEK TO CLAIM ANY RIGHT OF INTERVENTION IN THE INTERNAL AFFAIRS OF PANAMA.

TO TABLE THE MODIFIED GRIFFIN AMENDMENT #103, OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  GRIFFIN AMENDMENT #103 REQUIRES THE SENATE TO RETURN THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY TO THE PRESIDENT AND ADVISES HIM TO INITIATE NEGOTIATIONS FOR A NEW TREATY THAT WOULD BETTER SERVE "THE INTERESTS OF BOTH NATIONS."

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION #39 TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY.  THE CANNON RESERVATION PROVIDES THAT NO INTEREST PAYMENTS FROM THE PANAMA CANAL COMMISSION TO THE U.S. CAN BE WAIVED WITHOUT THE CONSENT OF CONGRESS.
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PANAMA CANAL TREATY, EXECUTIVE N, 95TH CONGRESS, FIRST SESSION, EXECUTIVE CALENDAR NO. 2.

TO AMEND S. 2493, THE PROPOSED AIR TRANSPORTATION REGULATORY ACT OF 1978, BY MAKING THE AUTOMATIC MARKET ENTRY PROGRAM EXPERIMENTAL, AND TERMINATING IT ON JUNE 30, 1985.  THE AUTOMATIC MARKET ENTRY PROGRAM GIVES THE AIRLINES LIMITED AUTHORITY TO ENTER ADDITIONAL ROUTES AND CHANGE FLIGHT FARES WITHOUT PRIOR APPROVAL OF THE CIVIL AERONAUTICS BOARD.

TO TABLE MCGOVERN AMENDMENT #1784 TO S. 2493, AN AMENDMENT THAT SEEKS TO INSURE THAT A COMPARABLE SUBSTITUTE AIR SERVICE WILL BE PROVIDED FOR SMALLER COMMUNITIES WHOSE ESSENTIAL AIR TRANSPORTATION LINES ARE DISCONTINUED AS A RESULT OF THIS ACT.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE ZORINSKY AMENDMENT #1229 (SEE RC 124) TO S. 2493.  THE DANFORTH AMENDMENT INCREASES THE SCOPE OF THE LABOR PROTECTION PROVISION TO INCLUDE A GREATER NUMBER OF AIRLINE EMPLOYEES.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE ZORINSKY AMENDMENT #1229 (SEE  RC 124) TO S. 2493.  THE HATCH AMENDMENT DELETES THE LABOR PROTECTION PROVISION ENTIRELY, AND STATES THAT "IT IS THE POLICY OF THE UNITED STATES NOT TO APPROVE EMPLOYEE PROTECTION PROGRAMS."

TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE SECTION OF S. 2493 THAT AUTHORIZES THE SECRETARY OF LABOR TO INITIATE A PROGRAM TO COMPENSATE THE AIRLINE EMPLOYEES THAT LOSE THEIR JOBS OR FACE SALARY CUTS AS A RESULT OF THIS LEGISLATION.  THE ZORINSKY AMENDMENT STRIKES THIS LABOR PROTECTION PROVISION AND REPLACES IT WITH A PROVISION REQUIRING THAT PROTECTED EMPLOYEES BE GIVEN A HIRING PRIORITY BY OTHER AIR CARRIERS, INSTEAD OF COMPENSATION.

TO AMEND S. 2493 BY REQUIRING THE CIVIL AERONAUTICS BOARD TO AUTHORIZE ANY NEW AIR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE UNLESS THEY DETERMINE THAT THE SERVICE WILL NOT BE "CONSISTENT WITH THE PUBLIC CONVENIENCE AND NECESSITY."
TO AMEND S. 2493 SO THAT AIR CARRIERS THAT PROVIDE INTERSTATE TRANSPORTATION WILL BE SUBJECT TO FEDERAL RATHER THAN STATE REGULATION FOR THE ENTIRETY OF THEIR OPERATIONS.
TO PASS S. 2493.
TO PASS S. 1566, THE BILL REQUIRING THAT A COURT ORDER MUST BE ACQUIRED PRIOR TO THE USE OF ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE TO OBTAIN FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE INFORMATION.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 2777, THE BILL ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL CONSUMER COOPERATIVE BANK.  THE TOWER SUBSTITUTE PROVIDES FOR A TWO-YEAR STUDY OF CONSUMER COOPERATIVES BY A FEDERAL INTERAGENCY TASK FORCE, AND PROVIDES FOR A PILOT LENDING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM FOR CONSUMER COOPERATIVES.
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 512, A RESOLUTION EXPRESSING THE SENATE'S SUPPORT OF THE NOMINATION OF THE HELSINKI WATCH GROUPS FOR THE NOBEL PEACE PRIZE TO BE AWARDED ON DECEMBER 10, 1978.

TO AMEND H.R. 2777 BY PROVIDING THAT PRIOR TO MAKING ANY LOAN, THE NATIONAL CONSUMER COOPERATIVE BANK MUST DETERMINE THAT THE LOAN WILL NOT HAVE AN ADVERSE ECONOMIC OR COMPETITIVE IMPACT ON SMALL BUSINESSES IN THE MARKET AREA SERVED BY THE BORROWER.
TO AMEND H.R. 2777 BY PROHIBITING THE NATIONAL CONSUMER COOPERATIVE BANK FROM MAKING A LOAN UNLESS THE BORROWER HAS BEEN REFUSED CREDIT TWICE BEFORE.
TO AMEND H.R. 2777 BY INCREASING THE PERCENTAGE OF LOANS FOR LOW INCOME GROUPS FROM 35% TO 50% OF THE TOTAL LOANS AWARDED BY THE NATIONAL CONSUMER COOPERATIVE BANK.
TO PASS H.R. 2777.

TO AMEND H.R. 11003, THE BILL AUTHORIZING NEW CEILINGS ON THE APPOINTMENT AND PAYMENT OF THE PRESIDENT'S WHITE HOUSE STAFF, BY PLACING A $20 MILLION CEILING ON THE AUTHORIZATION FOR TRAVEL, ENTERTAINMENT, AND OTHER OFFICIAL EXPENSES OF THE PRESIDENT.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF MILTON D. STEWART OF NEW YORK TO BE CHIEF COUNSEL FOR ADVOCACY OF THE SMALL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5146, THE BILL ENCOURAGING INCREASED USE OF COAL AS FUEL FOR ELECTRIC GENERATING FACILITES AND MAJOR INSTALLATIONS.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 2899, THE BILL ESTABLISHING AN ENDANGERED SPECIES INTERAGENCY COMMITTEE TO CLARIFY AND RESOLVE CONFLICTS BETWEEN FEDERAL PROJECTS AND LAWS PROTECTING ENDANGERED SPECIES.  THE STENNIS AMENDMENT WOULD EXEMPT FROM THE ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT OF 1973 ANY FEDERAL PROJECT FOR WHICH CONSTRUCTION FUNDS HAD BEEN APPROPRIATED AS OF THE DATE OF ENACTMENT OF THAT ACT, AND ANY PROJECT THAT HAD ALREADY EXPENDED 50% OF ITS AUTHORIZED FUNDS.
TO AMEND S. 2899 BY REQUIRING THAT THIS LEGISLATION BE "CONSISTENT WITH THE WELFARE AND NATIONAL GOALS OF THE PEOPLE OF THE UNITED STATES."

TO AMEND S. 2899 BY CHANGING THE DEFINITION OF AN "ENDANGERED SPECIES" TO MEAN A SPECIES THAT IS LIKELY TO BECOME ENDANGERED IN WHOLE OR IN PART WITHIN THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE, AND WHICH THE SECRETARY HAS DETERMINED TO BE OF SUBSTANTIAL BENEFIT TO MANKIND.

TO AMEND S. 2899 BY EXEMPTING ANY FEDERAL PROJECT FOR WHICH A "SUBSTANTIAL AND IRRETRIEVABLE COMMITMENT OF RESOURCES" WAS MADE PRIOR TO THE DISCOVERY OF POSSIBLE ADVERSE EFFECTS OF THE PROJECT TO AN ENDANGERED SPECIES.
TO AMEND S. 2899 BY REQUIRING A MAJORITY VOTE OF FOUR INSTEAD OF FIVE OF THE SEVEN MEMBERS OF THE ENDANGERED SPECIES INTERAGENCY COMMITTEE IN ORDER TO GRANT AN EXEMPTION.
TO PASS S. 2899.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO THE MODIFIED CHILES AMENDMENT (SEE RC 227) TO S. 3084, THE BILL AMENDING AND EXTENDING CERTAIN FEDERAL LAWS RELATING TO HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS.  THE MODIFIED MORGAN AMENDMENT INCREASES SOME OF THE AUTHORIZATION LEVELS CALLED FOR IN THE CHILES AMENDMENT.

TO AMEND S. 3084 BY REDUCING THE AUTHORIZATION LEVELS FOR A VARIETY OF HOUSING ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TO THE LEVELS ORIGINALLY REQUESTED BY THE PRESIDENT AND TARGETED IN THE FIRST BUDGET RESOLUTION FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO AMEND S. 3084 BY ALLOWING CITIES AND URBAN COUNTIES THAT CONTAIN AREAS OF SEVERE ECONOMIC AND PHYSICAL DISTRESS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE URBAN DEVELOPMENT ACTION GRANT PROGRAM OF THE DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT (HUD).
TO TABLE THE TOWER MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH TOWER AMENDMENT #3248 TO S. 3084 (SEE RC 228) WAS AGREED TO.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE CHILES AMENDMENT (SEE RC 231) TO S. 3084.  THE SCHMITT SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT WOULD REQUIRE HUD TO PUBLISH IN THE FEDERAL REGISTER AN ECONOMIC IMPACT ANALYSIS FOR EACH PROPOSED REGULATION.

TO AMEND S. 3084 BY REQUIRING THE SECRETARY OF HUD TO PUBLISH ANNUALLY IN THE FEDERAL REGISTER A TENTATIVE AGENDA OF EXPECTED DEPARTMENT REGULATIONS FOR THAT YEAR. THE CHILES AMENDMENT ALSO STATES THAT PRIOR TO PUBLISHING A PROPOSED REGULATION, THE SECRETARY OF HUD MUST ANALYZE ITS RELATIVE COSTS IN TERMS OF PAPERWORK, AND ITS RELATIVE BENEFITS.
TO AMEND S. 3084 BY PROVIDING FOR A ONE-HOUSE VETO OF ANY REGULATION PROMULGATED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT.

TO AMEND S. 3084 BY CLARIFYING THE MEANING OF THE PHRASE "EXPECTED TO RESIDE IN THE COMMUNITY" AS CONTAINED IN THE HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ACT OF 1974.  THE GRIFFIN AMENDMENT INTERPRETS THIS PHRASE TO MEAN "THOSE PERSONS EXPECTED BY THE COMMUNITY TO RESIDE IN THAT COMMUNITY REGARDLESS OF WHETHER THE APPLICANT IS OR IS NOT AWARDED FUNDING UNDER THIS ACT."
TO PASS S. 3084.
TO PASS S. 2534, THE BILL EXTENDING THE HEALTH MAINTENENCE ORGANIZATION PROGRAMS FUNDED UNDER TITLE XIII OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE ACT FOR AN ADDITIONAL SIX YEARS, THROUGH FISCAL YEAR 1984.
TO PASS S. 3085, THE BILL EXTENDING THE FEDERAL CHILD CARE FOOD PROGRAM AND THE SPECIAL SUPPLEMENTAL FOOD PROGRAM (WIC) THROUGH FISCAL YEAR 1982.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 2850, THE BILL AMENDING THE OLDER AMERICANS ACT OF 1965 AND EXTENDING ITS AUTHORIZATIONS FOR AN ADDITIONAL TWO YEARS, THROUGH FISCAL YEAR 1980.  THE MODIFIED MELCHER AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE COMMISSIONER ON AGING TO REIMBURSE ANY STATE FOR UP TO 5% OF ITS MODEL PROJECT FUNDS IF THAT STATE HAD USED SUCH FUNDS FOR THE DELIVERY OF SOCIAL SERVICES DURING A FEDERALLY DECLARED MAJOR DISASTER.
TO TABLE THE MODIFIED KENNEDY AMENDMENT #2499 (SEE RC 239) TO S. 2850.
TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 2850 THAT PROVIDES FOR A SEPARATE AUTHORIZATION OF $100 MILLION IN FISCAL YEAR 1979 AND $120 MILLION IN FISCAL YEAR 1980 FOR HOME-DELIVERED MEAL SERVICES.

TO AMEND S. 2850 BY REQUIRING THAT UP TO 1% OF THE NEW AUTHORIZATIONS BE USED TO FUND DEMONSTRATION PROJECTS DESIGNED TO EASE THE TRANSITION OF SENIOR CITIZENS FROM PUBLIC SERVICE JOBS TO PRIVATE SECTOR JOBS.

TO AMEND S. 2850 BY CLARIFYING AND STRENGTHENING CERTAIN PROVISIONS RELATED TO THE DETERMINATION OF THE FEDERAL SHARE IN THE COMMUNITY SERVICES EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM AND IN CERTAIN INDIAN PROGRAMS.  THE EAGLETON AMENDMENT ALSO MAKES CHANGES IN CERTAIN NUTRITION PROGRAMS AND BENEFITS PROGRAMS.

TO AGREE TO AN AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR DOMENICI AMENDMENT #1485 TO S. 2850.  THE JAVITS AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE USE OF 0.5% OF THE TITLE III AUTHORIZATION OR UP TO $5 MILLION FOR PAYMENT OF THE "EXCESS COSTS" OF PROVIDING SERVICES TO ELDERLY PEOPLE LIVING IN RURAL AREAS.  THE MODIFIED DOMENICI AMENDMENT #1485 ALTERS THE FORMULA FOR DISTRIBUTING TITLE III FUNDS SO AS TO PROVIDE GREATER AID TO STATES THAT MUST PROVIDE SERVICES TO OLDER AMERICANS LIVING IN RURAL AREAS.
TO PASS H.R. 12255, AFTER STRIKING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND SUBSTITUTING IN LIEU THEREOF THE TEXT OF S. 2850.

TO MODIFY THE SPARKMAN AMENDMENT TO S. 3075, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR INTERNATIONAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.  THE MODIFYING BYRD (WV AMENDMENT OUTLINES U.S. POLICIES TOWARDS CYPRUS, GREECE AND TURKEY IN THE EVENT OF LIFTING THE ARMS EMBARGO AGAINST TURKEY.  THE SPARKMAN AMENDMENT REPEALS THE LIMITED EMBARGO ON ARMS SALES TO TURKEY.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 3075, AN AMENDMENT THAT STATES THE SENSE OF THE SENATE THAT IT SHOULD BE CONSULTED PRIOR TO THE ADOPTION OF ANY NEW POLICY THAT WOULD AFFECT THE CONTINUATION OF THE UNITED STATES-REPUBLIC OF CHINA MUTUAL DEFENSE TREATY OF 1954.
TO TABLE THE CASE AMENDMENT #1505 (SEE RC 247) TO HAYAKAWA AMENDMENT #1504 (SEE RC 249) TO S. 3075.

TO MODIFY HAYAKAWA AMENDMENT #1504 (SEE RC 249) TO S. 3075. THE MODIFYING CASE AMENDMENT WILL LIFT U.S. SANCTIONS AGAINST RHODESIA AS SOON AS THERE HAVE BEEN FREE ELECTIONS FOR A NEW RHODESIAN GOVERNMENT.
TO MODIFY THE AMENDED HAYAKAWA AMENDMENT #1504 (SEE RC 249) TO S. 3075 BY LIFTING U.S. SANCTIONS AGAINST RHODESIA FROM OCTOBER 1, 1978 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 1978.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 3075 THAT WILL LIFT U.S. SANCTIONS AGAINST RHODESIA AS SOON AS THE PRESIDENT OF THE U.S. HAS DETERMINED THAT THE GOVERNMENT OF RHODESIA HAS COMMITTED ITSELF TO AN "ALL-PARTIES" CONFERENCE TO BE HELD UNDER INTERNATIONAL AUSPICES, AND AS SOON AS IT IS INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED THAT FREE ELECTIONS FOR A NEW RHODESIAN GOVERNMENT HAVE BEEN HELD.  THE ORIGINAL HAYAKAWA AMENDMENT PROHIBITS THE USE OF THESE FUNDS TO ASSIST ANY COUNTRY ENGAGED IN CIVIL WAR "UNLESS SUCH ASSISTANCE IS FURNISHED TO AL          NDING FORCES IN SUCH WAR."
TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 3075 THAT REDUCES THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR ASSISTANCE TO SOUTHERN AFRICA BY $40 MILLION.

TO TABLE THE BAKER AMENDMENT #1513 TO S. 3075.  BAKER AMENDMENT #1513 STRIKES LANGUAGE IN PRESENT LAW THAT REQUIRES THE SECRETARY OF STATE TO AUTOMATICALLY RECOMMEND APPROVAL OF ANY APPLICATION FOR A NONIMMIGRANT VISA THAT HAS BEEN SUBMITTED BY A MEMBER OF A COMMUNIST ORGANIZATION WHO WISHES TO ENTER THE UNITED STATES.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 3075 THAT EXPRESSES THE SENSE OF THE CONGRESS THAT IT SHOULD BE CONSULTED PRIOR TO THE FURTHER WITHDRAWAL OF TROOPS FROM SOUTH KOREA BECAUSE SUCH ACTION MAY SERIOUSLY UPSET THE "MILITARY BALANCE IN THAT REGION."

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO S. 3075 THAT EXPRESSES THE SENSE OF CONGRESS THAT THE UNITED STATES SHOULD CONTINUE TO PROMOTE DIRECT NEGOTIATIONS BETWEEN EGYPT AND ISRAEL, AND THAT THE U.S. SHOULD CONTINUE TO SELL ADVANCED MILITARY AIRCRAFT TO ISRAEL.
TO PASS S. 3075.

TO TABLE DIVISION 1 OF THE HUDDLESTON AMENDMENT #3098 TO S. 2410, THE BILL AMENDING TITLES XV AND XVI OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE ACT AND EXTENDING AUTHORIZATIONS THROUGH FISCAL YEAR 1981 FOR PROGRAMS FUNDED UNDER THE ACT. DIVISION 1 OF THE HUDDLESTON AMENDMENT GIVES THE SEPARATE STATES THE RIGHT TO EXTEND THE CERTIFICATES OF NEED OPTION TO NONINSTITUTIONAL PRIVATE OFFICES AT THEIR OWN DISCRETION.

TO TABLE DIVISION 2 OF THE HUDDLESTON AMENDMENT #3098 TO S. 2410.  DIVISION 2 OF THE HUDDLESTON AMENDMENT ALLOWS COVERAGE OF HEALTH MAINTENANCE ORGANIZATIONS UNDER THE CERTIFICATE OF NEED OPTION, BUT EXCLUDES COVERAGE OF ANY GROUP HEALTH PRACTICES.
TO TABLE THE JAVITS MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE KENNEDY MOTION TO TABLE DIVISION 2 OF THE HUDDLESTON AMENDMENT #3098 WAS AGREED TO (SEE RC 256).
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 12426, THE BILL AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO PROVIDE LONG-TERM LOAN GUARANTEES TO THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
TO PASS S. 2820, THE BILL GIVING THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR PERMANENT AUTHORITY TO TAKE ACTIONS TO ENSURE SAFETY OF DAMS UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION.

TO TABLE THE CHURCH AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE WEICKER AMENDMENT (SEE RC 261) TO S. 2152, THE BILL AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR U.S. PARTICIPATION IN THE SO-CALLED WITTEVEEN FINANCING FACILITY OF THE INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND.  THE CHURCH SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT URGES THE PRESIDENT TO ENCOURAGE AND SUPPORT INTERNATIONAL EFFORT TO INVESTIGATE AND RESPOND TO CONDITIONS IN UGANDA, INCLUDING ECONOMIC RESTRICTIONS.
TO AMEND S. 2152 BY IMPOSING A TRADE EMBARGO ON UGANDA UNTIL THE PRESIDENT CERTIFIES TO CONGRESS THAT THAT GOVERNMENT IS NO LONGER COMMITTING GROSS VIOLATIONS OF HUMAN RIGHTS.

TO AMEND S. 2152 BY REQUIRING THAT ANY PARTICIPATION BY THE U.S. IN THE SO-CALLED WITTEVEEN FINANCING FACILITY OF THE INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND BE SUBJECT TO THE APPROPRIATION OF ANY FUNDS AUTHORIZED FOR SUCH PURPOSE.
TO PASS H.R. 10173, THE BILL INCREASING THE PENSION OF NON-SERVICE CONNECTED DISABLED VETERANS.

TO TABLE THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT TO S. 2152.  THE ABOUREZK AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT NO WITTEVEEN FACILITY TRANSACTION SHALL CONTRIBUTE TO THE DEPRIVATION OF THE HUMAN RIGHTS OF THE CITIZENS OF A BORROWING NATION.

TO TABLE THE DOLE AMENDMENT TO S. 2152.  THE DOLE AMENDMENT INSTRUCTS THE U.S. DIRECTOR OF THE WITTEVEEN FACILITY TO OPPOSE LOANS TO CAMBODIA AND UGANDA UNLESS THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES DETERMINES THAT THESE COUNTRIES ARE RECOGNIZING HUMAN RIGHTS.
TO AMEND S. 2152 BY RESTRICTING THE AVERAGE SALARY LEVELS OF IMF PERSONNEL TO NO MORE THAN 5% ABOVE THE SALARIES OF COMPARABLE U.S. CIVIL SERVICE POSITIONS.
TO TABLE THE HELMS AMENDMENT TO S. 2152.  THE HELMS AMENDMENT INSTRUCTS THE U.S. DIRECTOR OF THE WITTEVEEN FACILITY TO OPPOSE LOANS TO NATIONS PROVIDING AID TO INTERNATIONAL TERRORISTS.
TO TABLE THE HELMS AMENDMENT TO S. 2152 THAT WOULD LIMIT U.S. PARTICIPATION IN THE WITTEVEEN FACILITY TO FIVE YEARS.

TO AGREE TO THE CHURCH AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE MCCLURE AMENDMENT TO S. 2152.  THE MCCLURE AMENDMENT DEFINES THE TERM "HUMAN RIGHTS" TO INCLUDE FREE ELECTIONS, RULE BY LAW, INDIVIDUAL FREEDOMS AND MINORITY RIGHTS.  THE CHURCH SUBSTITUTE THERETO REQUIRES AN ANNUAL REPORT TO CONGRESS FROM THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY ON THE OBSERVANCE OF INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED HUMAN RIGHTS IN NATIONS RECEIVING FUNDS FROM THE WITTEVEEN FACILITY.
TO AMEND S. 2152 BY REQUIRING A BALANCED FEDERAL BUDGET BEGINNING IN FISCAL YEAR 1981.
TO PASS H.R. 9214, AFTER STRIKING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND INSERTING IN LIEU THEREOF THE TEXT OF S. 2152.
TO PASS S. 3243, THE BILL AUTHORIZING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEARS 1978 AND 1979 TO COVER THE ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES OF CERTAIN PROGRAMS OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ADMINISTRATION.

TO AMEND S. 2788, THE BILL AUTHORIZING THE PURCHASE OF AN ADDITIONAL $1.2 BILLION OF THE SERIES A PREFERRED STOCK OF CONRAIL, BY AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR THE REPAIR OF A RAILROAD BRIDGE IN POUGHKEEPSIE, NEW YORK.

TO TABLE THE BARTLETT AMENDMENT TO H.R. 11445, THE BILL AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979 FOR PROGRAMS OF THE SMALL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION.  THE BARTLETT AMENDMENT EXEMPTS FROM THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE 1970 OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ACT THOSE BUSINESSES EMPLOYING TEN OR FEWER PERSONS.

TO AMEND H.R. 11445, THE BILL AUTHORIZING FUNDS FOR PROGRAMS OF THE SMALL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979, BY DELETING LANGUAGE AUTHORIZING THE GOVERNMENT TO SUBSIDIZE THE INTEREST RATE PAID ON SMALL BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION DISASTER LOANS.
TO PASS H.R. 13385, THE BILL INCREASING THE TEMPORARY PUBLIC DEBT LIMIT.
TO AMEND H.R. 12927, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979 FOR MILITARY CONSTRUCTION, BY REDUCING ALL APPROPRIATIONS THEREIN BY 2%.
TO PASS H.R. 12927, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979 FOR MILITARY CONSTRUCTION.

TO TABLE THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12934, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1979 FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF STATE, JUSTICE, COMMERCE AND THE JUDICIARY.  THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT WOULD INCREASE THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR POSITIONS IN THE CRIMINAL DIVISION OF THE JUSTICE DEPARTMENT.
TO TABLE THE ROTH AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12934.  THE ROTH AMENDMENT WOULD REDUCE ALL FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN THE BILL BY 2%.

TO AGREE TO DIVISION 1 OF AN AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE ROTH AMENDMENT (SEE RC 280) TO H.R. 12934.  DIVISION 1 OF THE HOLLINGS AMENDMENT MAKES A $26.1 MILLION REDUCTION IN THE FUNDING FOR VARIOUS PROGRAMS IN THE BILL.

TO AGREE TO DIVISION 2 OF AN AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE ROTH AMENDMENNT (SEE RC 280) TO H.R. 12934.  DIVISION 2 OF THE HOLLINGS AMENDMENT REDUCES THE FUNDS FOR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS BY $150 MILLION.
TO PASS H.R. 12934.

TO TABLE THE CHAFEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13467, THE BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1978. THE CHAFEE AMENDMENT RESCINDS $54 MILLION APPROPRIATED FOR CONSTRUCTION OF THE HART SENATE OFFICE BUILDING.
TO TABLE THE BUMPERS AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13467, AN AMENDMENT THAT APPROPRIATES $8.2 MILLION FOR AN INFLUENZA VACCINATION PROGRAM.
TO AMEND H.R. 13467 BY APPROPRIATING AN ADDITIONAL $54.8 MILLION FOR THE NEW SENATE OFFICE BUILDING AND IMPOSING A CEILING OF $135 MILLION ON EXPENDITURES FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE BUILDING.
TO AGREE TO A COMMITTEE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12935, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1979 FOR THE LEGISLATIVE BRANCH, BY PROVIDING FOR AN OVERALL 5% REDUCTION OF FUNDING IN THE BILL.
TO PASS H.R. 13467.
TO PASS H.R. 12935, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATIVE BRANCH FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO AMEND H.R. 12936, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT AND CERTAIN INDEPENDENT AGENCIES FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.  THE MORGAN AMENDMENT INCREASES THE APPROPRIATION FOR REGISTRATION UNDER THE SELECTIVE SERVICE ACT FROM $7 MILLION TO $17 MILLION.
TO AMEND H.R. 12936 BY INCREASING FROM $7 MILLION TO $9.5 MILLION THE APPROPRIATION FOR REGISTRATION UNDER THE SELECTIVE SERVICE ACT.
TO AMEND H.R. 12936 BY REDUCING THE FUNDING FOR CERTAIN PROGRAMS WITHIN HUD, THE EPA, NASA AND NSF BY A TOTAL OF $810 MILLION.
TO AMEND H.R. 12936 BY REDUCING BY 2% ALL APPROPRIATIONS CONTAINED IN THE BILL EXCEPT FOR THE FUNDING REQUIRED BY LAW.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE PROXMIRE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12936 (SEE RC 292) WAS REJECTED.
UPON RECONSIDERATION, TO AGREE TO THE PROXMIRE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12936 (SEE RC 292).
TO TABLE THE METZENBAUM MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE PROXMIRE AMENDMENT (SEE RC 292) TO H.R. 12936 WAS AGREED TO (SEE RC 295).
TO PASS H.R. 12936.

TO RULE ON THE GERMANENESS OF THE CANNON AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12932, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR AND RELATED AGENCIES FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979. THE CANNON AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT, NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF THE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT, CONSTRUCTION MAY CONTINUE ON THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER STORAGE PROJECTS, CENTRAL ARIZONA PROJECT AND THE SOUTHERN NEVADA WATER PROJECT IF A FINAL ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENT HAS BEEN FILED IN CONNECTION WITH SUCH PROJECTS.
TO TABLE THE METZENABUM MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE DIVISION VOTE BY WHICH THE CANNON AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12932 (SEE RC 298) WAS AGREED TO.
TO TABLE THE ROTH AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12932, AN AMENDMENT PROVIDING FOR A 2% REDUCTION IN FUNDING FOR NUMEROUS ITEMS IN THE BILL.

TO PASS S. 2466, A BILL EXTENDING PROGRAMS FOR HEALTH SERVICES RESEARCH AND CREATING AN OFFICE OF HEALTH TECHNOLOGY.  (THIS BILL WAS PASSED AFTER RECONSIDERATION OF THE VOTE BY WHICH IT FAILED TO PASS ON JUNE 26.  SEE RC 174.)
TO RULE ON THE GERMANENESS OF A JOHNSTON AMENDMENT (SEE RC 303) TO H.R. 12932.

TO AMEND H.R. 12932 BY LIMITING THE USE OF FUNDS TO IMPLEMENT REGULATIONS PROVIDING FOR AN INCREASE IN ENTITLEMENT SUBSIDY FOR REFINED PETROLEUM IMPORTS UNLESS CERTAIN CHANGES ARE MADE TO SUCH REGULATIONS, INCLUDING ONE THAT WOULD INCREASE THE RATE OF ENTITLEMENT FROM 30% TO 50%.
TO PASS H.R. 12932.

TO AMEND H.R. 13125, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND RELATED AGENCIES FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.  THE MELCHER AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $20 MILLION TO CARRY OUT ANIMAL HEALTH AND DISEASE RESEARCH PROGRAMS.
TO AMEND H.R. 13125 BY DELETING $1.6 MILLION FROM THE FUNDS FOR THE ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES OF THE OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY.
TO AMEND H.R. 13125 BY APPROPRIATING AN ADDITIONAL $105 MILLION FOR AGRICULTURAL CONSERVATION PROGRAMS.
TO TABLE THE WEICKER AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13125, AN AMENDMENT BARRING USE OF FUNDS UNDER THE AGRICULTURAL TRADE DEVELOPMENT AND ASSISTANCE ACT FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO KOREA.
TO AMEND H.R. 13125 BY REDUCING THE FUNDING FOR THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM BY $250 MILLION.
TO AMEND H.R. 13125 BY REDUCING FUNDS IN FIFTEEN DIFFERENT SECTIONS OF THE BILL FOR A TOTAL OVERALL REDUCTION OF $126.5 MILLION.
TO AMEND H.R. 13125 BY REDUCING THE FUNDING FOR THE FOOD STAMP PROGRAM BY $2 BILLION.
TO PASS H.R. 13125.
TO PASS H.R. 12928, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR PUBLIC WORKS FOR WATER AND POWER DEVELOPMENT AND FOR ENERGY RESEARCH FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.
TO AMEND H.R. 12050, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR A FEDERAL INCOME TAX CREDIT FOR TUITION, BY ESTABLISHING AN INCOME TAX CREDIT FOR RESIDENTIAL PROPERTY TAXES PAID FOR THE SUPPORT OF PUBLIC SCHOOLS.
TO AMEND H.R. 12050 BY ADDING TO THE PREAMBLE OF THE BILL A RECOGNITION OF THE IMPORTANCE OF THE EXISTENCE OF DIVERSE PUBLIC AND NONPUBLIC EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS OF HIGH QUALITY.
TO AMEND H.R. 12050 BY CLARIFYING THAT ONLY THE SUPREME COURT MAY DETERMINE THE CONSTITUTIONALITY OF THE PROVISIONS IN THE BILL.
TO TABLE THE HOLLINGS AMENDMENT (SEE RC 318) TO H.R. 12050.
TO AMEND H.R. 12050 BY LIMITING THE TAX CREDIT FOR TUITION TO POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION.
TO AMEND H.R. 12050 BY PROVIDING FOR A PHASE-OUT OF THE TAX CREDIT FOR HIGHER EDUCATION AS THE FAMILY'S ADJUSTED GROSS INCOME EXCEEDS $30,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 12050 BY INCREASING PARTICIPATION BY PRIVATE SCHOOL CHILDREN IN PROGRAMS FUNDED UNDER TITLES I AND IV OF THE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION ACT.

TO SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE PROPOSED LONG AMENDMENT #1658 TO H.R. 12050 WAS OUT OF ORDER ON THE GROUNDS THAT IT CALLED FOR SPENDING AUTHORITY UNAUTHORIZED BY LAW. AMENDMENT #1658 CALLS FOR THE REFUNDING OF TUITION TAX CREDITS IN EXCESS OF WHAT IS OWED IN TAXES, THEREBY BENEFITTING PERSONS PAYING LOW INCOME TAXES.

TO WAIVE SECTION 303(B) OF THE CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET ACT IN ORDER THAT THE SENATE MAY CONSIDER LONG AMENDMENT #1660, AN AMENDMENT SIMILAR TO LONG AMENDMENT #1658 WHICH WAS RULED OUT OF ORDER (SEE RC 321).

TO TABLE THE PELL MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE SENATE PASSED S. 2539, THE BILL IMPROVING THE BASIC EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANTS PROGRAM UNDER THE HIGHER EDUCATION ACT.

TO TABLE AN APPEAL FROM THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE MOTION TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF H. J. RES. 554 WAS IN ORDER.  H. J. RES. 554 IS THE BILL PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE U.S. CONSTITUTION THAT WOULD PROVIDE FOR THE REPRESENTATION OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA IN CONGRESS.
TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF H. J. RES. 554.
TO TABLE THE CURTIS AMENDMENT TO H. J. RES. 554, AN AMENDMENT REQUIRING THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO TERMINATE DEFICIT FINANCING.

TO TABLE THE MELCHER AMENDMENT TO H. J. RES. 554, AN AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT FOR THE PURPOSES OF REPRESENTATION THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA SHALL BE TREATED AS A STATE IN THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES AND AS A PART OF MARYLAND IN THE SENATE.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON HR. 13468, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO AGREE TO A MODIFIED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13511 THAT PROVIDES FOR TUITION TAX CREDITS AND FOR A $4.5 BILLION INCREASE IN THE PROPOSED TAX CUT FOR 1979. (SEE RC 452
TO AMEND H.R. 13511 BY STRIKING AN AUTHORIZATION OF $508 MILLION FOR FISCAL RELIEF TO THE STATES.
TO TABLE THE GRIFFIN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13511, AN AMENDMENT THAT PROVIDES FOR COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS IN TAX RATES FOR A FOUR-YEAR PERIOD BEGINNING IN 1980.
TO AGREE TO DIVISION 1 OF AMENDMENT #2001 TO H.R. 13511. DIVISION 1 OF THIS AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR A MODERATE REDUCTION OF CORPORATE TAX RATES.
TO AGREE TO DIVISION 2 OF AMENDMENT #2001 TO H.R. 13511. DIVISION 2 OF THE AMENDMENT REPEALS THE SPECIAL TAX BREAKS FOR DOMESTIC INTERNATIONAL SALES CORPORATIONS.

TO TABLE GLENN AMENDMENT #3681 TO MUSKIE AMENDMENT #3678 TO H.R. 13511.  THE GLENN "SUNSET" AMENDMENT REQUIRES THAT ALL TAX EXPENDITURE PROVISIONS OF THE LAW MUST BE REVIEWED ONCE EVERY TEN YEARS.  THE MUSKIE "SUNSET" AMENDMENT REQUIRES THAT ALMOST ALL FEDERAL PROGRAMS MUST BE REVIEWED AND REAUTHORIZED AT LEAST ONCE EVERY TEN YEARS.

TO CONCUR IN THE HOUSE SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT FOR THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7843, THE BILL PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINTMENT OF ADDITIONAL DISTRICT AND CIRCUIT COURT JUDGES. THE ORIGINAL SENATE AMENDMENT RECOMMENDED THAT THE FIFTH CIRCUIT BE SPLIT INTO TWO SEPARATE CIRCUITS, WHEREAS THE APPROVED HOUSE SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT DOES NOT PROVIDE FOR THE SPLITTING OF THE FIFTH CIRCUIT.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 12932, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.
TO AMEND H.R. 13511 BY PROVIDING THAT A 10% INVESTMENT CREDIT SHALL BE AVAILABLE FOR PERSONS REHABILITATING PROPERTIES THAT ARE AT LEAST 20 YEARS OLD.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #3890 TO H.R. 13511, AN AMENDMENT THAT PHASES IN, OVER A THREE-YEAR PERIOD, A PROVISION THAT ULTIMATELY ALLOWS ONLY 50% OF THE COST OF BUSINESS MEALS TO BE USED FOR TAX REDUCTIONS.

TO TABLE THE CHURCH AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13511, AN AMENDMENT THAT WOULD GRADUALLY REPEAL THE CURRENT LAW THAT ALLOWS U.S. CORPORATIONS TO DEFER THEIR TAXES PAYABLE ON FOREIGN EARNINGS UNTIL SUCH TIME THAT THEIR PROFITS ARE REPATRIATED.

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE HEINZ AMENDMENT #4078 TO H.R. 13511 IS OUT OF ORDER BECAUSE IT WOULD CAUSE U.S. REVENUES TO BE LESS THAN THE APPROPRIATE LEVEL OF REVENUES SET FORTH IN THE SECOND CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE FEDERAL BUDGET.  HEINZ AMENDMENT #4078 PROVIDES FOR A $75 REFUNDABLE TAX CREDIT FOR THE ELDERLY FOR ENERGY-RELATED EXPENSES.

TO INVOKE CLOTURE ON THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT OFFERED IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 13511.  (BY PRIOR AGREEMENT, THE SENATE HAS BEEN TREATING THE TEXT OF THE COMMITTEE SUBSTITUTE AS THE ORIGINAL TEXT AND HAS USED IT FOR PURPOSES OF AMENDMENT.)
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4018, THE BILL SUSPENDING THE DUTY ON CERTAIN DOXORUBICIN HYDROCHLORIDE ANTIBIOTICS AND ENCOURAGING ENERGY CONSERVATION IN UTILITY SYSTEMS.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5037, THE BILL ESTABLISHING A COMPREHENSIVE NATIONAL ENERGY CONSERVATION POLICY.

TO AMEND H.R. 13511 BY AUTHORIZING ACROSS-THE-BOARD TAX REDUCTIONS OF APPROXIMATELY 5% FOR FISCAL YEARS 1979 THROUGH 1983, PROVIDED THAT THE RATE OF GROWTH OF NATIONAL OUTLAYS DOES NOT EXCEED 1%, AND PROVIDED THAT A BALANCED BUDGET IS ACHEIVED BY THE END OF FISCAL YEAR 1982.
TO TABLE DANFORTH AMENDMENT #4054 TO H.R. 13511.  THE DANFORTH AMENDMENT AUTHORIZES THE REDUCTION OF THE CORPORATE TAX RATE TO 46% IN 1979 AND 1980, AND 44% IN 1981 AND 1982.
TO AMEND H.R. 13511 SO THAT BUSINESSES OF ALL SIZES MAY ELECT TO USE A THREE-YEAR STRAIGHT-LINE METHOD ON THE FIRST $25,000 OF MACHINERY OR EQUIPMENT PURCHASED EACH YEAR.
TO AMEND H.R. 13511 BY REDUCING THE CORPORATE TAX RATE TO 46% IN 1979, 45% IN 1980 AND 44% IN 1981.
TO AMEND H.R. 13511 SO THAT HOMEOWNERS WHO ARE 55 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER OR DISABLED WILL BE ELIGIBLE FOR A ONE-TIME $100,000 EXCLUSION OF GAIN FROM THE SALE OR EXCHANGE OF THEIR PRINCIPAL RESIDENCES.
TO AMEND H.R. 13511 BY REDUCING THE 70% EXCLUSION RATE FOR CAPITAL GAINS TO 50%.

TO TABLE KENNEDY AMENDMENT #4127 TO H.R. 13511.  KENNEDY AMENDMENT #4127 REDUCES THE BUSINESS REDUCTION FOR AIRFARE THAT IS ABOVE THE COACH FARE, ELIMINATES THE BUSINESS DEDUCTION FOR ENTERTAINMENT EXPENSES, AND DISALLOWS THE USE OF THE BUSINESS DEDUCTION FOR MEALS THAT COST MORE THAN $25 PER PERSON.

TO TABLE GLENN AMENDMENT #4153 TO H.R. 13511, AN AMENDMENT THAT REQUIRES THAT THE TAX EXPENDITURES IN THE PENDING BILL BE PERIODICALLY REVIEWED ACCORDING TO A SCHEDULE TO BE WRITTEN DURING THE 96TH CONGRESS.

THAT THE SENATE SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT THE HELMS AMENDMENT #3850 TO H.R. 13511 IS OUT OF ORDER ON THE GROUNDS THAT IT VIOLATES SECTION 311 OF THE CONGRESSIONAL BUDGET ACT.  SECTION 311 PROHIBITS PASSAGE OF ANY PROVISION THAT WOULD CAUSE U.S. REVENUES TO BE LESS THAN THE APPROPRIATE LEVEL OF REVENUES SET FORTH IN THE ANNUAL CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE FEDERAL BUDGET.   HELMS AMENDMENT #3850 PRESERVES THE TAX DEDUCTION FOR STATE AND LOCAL GASOLINE TAXES.
TO TABLE THE HELMS MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE SENATE SUSTAINED THE RULING OF THE CHAIR ON HELMS AMENDMENT #3850 TO H.R. 13511.  (SEE RC 476)
TO PASS H.R. 13511.
TO PASS S. 2, THE SUNSET BILL REQUIRING A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW AND REAUTHORIZATION OF FEDERAL PROGRAMS AT LEAST ONCE EVERY TEN YEARS.
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE PROTOCOL AMENDING THE INTERNATIONAL CONVENTION FOR THE HIGH SEAS FISHERIES OF THE NORTH PACIFIC OCEAN, EXECUTIVE J, 95TH CONGRESS, SECOND SESSION.

TO TABLE A KENNEDY AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR H.R. 5285, THE MEDICARE-MEDICAID ADMINISTRATIVE REFORM ACT.  THE KENNEDY AMENDMENT BASICALLY EMBODIES THE ADMINISTRATION'S PROPOSAL FOR A PROGRAM OF HOSPITAL COST CONTAINMENT.
TO TABLE THE NELSON AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5285, AN AMENDMENT ESTABLISHING A VOLUNTARY HOSPITAL COST CONTAINMENT PROGRAM.
TO AMEND H.R. 5285 BY ELIMINATING THE "PERCENTAGE ARRANGEMENT" SYSTEM THAT IS NOW USED WIDELY TO COMPENSATE THE INCOMES OF HOSPITAL-BASED ANESTHESIOLOGISTS, PATHOLOGISTS, AND RADIOLOGISTS.

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 13635, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 12931, THE BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FOREIGN AID PROGRAMS FOR FISCAL YEAR 1979.

TO MODIFY PROXMIRE AMENDMENT #2102 TO H.R. 50, THE FULL EMPLOYMENT AND BALNCED GROWTH ACT OF 1979.  THE MUSKIE MODIFYING AMENDMENT LIMITS FEDERAL SPENDING TO A PERCENTAGE OF THE GROSS NATIONAL PRODUCT (GNP) THAT IS THE LOWEST POSSIBLE PERCENTAGE THAT IS STILL CONSISTENT WITH NATIONAL NEEDS AND PRIORITIES.  THE PROXMIRE AMENDMENT LIMITS FEDERAL SPENDING TO NO MORE THAN 21% OF THE GNP IN 1981 AND 20% OF THE GNP IN 1983.

TO AMEND H.R. 50 BY GIVING CONGRESS THE DISCRETION TO EXERCISE THE AUTHORITIES PROVIDED IN SECTION 304 OF THE BILL, RATHER THAN MAKING THEIR CONGRESSIONAL ACTION MANDATORY.  SECTION 304 AUTHORIZES CONGRESS TO SET NEW EMPLOYMENT GOALS AND DEADLINES IF THE PRESIDENT RECOMMENDS THAT THE PREVIOUSLY ESTABLISHED UNEMPLOYMENT GOALS CAN NOT BE ACHEIVED.
TO AMEND H.R. 50 BY ESTABLISHING A NATIONAL GOAL OF 3% INFLATION TO BE ACHEIVED AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE HUMPHREY AMENDMENT TO H.R. 50 WAS REJECTED.  (SEE RC 493)
TO PASS H.R. 50.
